course.subject: MATH
course.name: Calculus IB
course.description: This is an introductory course in one-variable calculus, the first in the Calculus I and II sequence, designed for students that have taken HKDSE Mathematics Extended Module M1/M2. Topics include functions and their limits, continuity, derivatives and rules of differentiation, applications of derivatives, and basic integral calculus.
course.prerequisites: Level 3 or above in HKDSE Mathematics Extended Module M1/M2
course.exclusions: AL Pure Mathematics; AL Applied Mathematics; MATH 1012, MATH 1014, MATH 1020, MATH 1023, MATH 1024

reviews.author: Alpha703
reviews.title: Universal maths course
reviews.comment_content:
Calculus. Half DSE-M2 stuff, half new things. Good luck if you are M1.
Here's a list(not complete) of non-M2 stuffs in this course:
Continuity, Differentiability, Intermediate Value Theorem, Mean Value Theorem, 'one-to-one' function, Solving problems with absolute functions, Sandwich(Squeeze) Theorem, Linear Approximation, Newton's Method, Critical Point, Rolle's Theorem, L'Hopital Rule, Reimann Sum, Fundamental Theorem of Calculus(A little more things than DSE M2)
reviews.comment_teaching:
Dr. Lam's English is clear, and he is willing to answer student's questions. However, his writes on the whiteboard in a less organised way, so it's not easy to follow. The teaching pace is slow, and he put too much time on explaining the fundamental knowledge that both M1 and M2 and even DSE Maths core should have covered, especially functions... He should have put more efforts on new topics such as L'Hopital Rule and more...

Mr. Kong's tutorial is better, at least he can demonstrate the examples clearly and remind us some important steps/tips in solving problems.

I think attending tutorial is more important than attending lecture. I skip most lectures that teaches M2 stuff.
reviews.comment_grading:
Semi-absolute grading. Much fairer than previous semesters.
15% WebWork 35% Mid-term 50% Final
Total score
85-100%-->A range
70-85%-->B range
50-70%-->C range
40-50%-->D
0-40%-->Fail
Me:
WebWork Full mark
Mid-term 90/100 (Mean: 73.43 SD:15.77)
Final 65/100 (Mean: 63.46 SD:15.37)
Total 79/100 (Mean: 71.89 SD:12.94) -->B
You can see that getting a mean will give you B-, much fairer than the past.
reviews.comment_workload:
Homework: Basically 1 WebWork(Online homework) per week, each consists of 10-18 questions. Apart from the first one you will need 2-4 hours to finish one, not very heavy workload. You can attempt questions infinitely many times , so try your best to get full marks in them!
No attendance required for any lecture and tutorials
Exam: Do your best in the relatively simple mid-term to secure a better grade earlier. All contents will appear in final exam, so don't forget to practice on evaluating limits for the final. I focused too much on integration and didn't do a single question of limits before the final, so I lose at least 9 marks on some relatively simple limit MCs, sigh~~

reviews.author: 別問我是誰
reviews.title: 全世界都要讀咁濟既爛 grade MATH course
reviews.comment_content:
我讀個年係仲未分開做 1012 同 1013，搞到1013永遠有堆無讀 M2 既 (例如我) 比人屈機。原因就係呢個course 有9成都o係 M2 既 calculus 教過哂，而且1013本身係calculus 入門course，其實所有野都好淺。

內容同notes就可以去唔同 instructor 既網度睇 (右邊)。個 course 除左2個exams就只係有webwork。

P.S. 考試係唔比用 calc 機
reviews.comment_teaching:
kchow 教書就認真麻麻，雖然睇得出佢好有心機教，但個人認為上唔上堂聽佢講都無咩分別

雖然kchow教得麻麻，但d notes整得唔錯: https://www.math.ust.hk/~kchow/math1013/。
reviews.comment_grading: 隔左太耐唔記得d實質數字，MT below > 1 SD, Final above 0.x SD，最後拎 B- (差少少 (其實係差1分) 就 C+) 總之出哂名爛 grade
reviews.comment_workload:
但由於我無讀過 M2, 考試前要用d時間操下唔同題型先

當年我係純自修無上堂，呢度可以推介個網 http://tutorial.math.lamar.edu/Classes/CalcI/CalcI.aspx, 或者可以去 MIT OpenCourseWare 個網睇片。

reviews.author: NaokiR
reviews.title: Easy, but (almost) no mistake allowed
reviews.comment_content:
No attendance requirement. I only attended the first lecture.
Went through the syllabus once or twice but it doesn't matter.
James Stweart Calculus is used. Detailed book with a huge amount of examples (and problem sets). Don't need to go through all of them, and most problem sets in the book exceed the requirement of exams (if you only want to get good grades).
Overall, appropriate difficulty to learn calculus from scratch.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Instructors don't matter, the number of monstrous mainland students in your lecture does.

I highly recommend that you:
1. Read James Stweart Calculus 7ed (this course covers part of the book).
2. Finish your homework ASAP, get extra problem sets if you're not confident in a specific chapter.
3. Get yourself prepared for the test by doing pastpaper.
4. MOST IMPORTANT: Know what you're doing. Know how and WHY you're carrying out the calculation in a particular way instead of another.
reviews.comment_grading:
A range guarantee if you:
1. Get all of your homework right.
2. No stupid mistakes in midterm and final (e.g. calculation, clerical error), as little points would be given if you don't get the answer correct in the first place.
3. You're lucky enough not to be in a lecture with all crazy students, as they'll break the curve.
REMEMBER: Little tolerance for stupid mistakes.
reviews.comment_workload:
If you've learned some calculus before, almost no workload. Main focus is placed on USING calculus to solve problems that you've already encountered (if you read the textbook carefully) rather than PROVING.

However, if you want to get A+, you have to get yourself familiar with all those proving stuff.

reviews.author: 垃圾科大
reviews.title: 爛grade爛到
reviews.comment_content:
垃圾
假如你讀M1祝你好運
btw考試唔可以用cal機都係個句祝你好運
reviews.comment_teaching:
自己比較廢聽唔明prof 講乜所以對於我黎講lecture係無用嘅midterm前一個禮拜開始無再上過堂
tutorial 幾有用tutor會比notes同practice 推介 Walter

absolute grading
webwork 15% （100/100）
midterm 35% （56/100）
final (cumulative) 50% （37/100）
最後c-
對一個讀M1得4嘅人黎講依個course注定爛grade
reviews.comment_workload: 對一個讀M1得4嘅人黎講webwork好難我基本上除左第一份webwork可以自己做完其他都要去math support centre求救

reviews.author: O
reviews.comment_content: Basic M2 stuff. You will get good grade if you have taken DSE M2.
reviews.comment_teaching: Since I took the course in Spring semester, there were more international students and the lecturer will talk a bit slower and use more time to express the questions.
reviews.comment_grading:
As a M2 student and also in Spring semester (got many non local international students support me),
Got A-
But dont take this course in Spring course if you in Engin or Sci school becuase ir is the pre requisite of many thousands of courses and it will affect your timetable.
reviews.comment_workload: Webwork once per week and count small portion of marks

reviews.author: ylh
reviews.title: Nice instructor
reviews.comment_content: 深入版既differentiation & integration， 基本上有讀DSE M2既難度都唔會太高，不過對trigonometric的要求並唔算高，五個chapter分別為function, limit, derivatives, application of derivatives 同 integrals
reviews.comment_teaching: 應該係咁多lecturer入面最好個幾個之一，首先佢係local，講既英文聽得明，唔識都會用廣東話/英文去解答你，解答亦相當易明；而且resources亦都係十足，lecture notes 5份，每份都大約40頁，用唔同顏色去express，簡單易明，所有堂既lecture video都會係canvas上面搵到，而每個chapter都會有一份或超過一份既extra problem set，雖然比較難，但係問題極似final，基本上做完extra problem set明曬既話入到考場問題都唔大。好多朋友都問我拎佢d sources同埋sit佢堂
reviews.comment_grading:
15% Webwork
35% Mid-term
50% Final

Absolute Grading，~70%-85% = B range；85%+ = A range ，mean大約為67 (~C+)

Webwork有unlimited attempt，而且1013多人讀，容易問到人，所以基本上15%係攞硬

值得一提的是mid-term及final唔俾用cal機，所以撞數個d都唔會work

我webwork 100%，midterm 87%， final 91%，最後A。
reviews.comment_workload: workload偏高，但沒有人地所謂咁大可謂多勞多得。我本身讀DSE M1，所以到trigo或者summation個到就會比較吃力，不過只要肯做齊所有問題，明曬webwork d答案點黎，考試都唔會話好難好難

reviews.author: GPA 2.7小隊
reviews.title: The worst grade course in required course
reviews.comment_content:
So hard content. If you are a M1 student is HKDSE , you will die.
Useless lecture notes.
reviews.comment_teaching: Cai Yuan doesn't know how to deliver his message to students. His English is really bad. The TA Leung HM is also weak in delivering the message to the students. if I were asked, I would say other tutors in Math centre will be much more useful than them. Don't register Can Yuan if you really want to learn from lessons , he is boring and won't be willing to answer students' questions.
reviews.comment_grading: Getting 50% will only be able to give you a C- in your course. Absolute grading which destroy students' grade
reviews.comment_workload:
Large workload. there are 8 web works. And these webworks is also very hard.

If you want to get B/C in your exam , you have to spend so much time in doing the practice.

reviews.author: mint3
reviews.title: Mostly Form 5 Level M2
reviews.comment_content:
Most topics such as:
- Finding derivatives by first principles
- Limits
- Finding asymptotes
- Continuity
- Implicit differentiation
are covered in the M2 syllabus
There are not a lot of new concepts introduced near the end of the semester which were not covered in the M2 syllabus such as L'Hopital's Rule. If you have been hardworking enough while in secondary school, you should be able to handle the course fairly easily.
reviews.comment_teaching: The pronunciation is unclear and the lectures are just textbook reading sessions. No engagement. The only remarking thing is "line sig-a-min" (line segment). The TA talks in a volume that I can't hear anything at the second row. There wasn't an email notification about the cancellation of the tutorial in the first week. Bad teaching and bad arrangements.
reviews.comment_grading:
The midterm is out of 105 points. Fairly easy except for the last question.
Online homework allow infinite retries so I suggest trying your best to score 100%.
The final is (likely) postponed to spring term due to continued social unrest. The course coordinators still haven't make up their mind about the finals.
reviews.comment_workload: The only workload comes from the 8 exercises which accounts for 2.5% of the course grade each (total 20%). The exercises can take anything from 30 minutes to 4 hours complete, depends on your understanding to the material. To me, homework 4 and 5 were the hardest.

reviews.author: lhww1001
reviews.title: Disclaimer - 悪霊退散
reviews.comment_content:
More than DSE M2.
Require good foundation in limit and calculus.
自學能力“相對比較”重要。
reviews.comment_teaching:
唔知上緊咩堂。Maybe LANG 1013I?

每堂PPT同textbook一式兩份，鍾意邊款任君選擇。想攞好grade嘅同學可以抄底佢係projector show嘅從PPT=textbook揾嘅materials落自己notes到作溫習之用。點樣利用，因人而異。

佢都好俾心機教嘅，所有人嘅付出都值得尊重，可惜佢嘅付出同成效唔成正比。唔通真係生不逢時、懷才不遇？

但不論如何，我們仍要為佢難能可貴嘅自信獻出熱烈嘅掌聲。

p.s. 據非正式統計調查，通常reg佢嘅maths course同學主流有二：
一：識曬唔care
二：放棄咗懶理
偶有零星勇士不懼艱苦，然而精神可嘉，為”狹路相逢勇者勝“呢句名諺作下完美嘅注腳。
reviews.comment_grading:
Abs. grading. Need not explain.
Good grade if you're good at maths. (It's bullsxxt)
At least 72.5% to get a B this sem.
reviews.comment_workload:
WebWork only.
Unlimited attempts for all answers. Normally can get full score, which is 15% of your grade.

reviews.author: Bowling0314
reviews.title: Not friendly to M1 students
reviews.comment_content:
1. Number and intervals, inequalities and absolutes, functions and graphs, composite functions, exponential functions.

2.Trigonometric functions, inverse functions, logarithmic functions, inverse trigonometric functions.

3.Tangent and velocity, the limit of a function, limit laws.

4.Continuity, limits at infinity and horizontal asymptotes, derivatives and rates of change.

5.Basic derivatives, product and quotient rules, derivatives of trigonometric functions.

6.Chain rule, implicit differentiation, derivatives of inverse trigonometric functions and logarithmic functions.

7.Rates of change problems, related rates.

8.Linear approximations and differentials, maximum and minimum values.

9.Mean Value Theorem, derivatives and graphs, L’Hôpital’s rule.

10.Curve sketching, optimization problems, Newton’s Method.

11.Antiderivatives, areas and distances.

12.Definite integrals, the Fundamental Theorem of Calculus.

13.Applications of integrals, the substitution rule.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Dr.Huang’s teaching is okay. He uses good notes 5 app and writes the class notes on iPad. He always spends a lot of time to prove theories like how chains rule arises which is very useless for exams but if you really like maths, you maybe happy with him. His accent is okay, but he is not good at English! He only repeats a few words in class like “for example… similarly…so..”. However don’t worry! He will write everything he want to speak on the iPads ! I really appreciate for his teaching method, which is concise and clear. However the content is some how useless, only some basic examples and applications also many theories. So we have to find other exercises  for extra practices. Actually I could understand all the class materials and all the homework assignments but I still got very poor grade on the final exam and midterm.

For the Tutorial session,
Dr. Tam is form Hong Kong, he always speaks Cantonese in class. I didn’t attend the tutorial session after the first session because Dr. Tam, is very Irresponsible! He even said “唔識唔好嚟問我” and then just gave us some exercises… for me which is a M1 student, totally don’t understand what is L'Hôpital's rule and some trigonometry identities which M2 syllabus included. However he assume we all know and need to apply them in order to solve the first tutorial session’s exercises! So I didn’t go to tutorial session anymore.
reviews.comment_grading:
Absolute grading, F < 40% < D < 50% < C's < 70% < B's < 85% < A's
For our session, mean is 66.16/100
So, our mean is C grade!
I think Dr. Huang is harsh on giving grade because I got 48.18/100 in total and got D grade but my friend from other session got 48 and she got a C-. So Dr. Huang follow very strict to the grading standard! Absolute grade is very terrible!
reviews.comment_workload: Manageable, 8 assignment on class viva (web work) , each consists of around 20 questions. There are unlimited attempts so you can try infinity times until you score 100. But this website is really rubbish ! Suddenly disconnected and very slow to access.

reviews.author: lengradefong
reviews.title: Don't underestimate this course.
reviews.comment_content:
You will be learning more precise meaning of limit and differentiation. Also, the fundamental theorem of calculus.
Very Understandable!
reviews.comment_teaching: I never attended lectures. Just do all the extra questions in classviva or at least look at the solutions. They are super useful because they are similar to your exam questions. I found out after the midterm exam. I surly can perform better if I can find it sooner. In a nutshell, practice makes perfect.
reviews.comment_grading:
The midterm exam this year is ridiculous. It is 35% of your course grade but only has 10 multiple-choice questions which means 3.5 marks will be deducted in your overall for every wrong question.
I got 5/10 in the midterm exam. I was shocked. I mean noway. I did well in calculus throughout high school and HKDSE. However, with all the self-doubt and disappointment you must encounter in your study journey in HKUST, don't give up easily. I practice more   on the computation techniques required and studied in an exam oriented way. Finally, I got 85/100 in my final exams.
This is known as one of the poor grading courses because most people fall within the mean which is around sixty something and will get a C to C+. Therefore, all the hard work is worth it to chase back a B range. For your reference, my overall is 75/100 (B).
Reflection:
1. I was too confident
They are topics that you have faced in high school before, creating an illusion of simple. The fact is that you may have been treated mathematics as calculations but what I've learned in this course is that math is more about definitions and fundamental theorems. You should know what is a continuous function, a differentiable function, a integrable function, an invertible function even they were not asked directly in your exams. Also notice limit of a function with absolute sign could be very tricky.
2. Wrong direction
No much proof. You can ignore trig. However, the sandwich thm. intermediate value thm. mean value thm. would be useful. Just bear in mind.
3. No calculators allowed
Tbh, most of the careless mistakes could have eliminated if it is allowed. Anyway, no excuse as it is fair to everybody. Just memories all the special angles if you think it helps.
4. Don't compare yourself to others
People around you may put less effort to have better results than you but it has never changed the fact that you have to be a better me. As long as you focus on your own goal, no matter all odds, you must have way to do it. I didn't got A/A+ but I have made myself proud already.
reviews.comment_workload: I remember there are around 8 hw with less than 20 questions consists in each. They are all Webwork and can redo with out any deduction.

reviews.author: 芝士奶蓋綠茶
reviews.title: Basic DSE M2 Stuffs
reviews.comment_content: Contents are similar to the parts of DSE M2 Calculus, including functions, limits, differentiation and integration, but without trigo substitution, integration by part and calculating volume and areas (which I think these will be covered in MATH1014). Would not be a problem if you have studied DSE M2 before, though some concepts are new and you have to revise them before taking the exams, such as the Fundamental Theorem of Calculus and L'Hopital Rule. Get yourself a textbook such as the "Calculus Early Transcendentals 8th Edition", which is very useful if you do not want to attend lectures but want some examples and practices.
reviews.comment_teaching: Mainlander professor with a heavy Chinese accent. Never attended any lectures except the first and the final review session, and I found out that he even made quite a few mistakes even in the final review session. Never attended tutorials too. They gave exercise and step-by-step solutions, which can be found in canvas. Just go and download them from Canvas if you want to practice.
reviews.comment_grading:
Grading Method:
8 Homework: 25%
Final Exam: 75%
Unlimited Attempt of Homework so basically if you finish it on time, you could get 100% for homework.
Final Exam consists of three parts, 25 MC Questions in total.

Scored 100% for Homework, 84% for Final Exam. Final Score 88% and got an A-. Fair grading. Seems to be absolute grading so just try your best to study for your exams.

BTW unlike other courses, the scores are released immediately after Parts of the Exam.

FYI Got 5* in DSE Maths, 5 in M2
reviews.comment_workload: 8 Homework in total. Have plenty of time to do so though. The homework questions are not too difficult and you can easily get through if you studied the materials.

reviews.author: LU,Qingyan
reviews.title: easy but need to be careful
reviews.comment_content: something basic about math, including drivarive, triangle function, inverse function, ratio and so on. they are relatively easy.
reviews.comment_teaching: The professor is careful and analyze problems clearly.And the PPT is also comprehensive so it is easy to understand the content.And she always answer every question vividly.
reviews.comment_grading: you are supposed to be very careful because this course is easy! Dont ignore details and look down on it.the grade is constituted of midterm,final and homework.
reviews.comment_workload: you just need to finish your homework and understand the problems on PPT.No extra work is needed.

reviews.author: alvinwongtn
reviews.comment_content:
Almost 80% of the content had been learnt if you study M2
Week 01:
1.1 Review of functions,
1.2 Representing functions,
1.3 Inverse, exponential and logarithmic functions
Week 02:
1.4 Trigonometric functions and their inverses,
2.1 The idea of limits,
2.2 Definitions of limits
Week 03:
2.3 Techniques for computing limits,
2.4 Infinite limits,
2.5 Limits at infinity, 2.6 Continuity
Week 04:
3.1 Introducing the derivatives,
3.2 Rules of differentiation
Week 05:
3.2 Rules of differentiation,
3.3 The product and quotient rules,
3.4 Derivatives of trigonometric functions,
3.5 Derivatives as rates of change,
3.6 The chain rule
Week 06:
3.7 Implicit differentiation,
3.8 Derivatives of logarithmic and exponential functions,
3.9 Derivatives of inverse trigonometric functions
Week 07:
3.10 Related rates,
4.1 Maxima and minima
Week 08:
4.2 What derivatives tell us,
4.3 Graphing functions,
4.4 Optimization problems
Week 09:
4.5 Linear approximation and differentials,
4.6 Mean value theorem,
4.7 L'Hopital's rule
Week 10:
4.8 Newton's method (*),
4.9 Antiderivatives
Week 11:
5.1 Approximating areas under curves,
5.2 Definite integrals
Week 12:
5.3 Fundamental theorem of calculus,
5.4 Working with integrals
Week 13:
5.5 Substitution rule,
Review (if there is time available)
reviews.comment_teaching: He is great if you understand his accent
reviews.comment_grading: It is great if you have studied M2
reviews.comment_workload: Web works are easy if you have studied M2

reviews.author: camilla
reviews.title: MATH 1013Calculus IB
reviews.comment_content: many materials have been taught in M1/M2, so it will be easy for those who have taken M1/M2 before. You have to a maths brick book for your study too. Bless you!
reviews.comment_teaching: it varies a lot among profs. The pro side is that the tutorial is compulsory and it helps you to understand better.
reviews.comment_grading: as there are many science and engineering students, business students will suffer :(  Study hard la..The average grade is C as i heard from!
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is quite heavy. There is online homework and it counts attendance. The quiz and midterm are quite difficult.

reviews.author: Research+Doc
reviews.title: Not that bad, but not good of course.
reviews.comment_content:
The contents are pretty much summarized in the course description. However, if you think that since you've done Mathematics module 2 in DSE you won't have any problem -- you're wrong. It's an extension to M1 and M2. It might not cover as broad, but certainly deeper. It took quite a lot of work (drills and practice and memorization) for me, a biochemistry student, to master these topics. It would help quite a lot if you have a bunch of physics and mathematics major friends.
Maths professors might say otherwise, but up till now I find little use of the contents in my other courses and research lab projects. So if you ask me, it's not useful for life science guys, not in the first 2 years anyway. It's just something good to know.
reviews.comment_teaching:
This course is as boring as it can get. Honestly it doesn't make the slightest difference academically whether you attend classes or not.  It does, however, grant you a few more hours of sleep at home/hall if you don't attend lectures, although you'd sleep in class anyway.
It might be useful to attend the tutorials though. Tutors work through examples with you, which is much more useful than just talking about the theories.
reviews.comment_grading:
Grading isn't bad actually. Exams have MC and LQ, and almost always adequate time. It's true though, that if you don't know how to solve a question within 5 minutes, you're not gonna figure it out during the exam anyway (probably right when the invigilator says 'pens down'? Ouch.)
Obviously I didn't get an A+, but the grade I got still wasn't bad, and hey I'm an idiot in Maths. You all maths geeks out there will defo do better.
reviews.comment_workload: Webwork is the only piece of work we gotta do. It needs to be done on time every week though, and there's no reminder whatsoever, so better put that in your calendar and set up alarms. Some of the questions on there are real hard even for maths majors (or, well, the TAs at Math Support Centre), so Wolfram Alpha always come in handy. You might want to complete the corresponding Webwork once lecture's covered a chapter. Good way to revise actually.

reviews.author: BAM
reviews.title: calculus 既入門班
reviews.comment_content: 一個差唔多全世界都要讀既COURSE,sci友,engine仔,BBA佬都無走雞。教下基礎既calculus(m1/m2都接觸唔少)。因為以前無分開CORE人同M1/M2人黎教，所以讀起上黎有好大分別，大部分core人都會頂唔順，而有讀過既人就會覺得好淺。對數學無乜興趣概人必定中伏既COURSE:P。2個exam + 一堆webwork。我果時MIDTERM好似考到critical point同turning point 比D式你 畫返圖。
reviews.comment_teaching: 太多人教，個個唔同風格。一般黎講都係悶。
reviews.comment_grading: gradinge 差 mean c+,~1sd b+, a-要above 1.1sd
reviews.comment_workload: webwork 慘無人道 。不過有時會google到答案，唔識都可以問ta,math support centre係31/32lift地下。webwork你可以直接打式,唔洗出答案，例如tan(85)/2*5+1都會接受

reviews.author: stonks
reviews.title: 1013 L1
reviews.comment_content:
雖然都係1013，但喺L1同其他secton唔同，多唔少野，例如係epsilon-delta proof (not 1023 level, most basic ones)，mean value theorem 嘅proof 等等，入得黎要有心理準備問題會難過Webwork。

Syllabus大約HKALE Pure Maths Functions + Differentation 兩課，再加basic mathematical logic (negation, converse, contrapositive...)。
reviews.comment_teaching:
FF教得唔錯，上堂會講下笑話（雖然有啲爛），內容亦都講得明。Tutorial 嘅 quality 都幾好。
btw FF嘅1013有discord server，好jeng😋
reviews.comment_grading:
Grading依樣野就因人而異嘅，有啲人會覺得隔離sections考嘅大多都係dse野，刷grade簡單啲。不過對於我依啲成日計錯數/on9野嘅人黎講，L1嘅grading就相對好好多，因為L1重conceptual understanding，careless mistake 扣嘅分會小啲。

Grading scheme:
20% Assignments
40% Midterm (or 0%)
40% Final (or 75%)
注意midterm嘅分數係transfer唔曬落final嗰度，加上今次final頗難，所以midterm先係兵家必爭之地。

FF學期頭話係absolute grading，但喺因為太少人過A cut-off，所以最後都係lower左個cut-off。
reviews.comment_workload:
頭個兩份Assignment幾多題目，不過後勁不繼，到到最後個兩份Assignment full mark正係得32分，題目重要簡單。
Assignment係人手改，改左無回頭，所以記住小心，否則Final你會拉分拉得好辛苦。
btw tutorial ta成日會教做assignment類型嘅題目，所以記住上tutorial。

reviews.author: Aru
reviews.comment_content:
Easy
Easier than Hkdse m2 syllable just some d and in

Trash
都唔知佢教咩 自己去khan academy 學仲好
Prof 英文又唔好 organization 又講到1999
建議直接走堂
reviews.comment_grading:
Absolute grade
題目唔難有温下書做下數就得 個人認為係靚grade嘅 有努力有成果
Ps dse4 m2 3 1013 A
reviews.comment_workload:
Classviva
兩個禮拜一份
不過個人認為唔夠 要自己再做多啲數

reviews.author: lolllool
reviews.title: 唔係想像中甘爛grade
reviews.comment_content:
主要系高中m2同core野，例如：
-log function
-Trigonometric functions
-Limit
-Curve sketching
-Basic derivatives (Chain rule, product rule, quotient rule...)
-max min
-tangent, velocity, slope
-Rate of change
-Integration and application of integration
到中後期會教少少新野(或者舊野撈少少新野)：
-Mean Value Theorem
-L’Hôpital’s rule
-Linear approximations
-Derivatives of inverse function
-Newton's method

新舊野比例大約系3比7
Overall 黎講有讀m2應該唔難應付
我基本上無乜學新野，食曬M2啲老本就去考Final
reviews.comment_teaching:
Lecture:
佢通常講少少概念，之後做幾條Example
英文還好，叫做聽得明
但係tone比較單一，少悶
Notes 就基本上有上堂先睇得明，因爲字比較樣衰+冇乜解釋，冇上堂真係唔知佢寫緊乜

Tutorial:
我Walter Chan 教，上堂都係同你操下數甘，英文有HK口音，Notes 好靚，超多Extra exercise
reviews.comment_grading:
聽好多人講話爛grade，但我覺得還好
利申:M2 level 3
HW 25% Final 75%
今sem online 考所以全MC
MC 記得要有技巧甘做，例如善用integration 同 Differentiation 之間嘅關係
HW: 75/100 (mean ~100) [自己懶，唔記得做兩份]
Final part 1: 32/36 (mean 25.5)
Final part 2: 24/32 (mean 20.9)
Final Part 3: 24/32 (mean 14.4)
Final total: 80/100 (mean 60.8)
Grade: B
做齊功課應該有B+或者A-
reviews.comment_workload:
Lecture 同 Tutorial 冇 attendance，Lecture可以走，Tutorial 建議上

Classviva 啲HW 都係簡單野，total 8份，無限attempts，唔識嘅上網Google都有solution，所以人人都基本上滿分

記得做齊Classviva 啲HW，記得mark實deadline 日期，冇做一份扣好多分

reviews.author: chiaa
reviews.title: BAD grade
reviews.comment_content:
For the students who didn't learn calculus before, this class is a SUFFER. Your classmates are M2 local students and NDS, good luck to your grade.

I did't think I've learned ANYTHING in this course.

Lectures and hw and final are three totally different things.
The lectures contain really easy stuff like how to do the calculations. You can easily understand what the professor is saying.

The hw is totally different from the class, some questions even contain physic. It's like the class is LV1 and the hw will suddenly jump to LV99. You don't really need to attend the class to do the hw since they are thing from two different worlds.

The exam is easier than hw, but still need to spend some time to study.
reviews.comment_teaching:
The professor is really nice and cute. Although he has some accents but you can still understand. He is willing to answer to students' questions.

This is the only thing I didn't hate in this class.

tbh, professor doesn't really matter in this class, but a nice professor will make you feel better.
reviews.comment_grading:
Assignment: 25%
Final:75%
No attendance, so you don't really need to attend the lectures.

assignments: 8 in total. You can do the hw as many times as you want to get a hundred. Almost everyone scores perfectly on hw.

final: three parts, 26 questions in total. All MC.
The professor mentioned it's not all absolute grading, they still graded on curve to control the amount of A range students. (but who knows, they kept changing the grading method)

Absolute grading:
>93.5 A+
88.5 A
83.5 A-
78.5 B+
72.5 B
67.5 B-
61.5 C+
54.5 C
47.5 C-
38 D
<38 F

Full mark on assignments and below mean (about 60%)  in final will get you a C.
reviews.comment_workload:
Quite light. But depends on do you have calculus background.
Only 8 hw to do. About 20-25 problems per hw.
If you never learned calculus before, you might need a lot of help and find it really time consuming.

Also there are many problem sets on classviva you can do (if you want to).

reviews.author: pepi0922
reviews.title: In general a nice instructor
reviews.comment_content:
Basic things including limits, derivative, antidifferentiation.
We’ve learnt most of them in high school
reviews.comment_teaching: Not bad. She is always ready to answer your questions.
reviews.comment_grading:
25% Homework
75% Final ( All MCQs)

My situation:
Homework-full credits
Final-96/100
Finally I got A+

Homework is not difficult and it allows limitless attempts, so almost everyone can achieve full marks in homework. However, plz pay attention to the deadline of each homework especially when it is near final period.
As for the final exam, it is quite easy if you’ve understood every question in homework. Do the example papers. It is of great help.
reviews.comment_workload:
Normal.
Just several homework which could be completed in an hour (for each).
No midterm exam
So take the final seriously.

reviews.author: GB
reviews.comment_content:
1 Number and intervals, inequalities and absolutes, functions and graphs, composite
functions, exponential functions.
2 Trigonometric functions, inverse functions, logarithmic functions, inverse
trigonometric functions.
3 Tangent and velocity, the limit of a function, limit laws.
4 Continuity, limits at infinity and horizontal asymptotes, derivatives and rates of
change.
5 Basic derivatives, product and quotient rules, derivatives of trigonometric functions.
6 Chain rule, implicit differentiation, derivatives of inverse trigonometric functions and
logarithmic functions.
7 Rates of change problems, related rates.
8 Linear approximations and differentials, maximum and minimum values.
9 Mean Value Theorem, derivatives and graphs, L’Hôpital’s rule.
10 Curve sketching, optimization problems, Newton’s Method.
11 Antiderivatives, areas and distances.
12 Definite integrals, the Fundamental Theorem of Calculus.
13 Applications of integrals, the substitution rule.

For M1 students, like me, things can be a NIGHTMARE sometimes. In such cases, clear your doubts asap and if your professors or TAs can't help, YouTube is the best solution. Definitely helps understand stuff.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Many people have written rather negative reviews about Professor Chuang. However, I have had a very good learning experience in his class. He believes in learning to apply rather than to simply score well in the finals and teaches that way too. If you are someone who simply wants to learn for the sake of getting good grades, this class ain't for you.

No attendance required, at least for this class.
reviews.comment_grading:
There's an absolute grading system.
The classviva homework(10 assignments in total) weighs 25% of the grade while 75% of the grade comes from your final examination score.
My grade: C

One advice; don't leave too many lectures pending until close to the examination unless you are happy with receiving a C. I learnt it the hard way.
reviews.comment_workload: There are 10 pieces of online assignments on classviva. Unlimited attempts so easy to get full marks.

reviews.author: gradeson
reviews.title: Extremely bad grade course with bullshit teaching
reviews.comment_content:
DSE M2 Differentiation+small portion of integration+ few of new things
Syllabus :
Limits & Continuity
Differentiation
Rate of Change
Linear Approximation
L'Hospital Rules
Mean Value Theorem
Extreme Point
Concavity
Curve Sketching
Optimization
Newton Method
Riemann Sum
The fundamental theorem of Calculus
Indefinite & Definite Integral
Integration with substitution
Course Materials:
-A textbook with handwriting notes by the lecturer on the lecture
-Tutorial Notes from TA
-HW from classviva
reviews.comment_teaching:
CAI Yuan is a mainland lecturer with heavy mainland accent English.
His English cannot be understood if you are normal students
His teaching is also a disaster, only copy the book examples on the whiteboard
You cannot gain anything from his lesson
The textbook is not reader-friendly.
It is very difficult to understand the concent of the textbook if you are a normal student.
TA CHEUNG, Tsz Yung  is also bad on teaching
He only does the question on the board and nearly not hear his sound, just like he talks himself only
Tutorial Notes are not reader-friendly for beginner
reviews.comment_grading:
Grading :
15% HW from Classviva
35% midterm exam
50% Final exam
Cut-off :
> ~50% C range,> ~70% B range, > ~85% A range
Very bad grade course, but be forced to study for most of the yr1 students who studied M1/M2 in HKDSE
Only sample paper and HW from Classviva can be practised before the exam, but the real exam is more difficult than those
No past paper to practise from official way
So it is difficult to revise in this course
Most students got C range in this course
reviews.comment_workload:
Quite heavy, need to complete HW on classviva every half month.
Classviva is a rubbish system which always has lacking problem and Crashdown, so you always have problems on doing HWs
If you want to get A/B range, you must practise on daily
and sit other lecturer and TA lesson if yours is bullshit

reviews.author: cwl.Alex
reviews.comment_content:
This course is not M1-friendly.
This course is not M1-friendly.
This course is not M1-friendly.

I need to repeat 3 times as there are many parts of M2-privilege content.

It doesn't take attendance, so many friends (of course with M2 background) would choose to skip all lectures and only attend the exams. However, I found the tutorial sections useful.
reviews.comment_teaching:
His language is nearly incomprehensible. Sometimes he makes stale jokes and stories.

Only about 15 - 18 student remains in his class, mostly working on classviva or self-study by themselves. You can see how uninteresting his lessons are.

BTW, he earned a teaching award actually. How ironic.
reviews.comment_grading:
A BIG NOPE.
You will mostly get bad grades.
reviews.comment_workload:
You get webwork from classviva every week. The first few pieces are easy, and that's it. The later ones only get harder and more complicated. I have one that has 24 questions and there are a lot of sub-questions.

Luckily, you can spam and try for infinity time, so that you can strive for the full mark.

Don't try to procrastinate. You will regret that.

reviews.author: Bryan Lo
reviews.title: DO NOT UNDERESTIMATE ITS DIFFICULTY
reviews.comment_content:
Boring Math stuff. Pace very quick. Very difficult. Expect a broken grade. There is nothing else to say. Good luck.

Just make sure you understand and memorize all theories clearly because they are necessary to find the answer to the questions.

And make sure don't be confident even if you studied M2, it is very difficult to score high mark in this course.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Literally cannot learn anything from the lesson. Monotonous tone, small voice. He just lives in his world while we can never understand what is he talking about. His lecture notes are basically trash, what he taught does not correspond to his notes. I have to borrow my friend's lecture notes to do self-study. DON'T CHOOSE THIS PROF. If your prof is him, unfortunately, remember to always sit in the front.

I dunno if it will be the same to you, the classroom I was in has 3 whiteboards which are very big and far apart. YOU HAVE TO RUN ACROSS THE ROOM DURING THE LECTURE TO READ ALL THE THINGS HE WROTE, AND IT'S STUPID.
reviews.comment_grading:
I got a total of 3 stars in Math compulsory and M2 but still get a B- at last. It is difficult as hell. Don't expect good grade from this course unless you fell in love with maths.

In case  IF YOU WANT TO GET GOOD GRADES in this course, remember to drill the tutorials exercise (only drill exercise with answers).

This course is absolute grading so you don't have to care about the mean or median, just try to get as high mark as possible.
reviews.comment_workload:
The homework is not too difficult but you need to understand the stuff taught in the lecture to finish all of them.

***Remember to mark the deadlines of the homework in your calendar and set a reminder or you may forget to finish them.***

Just remember to drill all tutorial exercise if possible because they will help a lot to your midterm and final.

reviews.author: Eunis
reviews.comment_content:
the content is mostly cover in DSE M2
If you have taken M2, this course will be quite easy for you

her English is extremely bad can't understand immediately (need to think and guess)

reviews.author: Vivian_coco
reviews.comment_content: 上課不用ppt，全程都是手寫，所以之後要復習的話上課的時候可能最好做些筆記。内容的話開始比較簡單，midterm以後開始變難了。
reviews.comment_teaching: 老師教的挺認真的，但是會有點催眠效果。老師英語挺高的，人也很好很可愛，總是面帶微笑，上課的時候會自己把自己逗笑。老師很有耐心，課後回答學生問題也很細緻。
reviews.comment_grading: 給龜還挺好的，平時的作業可以有無數次的機會，不用擔心一邊做錯。midterm和final重要，會給過程分，不用擔心結果錯就全扣。之後check paper也有商量的餘地。總呢，老師人很好。
reviews.comment_workload: 平時幾乎沒有什麽workload，就是hw要盡量早點完成，免得過了ddl。midterm和final之前要做做sample，其他就幾乎沒什麽workload了。可以説是workload小，教授人又好，給龜也好的課了。

reviews.author: Kaptvilatseux
reviews.comment_content:
An introduction to some basic concepts and simple applications of calculus, including basic functions, limits, continuity, derivatives, linear approximations and Newton's method, mean value theorem, L'Hopital's rule, integrals and their applications.

This course concentrate more on the applications rather than the strictly logical structure of math. For example, strict definitions of the concepts as well as proofs of some theorems are not required. In this way, this course was poor in depth of math. Instead, problem-solving in daily or engineering or business circumstances serves as a big part of teaching, hw, and exams.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Dr. Lam is easy-going and helpful, but has a slight English accent.
Nothing more I could comment on, for I had only attended 2 lectures this semester. X)
reviews.comment_grading:
Good.

As infinite attempts are allowed in the webwork online homework, full mark of hw is very easy to get.
Exams are easy if adequate understanding of the basic concepts and algebraic deformation skills are equipped. A clear mind during the exam is also vital.

Semi-absolute grading.
Nearly all of the students get full mark in hw (average 90+ each); midterm average 73.93; final average 72.05.
Me: hw 100 + midterm 100 + final 94 = A+
reviews.comment_workload: Attendance is not required, and online homework cost approximately 1 hour each, sometimes slightly more. If you have adequate math level, the workload is almost zero.

reviews.author: K. H.
reviews.title: An Ordinary Maths Course
reviews.comment_content:
This course covers all the basics of calculus as well as some of the topics in the past AL Maths. Topics included are:
1. Definition of Functions (*)
2. Trigonometry
3. Limit of Functions
4. Continuity of Functions
4. Definition of Limit (not examined) (*)
5. Differentiation
6. Application of Differentiation, including
    I) Rates
    II) Linear Approximation and Differential (*)
    III) Newton's Method (*)
    IV) Maximum and Minimum Values
    V) Mean Value Theorem (*)
    VI) L'Hospital Rule (*)
    VII) Curve Sketching
    VIII) Optimization Problems
7. Antiderivatives
8. Definite Integrals
9. Fundamental Theorem of Calculus

(Topics with asterisk are either topics from past AL Pure Maths or topics at university level)

This course might be too easy for students studied Mathematics M2 before (especially for those who get very good result in DSE exam) but too difficult for the students studied M1 before because many topics are new to them, thereby I would say the content fails to satisfy the needs of the students.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Professor MOY use a lot of time to demonstrate the WebWork Problems. Although this approach might be good to the students who need a lot of help in the study, it is not really helpful to the students with better Maths background. His lecture is also very boring.

The TA, on the other hand, is much more helpful. He demonstrate the problems with very clear and concise logic, and is also very willing to answer the students' questions. But again, the tutorial is too boring for those people with better Maths background
reviews.comment_grading:
The grading scheme is as the following:
WebWork: 15%
Mid-term Exam: 35%
Final Exam: 50%

Since a lot of people have already given the details of the grading, I would rather show some statistics.
Mid-term: Mean:69.13 S.D.:18.25
Final: Mean:66.06 S.D.:16.62
Overall: Mean:71.49 S.D.:14.58

Overall I got 88.45 and I got an A.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload for this course is actually quite light. You just need to finish the WebWork every week. Since there are unlimited attempt in the WebWork, it is relatively easy to get higher marks or even full score in WebWork (in fact many people get full marks in WebWork so don't miss any one of the assignment in WebWork).

reviews.author: shaaa
reviews.title: Hard Work is Everything
reviews.comment_content:
Personally, I studied M1 in secondary school. I thought my math was good. FYI, I got 5* in M1 and 5* in core.

When I first got in UST, people kept saying good luck to me for this course. I was like, no way, I'm pretty good at math, it should be alright. Ended up I got a C+ lol.

But hey, I think I deserve getting this grade. UST is all about EARNING your own grade. I just overestimated myself. I only attended the first 2 lectures and the first tutorial. Yes, I skipped all the rest.

First few lectures, the content is pretty easy to understand. Since I found the lecturer accent hard to understand, and I felt like tutorial is just doing exercise that will be uploaded later on, I skipped all of them.

Obviously I was not as disciplined as I expected, I ended up only studying the materials just before webwork due. The chapters that I'm not familiar with piled up and I ended up not fully understanding them.

Mid-term was not hard and I got 65/100 because I didn't even managed to understand how to do some of the question in past papers. Final I deadline-fighted in the library for one day only. So I got 60/100 at the end.

I feel like I was just using my old knowledge from M1 about calculus to get this grade. I do feel bad about getting a bad math grade, so I'm trying to pick up the exercises and finish them in this winter term, hoping at least it'll be less hard to catch up with MATH1014. Let's see how I'll be doing if I work harder. See you in MATH1014 comment and Wish you good luck!!
reviews.comment_teaching: She tried very hard to explain things in detail. Her math and teaching are fair but her mainland accent is quite strong. Maybe it's just me not understanding sometimes. Even some words that I knew, I spent quite some time in lesson to understand which word she's talking about. She is very willing to answer your question, it may be better if you can ask in mandarin.
reviews.comment_grading:
Fair.
Directly proportional to your effort.

Do your past paper. The question type repeats.

Though many said it is a poor grade course, I think it is very good grade to me already. Didn't study well and thought I would get an F.
reviews.comment_workload: WebWork is too easy sometimes. It made us feel like the exam paper is gonna be as easy.

reviews.author: Blue science
reviews.title: MATH1013 L1
reviews.comment_content:
The content of L1 is different from other sessions. It is more about logic, concepts, and proof. The two main topics are limits and differentiation, but it's pretty different from HKDSE stuff.

Chapter 1: Preliminaries
Chapter 2: Limit of Functions
Chapter 3: Differentiations I
Chapter 4: Differentiations II

It is a lot simpler than MATH1023. If you want to learn more challenging and in-depth content, you should take MATH1023. On the other hand, if you don't want to think too much and just want to do computations, you should take other sessions of MATH1013.
reviews.comment_teaching: Prof. Fong explains everything quite clearly in lectures. He can guide you through the materials and the concepts could be learned easily. The jokes in class are not too odd and can keep the attention of the class.
reviews.comment_grading:
It's said to be absolute grading, but the cut-off scores appeared to be lowered after the final exam. Just like other UST courses, the grade would not be too good on average.

Cut-off score (according to the anonymous grade table):
A+ : [93,100]
A : [89,93)
A- : [82,89)
B+ : [75,82)
B : [65,75)
B- : [60,65)
C+ : [52,60)
C : [45,52)
C- : [39,45)
D : [30,39)
F : [0,30)

It provides two scoring formulas:
Scheme A:
Homework: 20%
Midterm: 40%
Final: 40%

Scheme B:
Homework: 20%
Midterm: 5%
Final: 70%

It will automatically use the scheme with a higher score. Most people (about 90% of the class) use Scheme A.

Total score (before the mark adjustments during paper checking)
Mean = 62.81
Median = 60.43
LQ = 51.73
UQ = 75.67
SD = 16.91
reviews.comment_workload:
There are a total of 11 problem sets but only the first 8 would be graded (in detail). The last 3 problem sets are optional and will not affect the grade if you did well in the first 8. The 3 problem sets will not be graded in detail and would be graded on 0-60-80% basis. One of which could be used to replace one of the previous 8. Then the lowest-scored graded assignment would be dropped.

On average, about 1 assignment per week, which is not too much in my opinion.

reviews.author: LouisL
reviews.comment_content:
Just some HKUSE stuff, with a little bit of new things such as the fundamental theorem of calculus

Week 01:
1.1 Review of functions,
1.2 Representing functions,
1.3 Inverse, exponential and logarithmic functions
Week 02:
1.4 Trigonometric functions and their inverses,
2.1 The idea of limits,
2.2 Definitions of limits
Week 03:
2.3 Techniques for computing limits,
2.4 Infinite limits,
2.5 Limits at infinity, 2.6 Continuity
Week 04:
3.1 Introducing the derivatives,
3.2 Rules of differentiation
Week 05:
3.2 Rules of differentiation,
3.3 The product and quotient rules,
3.4 Derivatives of trigonometric functions,
3.5 Derivatives as rates of change,
3.6 The chain rule
Week 06:
3.7 Implicit differentiation,
3.8 Derivatives of logarithmic and exponential functions,
3.9 Derivatives of inverse trigonometric functions
Week 07:
3.10 Related rates,
4.1 Maxima and minima
Week 08:
4.2 What derivatives tell us,
4.3 Graphing functions,
4.4 Optimization problems
Week 09:
4.5 Linear approximation and differentials,
4.6 Mean value theorem,
4.7 L'Hopital's rule
Week 10:
4.8 Newton's method (*),
4.9 Antiderivatives
Week 11:

5.4 Working with integrals
Week 13:
5.5 Substitution rule,
Review (if there is time available)
reviews.comment_teaching: I've never attend the lectures, so idk
reviews.comment_grading:
Absolute grading, F < 40% < D < 50% < C's < 70% < B's < 85% < A's
There is nothing much to say about it.
hw 10%
mid term 35%
final 55%
I got a B+ with 70/100 in mid term and 89/100 in final.
reviews.comment_workload: one hw per week, unlimited attempts, which is pretty light

reviews.author: outliers
reviews.comment_content:
Typical Calculus course, with two-thirds DSE-m2 stuff and some new stuff, but the expressions are
sometimes different from dse m2. The course covers Continuity, Differentiability, Intermediate Value Theorem, L'Hopital's Rule, Sketch curves, Newton's Method, Mean Value Theorem, 'one-to-one' function, Fundamental Theorem of Calculus, Substitution Rule, Applications of Integrals.
Note that the course covers less integration, e.g. no integration by part.
reviews.comment_teaching: I attend every lecture in the beginning, but the professor speaks with a Mandarin accent and the notes he writes are messy. It's better to watch the recording and his notes afterward. Self-learning is enough to score high.
reviews.comment_grading:
Homework 10%
Midterm 35%
Final 55%

Midterm only 10 mc, which means each mc account for 3.5 marks out of 100. Yet, it takes absolute grading (5 marks a subgrade). So, if you wrong 3 mc like me, getting an A range is extremely hard, need >90/100 in the final. At last, I got a b+ even scoring near 90 in the final. When it comes to difficulty, it's reasonable. To me, the final is even easier than the midterm, cause some mc are really tricky.
reviews.comment_workload: light workload with 8 online assignments to hand in. Each takes about an hour to complete. Also, you can submit unlimited times before the deadline and it only counts the highest one. So, the mean of the hw is near full mark too.

reviews.author: BusyBee
reviews.comment_content:
It's just your typical calculus course, taken to a deeper level than what we have learnt in high school.

Topics include limits, continuity, derivatives, integrals etc.

I have also noticed, like many others, about the different abilities of M1/M2 students but beyond that, I think it boils down to whether or not you have sufficient practice.
reviews.comment_teaching:
To be frank, this professor has a thick accent which can be hard to follow. Other than that, when explaining "tricky" or "hard" questions, his writing can be messy and quite hard to follow as well.

However, his explanation of concepts is alright and from what I heard about other instructors in the math department, I think WANG, Fan is already comparatively okay as he does teach at an acceptable level.

However, with math, self-discipline is key. You've got to chase the prof/ TA by yourself to ask if you don't understand a question/ concept otherwise you may be falling behind.
reviews.comment_grading:
Grade composition:

Homework: 10%
Mid-term: 35%
Finals: 55%

For me, personally, everything else was fine except the mid-term which is tricky because there were only 10 MC questions but that midterm accounts for 35% of your grade. So, be CAREFUL!!! I know many students, myself included, who were simply a bit too careless in midterms and our grades suffered for it...

Also, attendance doesn't count in any way so I know many people who just skip lectures and watch the recorded clips later on... but if you do that make sure you can manage your time well and are self-motivated... the last thing you want is to have deadlines piling up and you haven't even watched hour-long lecture videos.
reviews.comment_workload:
"Required" workload on its own is very light. Just the few online assignments (with which you have unlimited tries as well, so that's great).

However, I doubt that's enough for practice for mid-terms and finals. You would have to be self-motivated and use all available resources at your disposal to prepare yourself for these assessments.

reviews.author: Smashgod
reviews.title: Think twice before choosing Mr. Huang Meng's class
reviews.comment_content:
Topics are mostly covered in Mathematics compulsory and extended part Module 2 (M2). There are new theorems and skills to learn.

Week Topics
1
Number and intervals, inequalities and absolutes, functions and graphs, composite functions, exponential functions.

2
Trigonometric functions, inverse functions, logarithmic functions, inverse trigonometric functions.

3
Tangent and velocity, the limit of a function, limit laws.

4
Continuity, limits at infinity and horizontal asymptotes, derivatives and rates of change.

5
Basic derivatives, product and quotient rules, derivatives of trigonometric functions.

6
Chain rule, implicit differentiation, derivatives of inverse trigonometric functions and logarithmic functions.

7
Rates of change problems, related rates.

8
Linear approximations and differentials, maximum and minimum values.

9
Mean Value Theorem, derivatives and graphs, L’Hôpital’s rule.

10
Curve sketching, optimization problems, Newton’s Method.

11
Antiderivatives, areas and distances.

12
Definite integrals, the Fundamental Theorem of Calculus.

13
Applications of integrals, the substitution rule.
reviews.comment_teaching:
I really do not appreciate Mr. Huang's note-taking habits. Mr. Huang takes notes on his iPad and shares the screen on the hall screens. However, he does not give us enough time to take the notes 90% of the time. After finishing 1 part, he will not give you more than 10 seconds to copy all the graphs and numbers, and sometimes just scrolls back to the starting page IMMEDIATELY for 'conclusion' I guess (but doesn't really say something useful). I don't know why he always seems to be in a rush and has to scroll a little lower which hides his previous notes but does not write anything new in the blank space. He does not like writing on the bottom of his iPad so he will scroll up and continue (which hides the notes again). If he hadn't put the Zoom recordings and notes on Canvas, I would have been more disappointed. His writing is a bit hard to read though.
Mr. Huang's lessons this semester were at 09:00-10:20 every Tuesday and Thursday so it was not the best time for students to be concentrated during the lessons. Mr. Huang also spends too much time proving theorems. Despite the rapid pace in lessons, he is behind schedule.
The good thing about Mr. Huang is that he is very responsive when it comes to asking questions via email. He even replies during weekends.
His accent is alright. You can understand what he is saying.

There are two tutorial teaching assistants (TA) in Huang Meng's course. I was in tutorial A which was taught by TA Mr. He Jiafa. The tutorials became pretty boring and not very useful later on. The earliest tutorials talked about the homework solutions and steps before their deadlines so it helps students finish their assignments. The tutorials then became reviewing concepts covered in lectures with some in-class exercises but there were too simple compared with the assignments and exams. The progress of the tutorials and lectures also do not match; tutorials can get ahead of lectures or behind them. We failed to cover integration and the important theorems.
According to my classmate, the other TA's tutorials are used for drilling exercises but the questions are likely to be out-syllabus. That is why the tutorials are not helpful at all.

They do not take attendance in both lectures and tutorials so you can choose whether you would like to attend them or not.

If you do not attend his lectures and only do revision on your own, then his class will be alright for you. If you really need to learn in his class, then it may not be a good choice.
reviews.comment_grading:
10% by online homework
35% by midterm exam (x1)
55% by final exam
He didn't even give us the midterm exam results until I asked him for them before the finals.
The grading is based on students’ performance in assessment tasks.
The homework is delivered and submitted via the website: https://www.classviva.org/
There are unlimited homework attempts given so it is best if you maximize your score before the deadline. Ask for help from classmates or lecturers if needed.
Calculators are forbidden in exams for MATH1013 (for all instructors and classes)!
The midterm and final exams have moderate difficulty. Similar to the sample papers and past papers.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is not high. There are 8 assignments for this semester in total with 15-16 questions on average (the last one had 24). There are unlimited homework attempts given so it is best if you maximize your score before the deadline. He was behind schedule so the deadlines were postponed for a few days occasionally. The required skills and methods may be taught just a few days before the deadline.

reviews.author: Thomas-19
reviews.title: M2, NDS friendly
reviews.comment_content:
M2 topics for about 60%

Continuity, Differentiability, Intermediate Value Theorem, Mean Value Theorem, 'one-to-one' function, Solving problems with absolute functions, Sandwich(Squeeze) Theorem, Linear Approximation, Newton's Method, Critical Point, Rolle's Theorem, L'Hopital Rule, Reimann Sum, Fundamental Theorem of Calculus(A little more things than DSE M2)

Non-M2 topics includes
Inverse function
Differentiation of inverse functions
etc.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Skipped lesson after knowing no attendance from the first lesson.

Students are suggested to watch tutorials only.

Self-study by looking once into the book is enough to score B or above for non-M1 students.

Kind of useless professor, useful TA (tutorials). All math-related expressions are able to learn from tutorials.

Literally cannot learn anything from the lesson. Monotonous tone, small voice. Wonder why can he teach the lesson when his microphone is located above his hair in the zoom class.
reviews.comment_grading:
Absolute Grading
85% A range
70% B Range
50% C Range

Without attending lecture, mid-term 90/100 (9 out of 10 mc)
Hw 100/100

Composition of grading:
10% HW
35% mid-term
55% final

For me
Homework : 100/100
Mid Term : 90/100 ( 9/10 mc )
Final Examination : 80/100 ( Whole paper consists of 15 mc and 3 long questions )
Final Mark : 85.5/100 ( Mean 61.26/100 ) (Should be above 2.5+ sd)
Final Letter Grade : A-
Generally speaking ABSOLUTE GRADING DESTROY students grade
reviews.comment_workload:
8 Classviva HW in total with unlimited trials.
Expect 2-3 hours for finishing one with time for self-studying included. And 4 trials per HW

reviews.author: hatsunemiku
reviews.title: Very poor pronunciation
reviews.comment_content: Typical M2 stuff learnt in HKDSE syllabus, with new things taught like L'Hôpital's rule. Before midterm it is mainly focusing on derivatives and integrations for the final term. If you have learnt M2 before, you will feel very bored, if not you will be fucked up miserably.
reviews.comment_teaching: It is strongly recommended that Mr Huang Meng should attend LANG 1002R, which is a remedial course for those who fail to get a level 3 or above in HKDSE English Language, and I think that his English is as poor as a primary student. First of all, he should be able to pronounce each word concisely and clearly. However, you may find it confusing by listening to Mr. Huang Meng's pronunciation. For instance, he pronounces "absolute" with 5 syllables (ab/bu/su/la/de), "odd function" into "other funcshin". Moreover, his voice is too soft that I can't hear him even though he is using a microphone during the whole course. Last but not least, his ability of expression is disastrous since no one can understand what he is talking about. He expresses simple concepts about Mathematics in a very extremely complicated way.
reviews.comment_grading:
TOTALLY TRASH.
Even your score is higher than 1SD, you still only get a B grade. For students who get a mean score could only get a C grade, which is very unfair.
Classviva(10%): 100/100 (Mean: 94.64)
Midterm(35%): 70/100 (10MC for 35% very ridiculous) (Mean: 58.2)
Final(55%): 85/100 (Mean: 65.59)
Total(100%): 81.25 (Mean: 65.91)
Final grade: B+

This course uses absolute grading and doesn't take any attendance. You can't get a good grade even you are very hardworking.
>95 A+
>90 A
>85 A-
>80 B+
>70 B
>65 B-
>60 C+
>55 C
>50 C-
>=40 D
<40 F
reviews.comment_workload: There aren't many assignments, mostly 2 weeks per one assignment, which you could have plenty of time to finish it. However, it is really really hard to operate in classviva.

reviews.author: ffskw
reviews.title: Do not underestimate this course even you have M2 background...
reviews.comment_content: You can view other reviews for detailed content/topics of this course. It is unnecessary for me to copy and paste.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Lecture: The professor does not use any PowerPoint or online materials. He writes the notes and explains at the same time during the lecture which is actually quite interesting for me. However, his English pronunciations have to be improved... For example, he once pronounced "Consider" as "Concide". It is really confusing sometimes. It may be boring for some people since he does not make any jokes and focuses on teaching only.
Tutorial: My tutorial section didn't count any attendance but I still attended all of them
The TAs analyzed the homework problems and provide detailed solutions. Sometimes there are distinctive questions or questions with many variables which you may find difficult to finish the assignments with online calculators. So you may refer to the detailed solutions to do your assignments. All in all, I think the tutorial was kind of useful for me
reviews.comment_grading:
At first, I thought I could handle this course easily because I got both Core Maths and M2 level5 in HKDSE (May not be so excellent but decent for me), so I daydreamt a lot in lectures (you know, it is online learning, who else can focuses)
Here are some weightings for you to know:
Assignments (25%)
Final Exams (75%)
Assignments are web work (Class viva)
Final exams are MC questions but you cannot use any calculators, including the physical one. Exam is open-book
Assignment 99.86/100 (because I always use Symbolab)
Final exam 50-55%/100% (I don't remember exact)
Sorry, I don't remember the mean
I got a C grade
Well, I was too confident with my maths, so I thought I could handle it easily. I found out that I should have worked much harder.
So a friendly reminder, even though you did very well in HKDSE, you still have to make effort on this course. The exam-type questions are not identical to HKDSE. You still have to do some exercises to prepare for the exam. (But questions of the assignments are not really related to exam questions sometimes)
reviews.comment_workload:
Online assignment every week/ 2 week (Class viva)
There are around 10-15 questions on average for each assignment
I think it is fair. You can finish the assignments really quickly with online calculators such as Symbolab
I tried to do them without any online calculator and it took me around an hour

reviews.author: Bruck
reviews.comment_content:
Similar to M2
The course focuses a lot on the concept of maths such as the basic principle of integration.Those concepts were probably ignored by your secondary school's teacher.
The exam will test students on those concepts which is quite different from HKDSE.Getting a good grade in HKDSE M2 may not help as much as you think.
Basically:limit+differentiation+integration(up to substitution)
reviews.comment_teaching:
Li is a professor who loves using notability to teach.
His lecture notes is tidy and clear,so no worries about the lecture notes.
Sometimes he will use interesting examples to explain mathematical concepts(use monster as an example to explain dummy variable),it makes the lessons less boring.
He doesn't have a heavy mainland accent so I can understand 98% of what he is saying.
He is always willing to answer your email,but most of the time he will only provides you with hints.However,no worries cuz he will still answer your follow-up questions if u dun understand his hints or having other problems.
For tutorials,I will not suggest u to attend cuz the lecture notes and the notes on tutorial(will be provided on canvas) are already good enough for your revision.
Raising questions during the lecture is fine as he will answer your questions even if it is dumb(students keep asking how many questions in the final every lecture)
reviews.comment_grading:
Fair
The grading only consists of homework and exam.The distribution was like homework:20%,final:80%.
Homework:full,most students got full in this part.
Final:88/100,3 part,consist of 25? questions in total,each costs u 4 points
Final grade:A
I would say quite good(p.s it varies every semester)
reviews.comment_workload:
Fair
About 8 online homework on classviva throughout the whole semester.They are quite easy to handle as you have infinite chance to redo the questions so no worries if you get wrong.
Sometimes u will face difficult questions,but do not hesitate,just find your professor.
The time provided for the assignment is sufficient,about 2-3 weeks for each homework so u can finish them at a comfy pace.
There are extra exercise available on classviva.Do it if u suck or u will complain after the exam.For maths elite,just ignore them if u think u can handle the exam well.

reviews.comment_teaching: Professor Chang is very patient, he is willing to answer u any question in specific ways, and start from the fundamentals. Tho his english is a little hard to understand, he has got nice handwriting so u can understand his teaching anyway.
reviews.comment_grading:
The course uses absolute grading system, which it is really strict. The marks cutoff can be seen from the course webpage or somewhere in the faculty page, it is just one google away. I only know about the A range cutoff, which is abv 85, with 5 points a sub-range. Because we dont hv any midterm this semester, the grade directly count towards hw and finals. Most of the ppl get 100 at all hw, as u got unlimited chances to fill the hw.
Final :    0-1Q wrong --> A+
              2-3Q wrong --> A
              4-5Q wrong --> A-


just for reference: DSE M2 5* Maths 5* math 1013 A-

no midterm exams.
in final, the time is pretty enough, some question type will be really similar with the past papers and the hw. At least in my point of view it was not hard, because i studied m2.

reviews.comment_teaching:
This professor (YANG, Hui) did not receive good reviews in the previous years, so I was quite reluctant to attend his classes. However, I decided to give him a shot, but his teaching is just too plain and boring. The accent is quite hard to understand and he writes lecture notes which he uploads on the same day of teaching.

Instead, I decided to try joining LAM, Tsz Kin's classes, and it's very easy to hop between classes because of the online learning situation. So, just find someone who's registered in his classes, and save the link somewhere. Or, if you really want to be prepared, save the link for his class during the add/drop period, the links are made public during that time. I preferred Dr Lam's approach to teaching, and his English was much easier to understand. However, he does make plenty of careless mistakes when writing, so just watch out for that.
reviews.comment_grading:
25% assignments, 75% final

As you can see, there's a really heavy weighting on final, so you have to be super careful. A few careless mistakes could cost you subgrades. The finals this term had 26 multiple choice questions, divided into three parts. The average was 64.3% in my lecture section.
reviews.comment_workload: Only 8 assignments which are hosted on Classviva, which add up to 25% of the total grade. Quite easy to get a perfect score in the assignments component, if you're stuck on a question, just look it up on Google, they're quite easy to find. Don't worry about the number of attempts, they allow as many as you want and they pick the highest grade.

reviews.author: lkjhg222
reviews.comment_content:
Week 1 Review of the concepts of functions and graphs.
Week 2 Elementary functions.
Week 3 Tangent and velocity; the limit of  a function and limit laws.
Week 4 Continuity; limit at infinity; limit definition of derivative and rates of change.
Week 5 Derivatives of basic functions; differentiation rules.
Week 6 Chain rule and implicit differentiation.
Week 7 Rates and related rates.
Week 8 Linear approximation and differentials; Newton's method; Maximum and minimum values.
Week 9 Mean Value Theorem; derivatives and the shape of a graph; L'Hopital's Rule.
Week 10 Curve sketching; optimization problems.
Week 11 Antiderivatives; areas and distance travelled.
Week 12 Definite integrals; Fundamental Theorem of Calculus.
Week 13 Applications of integrals; substitution rule.
reviews.comment_teaching: useless but no attendance
reviews.comment_grading: 25%homework and 75%final.No mid-term
reviews.comment_workload: light

reviews.comment_content: 大致學返中學m2曬，limits, differentiation, integration 睇slides都跟到，冇midterm，final未知如何
reviews.comment_teaching: 勁重大陸口音，發音有少少難跟，但係侯生囡，個樣似學生，nice，有野問佢都應該會盡答，上堂100％跟ppt讀，班原本有85人，過咗2星期得返30左右
reviews.comment_grading: 未出

reviews.author: MifenHD
reviews.title: It's not a difficult class if you entered the class with a 3 in M2
reviews.comment_content: functions, trigonometry, continuity and differentiability, limits, application of both differentiation and integration, antiderivatives, definite integrals and fundamental theorem of calculus.
reviews.comment_teaching: Prof. Cai is a mainland lecturer with a strong mainland accent, so listening to him without fully understand the textbook is rather difficult at times. He also likes to read the book directly, albeit sometimes with some short explanation. It is a bit boring in general, but if you can stand the boredom of him reading the book, it will be fine.
reviews.comment_grading: If you have experience in differentiation and integration, having a high mark should be easy. Even if you haven't studied M2 in high school, the course isn't really that difficult so you should done well regardless of whether you took M2 in senior form or not.
reviews.comment_workload: The Classviva assignment are relatively short, with only 16 questions for the first 2 assignments. The homeworks are few and relatively far between, and as they can be attempted multiple times you should try to aim for getting 100% each since they do take up a portion of your final score.

reviews.author: HonNg
reviews.comment_content: Nothing special to mention about. It is all about sequences, integration skills, polar coordinates and vectors. Fairly basic.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Teaching with enthusiasm but ... I will be blunt here, the teaching is horrible.
The tutor, who is Walter Chan, is doing a good job.
Youtube could be a good teacher as well.
reviews.comment_grading:
VECTORS NOT INCLUDED
ONLINE EXAM
FINAL ONLY
Final Exam: 75/100 as I remember
Final score is around half SD above the mean
Letter grade: B
Really forgotten those figures sorry.
The grading sucks, but I think it is typical case in our school.
reviews.comment_workload: Weekly homework, need around 2-12 hours to finish, depend on your talent and ingenuity. Effort is usually useless by the way. Tutor helps a lot.

reviews.author: hahaust
reviews.title: MATH 1013 Course
reviews.comment_content:
Around fifty percent of the contents of MATH 1013 is overlapped with M2 syllabus and therefore M2 students may familiar with it. The integration except Riemann Sum is much easier than M2. Note that trigonometric substitution is NOT required for MATH 1013 students.
However, NO CALCULATOR is allowed during the exam. Thus, you cannot use program during the exam. DSE students may need some time to adopt.
Most topics such as:
- Inequalities
- e
- Finding derivatives by first principles
- Limits (like using sandwich theorem, L'Hospital Rule)
- asymptotes
- curve sketching
- Continuity
- Mean value theorem
- differentiation
- Implicit differentiation
- integration
- Riemann sum
reviews.comment_teaching:
A patent and helpful professor who is always willing to answer your question. However, some of the contents of MATH 1013 is overlapped with M2 syllabus and therefore M2 students may find it boring.

Lesson Structure: Derivation of formula => Application (like doing exercises)
reviews.comment_grading:
Poor?
Math 1013 adopt absolute grading system.
15% Classviva
35% Mid-term
50% Final

I got almost 95 marks in total but i can only get A rather than A+

Mid-term 95/100
Final 95/100
Homework: 100
reviews.comment_workload:
Huge
Homework: Around 1 Classviva (Online homework) per 1/2 week. You can attempt questions many times and therefore most of the students get full mark and the mean of homework is almost one hundred!  Remember do NOT finish your homework at the last minute since the system usually system broke down.

No attendance is required for any lecture and tutorials

Exam: For mid term, M2 students should feel comfortable about it since almost half of the questions are related to M2 syllabus. Because of having online lesson, all the final question are in MC format. There are total 20 questions and ONE question can determine one sub !

Functions
Limits and L'hopital Rule
Differentiation and Application

reviews.comment_teaching: Poor accent, poor teaching. You are god if you can understand his English. Drop or swap if you encounter this professor.
reviews.comment_grading:
Homework: full (15%)
Midterm: 79/100 (35%)
Final: 75/100 (50%)
Overall: 80.15%
Grade: B+
Absolute grading. Above 80 B+. Homework saves me from getting a B. So make sure you get full mark in homework.
reviews.comment_workload: Each homework for a topic. Bothersome but unlimited attempt, so try hard to get full mark. It might help you to get a subgrade higher.

reviews.author: Sahab
reviews.title: It sucks either way
reviews.comment_content:
Limit, differential calculus, and basic integral calculus. If you studied M2, you'd probably understood most of the content without attending any of the lectures or tutorials. Some concepts are new, e.g. squeeze theorem and L'hopital's rule but they are not that hard to use, as long as you are not pursuing a complete mathematical understanding of those theories. I heard it's a bit challenging for M1 students.

Either way, whether you find it boring or hard, you are most likely taking this class to fulfill the requirements so there is no way out.
reviews.comment_teaching:
I attended the first few lectures and I don't find it helpful in the sense of grasping mathematical concepts or examination skills. Prof. Cai is not good at answering questions clearly either, so good luck if you are stuck with him.

The tutorials are for completing worksheets which are meant to consolidate the understanding of those concepts, but they are far from enough to help with your exam.
reviews.comment_grading:
Webwork (15%)
Midterm (35%)
Final (50%)

Webwork on Classviva has unlimited attempts though they are not easy. So you might want to spare more time to complete the homework if you are aiming 100% correct.

Both midterm and final originally contains MC and long questions. They are not particularly hard but the questions are tricky. Past papers are your best friend in this regard. This semester's final is altered to only MC questions and is conducted online.

My scores:
Webwork: 99.88%
Midterm: 60%
Final: 75%
Total: 73.48%
Final Grade: B
reviews.comment_workload: Acceptable. Webwork due one to two weeks after the lecture. As long as you spare enough time to complete them, getting 80% correct shouldn't be hard. If stuck in one or two questions, copying the whole question to Google sometimes helps.

reviews.author: grindingalways
reviews.title: Good TA
reviews.comment_content: Most are covered in Hong Kong high school m2 syllabus. Only a few things such as Rolle's theorem are new, but these are not hard to understand if you have a good foundation.
reviews.comment_teaching:
I would mention the TA more because she is one of the best tutors I have ever met. For the professor, his teaching is OK and he often tries to explain the concepts in an in-depth way. Ofc it'll be appealing to certain people, but not for me cos I only want something that can tackle the problems in the exam. If you have the same mindset, you would find his lecture quite boring, and honestly I give up listening to him after a few lectures.

However, you would definitely like the TA's tutorial sessions. Her notes are so good: Clear outline, comprehensive and quite difficult exercises (some are adopted from past exams). The best part is when explaining the concepts or theorems, her notes can present in an easy-to-understand format, which is good enough for you to understand in order to cope with the exam. She also likes to check if there are any students encountering difficulty doing the questions, and is willing to answer any questions. So I always recommend that other people google her personal website which is public to access her tutorial notes in case you are not satisfied with your own prof/TA.
reviews.comment_grading:
Professor says the grading might change to curve grading instead of absolute grading. It is because of the change in exam format, which becomes around 20 MC questions for final in the end. So the grading is unclear for now.

*will update on the information after the release of grade

Update:
The grading scheme changes to curve grading. So someone who gets around 65% can get a B-, which would have been in C range when under absolute grading. But I guess this is only the case for my semester due to special social situations. It most likely will stick back to absolute grading afterwards.

HW (15%) = full marks
Midterm (35%) = 93/100
Final (50%) = 80/100
Outcome: 87.55% (mean is about 70% for my class section)
Final grade: A-
reviews.comment_workload: Quite heavy. I got Level 4 in m2 and I needed to take more time than others to familiarize myself with the content that I just wanted to get rid of. Anyway, doing the past papers definitely helps you grasp better the difficulty of exam. I also asked my frds who are very good at maths for homework problems. Please find some good study partners to carry you if your maths is not good.

reviews.author: hty253
reviews.title: switch to anyone else if your instructor is HU Jisan
reviews.comment_teaching:
Be prepared to 100% self-learning if you failed to swap to other instructors. I tried hard to attend every class at first and eventually acknowledged the reality that it is a waste of my time. Trust me, go sleep in the library will be a better option if you have no idea how to spend your time.

Apart from his accent and the fact that he often speaks Mandarin hence leaves all international students confused, the biggest problem is that he teaches in such an unclear, illogic, and un-systematized way. I learned ZERO from him.

The other thing that really irritated me is his attitude towards his teaching. When all other professors strived to provide high-quality online courses and spared no effort to keep us following up with the latest arrangement of the school under this unfortunate circumstance. Mr. HU Jishan did NOT offer a single piece of information, no learning materials, no recording videos, even no message like "Hey we're not going to have class tmr!" FOR 17 DAYS, that's nearly two and a half weeks ^_^ And incredibly, right after I complained about this via the school online survey on the very 16th day, he provided us with recording (= the lowest quality video I have ever seen) on the next day!!! Whoa, what a big surprise huh?

------
(for the self-learning part)
Find out the topics you are required to learn on the homework page and go learn them from khan academy. It is totally enough for 1013. I had zero knowledge in calculus before and got 84 (mean 58.4) in mid-term with the help of khan academy only.
reviews.comment_grading: Fair grading, all based on the absolute score (mid-term, final, and assignments.)
reviews.comment_workload: There are 8 assignments this semester, which you can try as many times as you wish before the deadline. The overall workload is acceptable.
