Limits, differentiation, curve sketching, integration.... which are just like M2 things but more detail and proof taught (although not required in exam). New things are just linear approximation, Newton's method, L'hopital's rule... which are some basic concept of differentiation actually.

However for those taking M1, good luck because u simply need to learn half the M2 syllabus in one semester.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Mr. Lam taught in very detail and slowly. He is also willing to answer student's question in class or after class. His teaching is quite good and precise. But for M2 student it may be a little bit slow...

Most importantly, he will upload both his notes and handwriting notes to a website for people to download and see so even if you missed one or two, u could just learn it back yourself.
reviews.comment_grading:
If you have really taken some classes and revised a bit before the exam, getting A range grade should not be a problem.
However, i would say the exam test you one or two hard questions and most of them are pretty easy but requires very careful calculating. Some questions are just tricky like limits and the graph so you need to be sure to really understand those concept in deep.

It contains both MC and long question.
reviews.comment_workload:
A webwork per week or per two week. Not so heavy because only few questions are difficult and you could still solve it by searching online or asking Mr. Lam. Other questions are just basic concept.

Other than that, no other work is required so i would think it is low workload.

reviews.author: fungshum
reviews.title: Easy if u hv studied M2
reviews.comment_content: From function to integration by substitution and include some new topic like Riemann sum, but mostly are the syllabus in secondary school. If u hv studied M2 before, it's not a big problem.
reviews.comment_teaching: No comment becoz I attended the first lecture only in the whole semaster. Tutorial depends on ur tutor.
reviews.comment_grading:
Absolute grading is used in this course. It means
below 40% - F
40-54% - D
55-69% - C range
70-85% - B range
above 85% - A

webwork: 15%
mid term: 35%
Final: 50%

i hv studied M2 in secondary school. Mid term and final only revised a few hrs, both got 71 marks(sad), at last got a B. Nth special.
reviews.comment_workload: Webwork only , for me webwork is very easy. This 15 marks is not difficult to get.

reviews.author: PhockYourMom
reviews.title: Awesome
reviews.comment_content:
The content was actually very well organized as compared with other classes. Lecturer goes very systematically according to his slides and the textbook is well-aligned with class content.

However, there is a lack of exercise given by lecturer in class which makes practice for complicated contents inadequate.


If you suck at math, ain't nothing can help yo butt for A+ brah
reviews.comment_teaching:
The teaching style of professor is very orderly. There is always an explanation to every line in the notes and the professor will not skip any parts and always ensure his students pay attention in lessons. His major pet peeve is using the mobile phone in class.


If you suck at math, ain't nothing can help yo butt for A+ brah
reviews.comment_grading:
Grading is really bad for as the mean for every examination is really high. The assignments are all expected to score 100% in order to secure a better grade.

If you suck at math, ain't nothing can help yo butt for A+ brah


Grading is really bad for as the mean for every examination is really high. The assignments are all expected to score 100% in order to secure a better grade.
reviews.comment_workload:
Workload is acceptable. There is little/ no class exercises but assignments are okay if you are doing it with your groupmates. Acceptable workload, overal

Grading is really bad for as the mean for every examination is really high. The assignments are all expected to score 100% in order to secure a better grade.

reviews.author: Peterleung
reviews.comment_content:
主要係微積分 但個基本上由零開始咁教
一開始又教一大輪graph and function >tangent to the curve
搞勁耐都唔直接教differentiation同integration
中間又夾雜d睇落冇乜用但又要你記嘅theorem
對於全部都讀過m1/m2嘅學生黎講 我覺得好浪費時間
強烈建議睇左notes先決定去唔去聽lecture

程度同中學m1/m2差唔多(或者深少少
midterm唔太難 final就幾難嘅 真係要花d時間做數先會過mean
reviews.comment_teaching:
lecture極悶 prof係同一個課題停留極耐 又不斷講解好多條好類似嘅examples 某程度上係將條式/steps無限拆細 簡單複雜化 唔會幫你明到條式

tutorial可以自己衡量去唔去 睇得明lecture notes嘅話可以skip
reviews.comment_grading: final above mean ~1sd : A-
reviews.comment_workload: ~2星期1次homework, 十幾條數, 無限次attempt,答錯唔扣分, 總之你最後答岩就得

reviews.author: Rubyy
reviews.comment_content:
mostly m2 stuffs
a bit different for m1 students
have to pay effort to do exercises if you want to have good grades
reviews.comment_teaching:
not bad but not clear English
the notes given is a bit messy and too much words so a bit difficult to get the key points
ta is good
always willing to explain
reviews.comment_grading:
absolute grading
depends on how much effort you would like to pay
no iprs so attendance is not counted
reviews.comment_workload:
only mid term and final without quizzes
you can choose to finish the tutorial assignment or not
but have to finish the web work

reviews.author: car1704
reviews.comment_content:
This is an introductory course in one-variable calculus. Topics include functions and graphs, limits of functions and continuity, derivatives and their applications, basic indefinite and definite integrals.

This course is quite difficult for those who don't have strong mathematics background or strong passion for math.
reviews.comment_teaching: Professor Li's teaching is quite boring and is not very helpful to our study as he always assumes everyone has strong mathematics knowledge so he is not willing to explain maths problems which he thinks as "easy". Many of his students skip his classes and attend another better professor, Professor LAM, Tsz Kin's classes as attendance will not be taken.
reviews.comment_grading:
It adopts an absolute grading system and the mean is about C+ to B-.

Homework 15%
Midterm Exam 35%
Final Exam 50%
The mean for both Midterm and Final are 60 something.

F < 40% < D < 50% < C’s < 70% < B’s < 85% < A’s
reviews.comment_workload: If you got 5* or below in M1 or 5 or below in M2, you will need to work quite hard in this course and do a lot of practice problems.

reviews.author: lvis
reviews.comment_content: Around 70% similar to DSE M2 content, including limit,differentiation,graphing function integration. Midterm should be okay for those who have studied M2. After midterm, new things are taught like Linear approximation and differentials,Mean value theorem,L'Hopital's rule
reviews.comment_teaching: The professor prove and explain every theorem, but a little bit difficult to hear what he is talking about because of his ascent. Handwritten notes are uploaded to canvas after each lesson. Can ask question in class or through canvas and he will answer during class
reviews.comment_grading:
Absolute grading
85%- 100% = a range
70%- 85% = b range
50%- 70% = c range
below 50% = d range

WebWork: 15%
Mid-term Exam: 35%
Final Exam: 50%

WebWork has unlimited attempts and remember to do all the WebWork to ensure good grade
reviews.comment_workload: Should be fair to those who have studied M2, basically is about doing WebWork on time and be careful in Midterm and exam. Not that difficult at all

reviews.author: franky
reviews.comment_content: It’s not so hard for those who have already learned calculus in high school
reviews.comment_teaching: It’s most about solving problems, however, it’s quite important to make sure that you’ve been to every tutorial lesson to get the problem lists and answers.
reviews.comment_grading: If you attend most of the classes and be focus in class you can probably pass this course. But if you want a good grade you still need to do adequate practices. Some mid-term and final exam question comes from the content of class or tutorials.
reviews.comment_workload: Just a few webwork

reviews.author: hsluk
reviews.title: Normal grading
reviews.comment_content: Most of the contents are DSE level, if you have a good grade in DSE it should be very easy to handle.
reviews.comment_teaching: Voice of the lecturer is quite powerful to get you feel sleepy, I always fallen into sleep during lessons.
reviews.comment_grading: Most of the time is self-study only attend lessons in first two weeks. My score just hit the mean which is around 70% and got a B-. I think it is fair enough.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is very reasonable just need to finish webwork, you can do it all at once before the deadline, just need a day can finish it.

reviews.author: kkkcaz
reviews.comment_content: content was difficult, but the class is worth the effort
reviews.comment_teaching: powerpoint notes are log and mundane, just like every single other ust course self study is implied
reviews.comment_grading: gradign was similar to that of UST standard, however, due to the diffiuclt content I suppose a lot of students didnt do well in the exams. It is important to finish the only maths assignment to get a pass, but those are not difficult if one seeks help from your friends and will be able to finish it.
reviews.comment_workload: workload was not a lot, but self study is much required

reviews.author: AndyCat
reviews.title: normal result
reviews.comment_content: Basic calculus. Require only DSE level of M2 skill.
reviews.comment_teaching: The notes of the instructor are very useful. You can completely rely on the notes and do not need a maths book. The exercise is also enough for us to practise.
reviews.comment_grading: Not as good as I expect. However, it is equal to the effort you have paid.
reviews.comment_workload: It is acceptable. Need to complete an assignment every week. It is not enough to get a good gade just by doing the weekly assignment. You need to do the out of class exercise by yourself.

reviews.author: setjawardaja
reviews.title: MATH 1013 Comprehensive Review
reviews.comment_content: The content is related to university students and really useful. In this course, you will study about Calculus IB, such as derivative and integral.
reviews.comment_teaching:
YE, Guibo is a really good teacher and has a good English although she is from Mainland China. She always gives students to try to solve the problem, before she reveals the true answer. I would rate her A+ if I could.
However, the tutorial class is not satisfactory at all.
reviews.comment_grading: The Multiple-choice question is not that hard. Usually, there are 13 question in Mid-term Examination and Final Examination. But in the other part, they won't give you some extra points if you fail to give a true final answer. They will not care about the other bullshit that you write on the paper. However, the positive side of the grading is that they do not care about the attendance record. So, you can always study by yourself or with your friends.
reviews.comment_workload: There are Mid-term Examination, Final Examination, and 9 Homework. The homework will be provided online, through the HKUST Math Website. The Homework is pretty easy actually because we have an infinite number of attempt. For the Mid-term Examination and Final Examination, usually, they give one past paper for you. You can download the other past paper by yourself in the petergao.net

reviews.author: m31
reviews.comment_content:
content is similar to high school calculus. limits, function, differentiation, FTC, integration, Newton's Method, Critical Point, Rolle's Theorem, L'Hopital Rule, Reimann Sum etc.
it might be very difficult for you if you have a weaker understanding of how graphs work and how differentiation is related to graphs.
but be careful, for after the midterm, things start to get pretty hard. so slacking off would be a terrible idea.
reviews.comment_teaching: lectures are super boring. I almost fell asleep in every class. Professor goes through the ppt notes and solves the answer- that's it. no attendance required. But tutorials are pretty great. Dr Wang Jingjing's tutorial is great, so are the notes. just go through the tutorial notes on her website and you're good to go.
reviews.comment_grading:
semi absolute grading. exams only have MCs and long questions.
15% WebWork 35% Mid-term 50% Final
Total score
85-100%-->A range
70-85%-->B range
50-70%-->C range
40-50%-->D
0-40%-->Fail
reviews.comment_workload: Workload isn't much. around 9 webwork homeworks; you get infinite chances for each homework so that's that. MSC is always there to help you out.

reviews.author: Sam ng
reviews.comment_content:
not that difficult, secondary school level plus a little bit extra things.
M2 things, like integration, diffiriation, application of integration and so om.
reviews.comment_teaching: l miss most of the classes and study by myself. Even though l study by myself, l can learn that knowledge from youtube or khan academy. So, attending classes is not that essential.
reviews.comment_grading:
absolute grading like
>85% ~ A
>70% ~ B
>60% ~ C
l guess.
reviews.comment_workload: Fair, one webwork s week. The level is fair as well. You can do it if u understand the content required in this course.

reviews.author: Ivan hulk
reviews.comment_content:
Chapter 1 Functions And Models
Chapter 2 Limits And Derivatives
Chapter 3 Differentiation Rules
Chapter 4 Applications Of Differentiation
Chapter 5 Integrals

If you study M1 in secondary school, you will find it quite hard to catch up because the content of this course is far more than what you have learnt in DSE.
Some special highlights: trigo differentiation, implicit differentiation, Mean Value Theorem, Curve sketching etc.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Lam Tsz Kin is a very friendly teacher.
He uses various examples to talk about the concepts behind and is willing to answer students' questions.
However, what he teaches are not the question types or main points that the exam will cover.
Tutorial is more important.
reviews.comment_grading:
The grading system is fair because it is absolute grading.
The grading mainly composed of your Homework, mid-term and final exam.

Warm Reminders: You should work hard on your homework because you can get full mark if you put effort into it. It is also quite easy to get high marks in mid-term exam if you work hard. The final is comparatively more difficult but the marking is loose.
reviews.comment_workload: Fair. Online homework around once per week.

reviews.author: wzbn
reviews.title: Good course
reviews.comment_content: It's simple. Just some basic calculus. Such as functions, LH's rule, mean value theorem,  derivatives and antiderivatives, chain and inverse, and so on.
reviews.comment_teaching: I like TK Lam, he gave lots of examples, making it easy to understand. He also used many body language to express, which is really interesting. : )
reviews.comment_grading: You can easily get A or A- if you take it seriously, but A+ is more difficult, you need to be careful on midterm and final.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is not heavy. Only 1 midterm, 1 final and 9 homework. You have unlimited try on homework.

reviews.author: zack0617
reviews.comment_content:
Basic mathematics staff for university study:
fuction, limits, continuity, differentiation and integration. M2 in secondary school covers some topics like limits, techniques and some application of differetiation and antiderivatives.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Normal speed, not difficult to follow.
The examples in note are thought-provoking.
The instructor seems to be a bit nervous sometimes
reviews.comment_grading:
9 WebWork Assignments 15% ( Some difficult, need source)
Midterm Exam                  35%
Final Exam                       50%

Provisional grading scale:
A-range: > 85%
B-range: > 70%
C-range: > 50%
D > 40%
F <= 40%
reviews.comment_workload: Very light. WebWork is the only work to be done every week. Each webwork provides 9-17 questions for student to practice. Most of the webwork question are fill in the blanks, and some MC question. The WebWork has an installed equation calculator. You are allowed to type in long strings of number and operators. You need not use a calculator for most question.

reviews.author: Kennychan16
reviews.comment_content:
The course is not very difficult if you keep study and do exercise

Calculus. Half DSE-M2 stuff, half new things. Good luck if you are M1.
Here's a list(not complete) of non-M2 stuffs in this course:
Continuity, Differentiability, Intermediate Value Theorem, Mean Value Theorem, 'one-to-one' function, Solving problems with absolute functions, Sandwich(Squeeze) Theorem, Linear Approximation, Newton's Method, Critical Point, Rolle's Theorem, L'Hopital Rule, Reimann Sum, Fundamental Theorem of Calculus(A little more things than DSE M2)
reviews.comment_teaching: Li Dong will not cover the basic content very much, he will spend most of the time discussing the difficult questions.
reviews.comment_grading:
Standard grading, cant make any careless mistake if you want to get A range.

Total score
85-100%-->A range
70-85%-->B range
50-70%-->C range
40-50%-->D
0-40%-->Fail
reviews.comment_workload:
Nearly zero workload. Just some extremely easy online exercise

Homework: Basically 1 WebWork(Online homework) per week, each consists of 10-18 questions. Apart from the first one you will need 2-4 hours to finish one, not very heavy workload. You can attempt questions infinitely many times , so try your best to get full marks in them!
No attendance required for any lecture and tutorials
Exam: Do your best in the relatively simple mid-term to secure a better grade earlier. All contents will appear in final exam, so don't forget to practice on evaluating limits for the final. I focused too much on integration and didn't do a single question of limits before the final, so I lose at least 9 marks on some relatively simple limit MCs, sigh~~Homework: Basically 1 WebWork(Online homework) per week, each consists of 10-18 questions. reviews.comment_grading: The grading is acceptable but you have to pay effort. As this course is absolute grading, the more effort you pay, the higher grade you can get. It just depends on how hard-working you are.

reviews.author: Angel1ca
reviews.title: Unnecessarily Difficult Course
reviews.comment_content: The course is so disorganized, making it unnecessarily difficult to learn a material that has largely been taught in most countries' high school. But I heard some teachers and TAs are very well organized and provides lecture notes that are very helpful, I was just unlucky I guess.
reviews.comment_teaching: Her english pronunciation needs work, and its a bit difficult to pay attention to her for extended periods of time. But she tries and you can always come to her after class for questions, or you can make an appointment to meet with her before exams. Overall she's a nice person but not a great teacher.
reviews.comment_grading: Don't remember the exact percentages but I HATE THAT ITS ABSOLUTE GRADING idk why they think it's a good idea to give a difficult course absolute grading, i mean, most ppl won't do very well but with curve grading at least the average scorers will be guaranteed a B range. But at least I'm pretty happy with my final grade, I'm not very good at math and I got a B-.
reviews.comment_workload: We only have one webwork per week (if i remember correctly). So, its not that bad.

reviews.author: Tina Yeh
reviews.title: So so so easy
reviews.comment_content: (This is more accurate for students from mainland and Taiwan) I learned most of the content in high school. All I needed to do is to memorize the English vocabularies of the mathematics concepts. A class that cost me almost no time :)
reviews.comment_teaching: The teacher is very nice, patient and willing to listen to students' questions during class. He always writes down everything he says, and upload the notes on canvas, so it is totally the same to listen to the lecture and read the notes on my own. He speaks fluent Cantonese, Mandarin and English, so there is no language barrier when interacting with him!
reviews.comment_grading: It is absolute grading. Not by curve. There are only some webwork assignments with infinite attempts (you should get full mark on this!!!) and two exams for grading, so it is very important to score high in both exams to guarantee yourself a good grade!
reviews.comment_workload: Only some webworks which only require you to type in the correct answers (no process needed!). Almost no workload la :)))

Calculus. Half DSE-M2 stuff, half new things. Good luck if you are M1.

reviews.author: W.CCL
reviews.title: Done math1013
reviews.comment_content:
I studied M1 in DSE
contents of this course is simply the advanced version of M1 except a few
So don't trust anyone if they tell you that you're gonna get rekt by students who studied M2 in DSE
This course is not hard at all
I didn't go to any of the classes except for the first three weeks and I only did revision one day before the mid-term and final. It turned out to be a closely A- B+
reviews.comment_teaching: Sorry I didn't attend many lectures to tell
reviews.comment_grading:
Absolute grading, very good grade
You don't have to revise if you aim for a B range. You may need to do some if you wanna go for an A range.
It is impossible to attain a C range so chill down if you have been pre-assigned in this course. This course will probably pull up your GPA in the first semester.
reviews.comment_workload:
This course has only a few webworks, approximately 18, and you are only required to do one in around one week. In each webwork, you only have to do around 14 questions.
So the workload in this course is very low. Be grateful if you have this course in your timetable

reviews.author: unclemosaic
reviews.title: Good course and don't worry about ur grade
reviews.comment_content: Largely related to M2 in high school with additional knowledge. In the exam will be mainly focus in those newly taught knowledge. Such as Newton's method ,squeeze theorem ,L’Hospital’s rule and Intermediate value theorem.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Mr Lam teaching is kinda boring and sometimes made mistakes in his teaching without knowing it. However if you brain can't run fast, Mr Lam will be ur best choice because he speaks slow.
Mr Hu teaching is absolutely awful, he can't speak English well and hardly understand what he is saying. But his notes and supplementary materials are useful for exam and he is nice to answer your questions. And please do not take his course.
reviews.comment_grading:
Absolute grading and work hard so that you can get a good grade
Add oil :)
reviews.comment_workload: Every week will have an assignment in webwork and some additional questions in tutorial not hard and just a practice for you

reviews.author: dkslxk
reviews.comment_content: Mainly M2 related things with a little bit of M1 stuff. A lot of M1 students struggle with it because they do not even have basic dse knowledge of M2 so I feel like this course does not take into account the needs of different students.
reviews.comment_teaching: Teaching is good since the concepts are well-explained with details and the professor is really patient and helpful and is willing to answer any question you have. The tutorials in my opinion are more useful than lectures as they explain stuff with more details. Lectures seem quite useless since you will not understand and you cannot ask questions directly.
reviews.comment_grading: Grading is not according to the normal distribution table so your marks will not be affected by how bad or good other students are so I like it since there are so many smart people taking this course. 15% from webwork which you can get quite easily. 35% mid-term and 50% final. I would say final is a bit better than the mid-term but still really hard.
reviews.comment_workload:
Not a lot of workload. Just need to do webwork every 1 to 2 weeks.
As long as you spend appropriate time doing the webwork, you will not feel burdened.

reviews.author: I love ust <3<3
reviews.comment_content:
DSE M2 stuffs, including functions, limit, differentiation, and a small part of integration.
I studied M1 for my DSE, but 1013 is not that hard for M1 students, you just have to learn the derivates and integrals of trigonometric functions and nothing more.
For limit, we have to check whether the limit exist with just looking at its left-hand and right-hand limit, not that hard but would be a bit strange at first since it is different form what we have learnt in high school.
For differentiation, nothing special, very standard differential calculus.
For integration, this course will only cover from common integrals to u-substitution only, either M1 or M2 students should be familiar with it. The only thing new to M1 students is integrating trigonometric functions.
No any rigorous definitions are covered in this course, if you are interested in maths, you should take 1023 instead.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Dr. Hu is very nice, questions are always welcomed. He always stays until 1830 to answer students' questions where the class is ended at 1750.
He would remind you to do webwork before the deadline.
But his classes are quite boring, it seems like he is doing maths by himself but shouting it out only. Also, his english pronunciation is drastically poor, i could barely understand what he is talking about without looking at his handout.
He writes on the papers with the visualizer projecting his handwriting during classes, they are just content from textbook.
-
He would upload a ppt file on canvas after each lesson, it would be a digital form of his handout, look at it when you don't understand his handwriting.
He would also upload a check list for what you should know before the final exam, it is ABSOLUTELY USEFUL for your revision.
-
He also taught something that are out of syllabus, such as the epsilon-delta language (in the syllabus of 1023) and topology (his research area). If you are not gonna take maths as major, just ignore it is ok. It won't be examined.
reviews.comment_grading:
Absolute grading.
85% or above = A range
70%-84% = B range
50-69% = C range
-
The grade for this course is fair, it is not that hard to get a "B".
reviews.comment_workload: Webwork only, and it's easy. Finish it when you feel boring. If you are not good at math, you still have unlimited attempts, so don't worry about webwork.

reviews.author: purpscerp
reviews.comment_content: Basic Math / Calculus. Found it to not be horrible, as the material overlapped with a lot of math from high school (ie. derivatives/inverse functions/differentiation/etc..)
reviews.comment_teaching: Great professor who is very eloquent and capable of speaking english. Knew about the topics in depth, and is really good at iterating through concepts. Accent can be tough at times, but their competency in the subject and clarity when teaching makes it worth going to lecture. Would definitely recommend taking it with this prof.
reviews.comment_grading:
15% WebWork 35% Mid-term 50% Final

Found grading to be fair.
reviews.comment_workload: Web works are simple to handle and studying for exams is not the worst. Make sure you really understand concepts.

reviews.author: KPY
reviews.comment_content:
75% DSE M2 contents, eg limits, differentiation, integration.
25% new contents, eg Linear approximations, Newton's Method, Mean Value Theorem, L'Hopital's rule...
reviews.comment_teaching:
Instructor is from mainland so HK students may hard to hear what he said because of his accent.
Always ask students whether he is correct or not and he sometimes cannot answer student's questions.
Sometimes randomly pick students to answer examples in the lesson.
reviews.comment_grading:
Absolute grading
100% ≥ A+/A/A- ≥ 85%, > B+/B/B- ≥ 70%, > C+/C/C- ≥ 50% > D ≥ 40% > F
15% webwork
(easy to get full mark because you can answer infinitely)
35% mid-term
50% final exam
Easy to get A range for M2 students and nds.
Not fair to M1 students because they did not study differentiation and integration of trigonometric functions but M2 students and nds studied before
reviews.comment_workload:
light workload
total 9 webwork
10-15 questions each webwork

reviews.author: victorcheung
reviews.comment_content:
Most topics are covered in HKDSE M2
Limit, differentiation and application, integration
Some are not taught in M2(or just a little), including:
Function, continuity, differentiability, definition of integration (Riemann Sum), intermediate value theorem, mean value theorem
Basically, it is a very easy course as you have learned most of the content in secondary school
But the most important difference (not related to content but worth mentioning) is that NO calculator is allowed
reviews.comment_teaching:
Dr Hu's pronunciation is not very good, but normal students should have no problem to follow what he said in the lecture
Sometimes talk about contents not required in the course (eg rigorous definition of limit, application of IVT using example in topology), but just forget what he said is okay
Vey willing to answer students' questions, no matter face-to-face or by email
reviews.comment_grading:
15% Webwork
35% Midterm
50% Final
Me: webwork 450/450, midterm 99/100, final 96/100
overall 97.65, A+
It is quite hard to get A+ as the cutoff is really high (seems to be 95 as one of my friends get 94 overall and get A), and therefore there is nearly no room for error
But if you can complete your webwork on your own, A range should be quite easy
reviews.comment_workload:
one webwork every one or two weeks and nothing else
most importantly, you have infinite attempts to do all the questions and no marks will be deduced if you attempt a question for more than one time

reviews.author: Ricky1320
reviews.comment_content:
M2 野+ 少少新野(難既有fundamental theorem of calculus,riemann sum, mean value theorem同L'Hôpital's rule)
但concept 比M2 再深入少少 尤其係limit 但如果d 野你係真係明就冇咩大問題 我 DSE M2 係自修(睇herman yeung )都catch up 到, 但如果你係M1 既朋友就可能要再曬多d 時間温埋M2 d 野
reviews.comment_teaching: 淨係上過一堂lecture 所以唔知教成點 淨係上tutorial 都夠學既~同埋做webwork 都夠清concept
reviews.comment_grading:
absolute grading 冇咩好講
我就覺得今年份卷都幾簡單 易左拎高grade

grading 就
> 85% A range
>70% B range
C range 個堆唔太清楚
我overall ~93% 拎A 聽聞A+ 要>97%先有
for reference 我M2 level 5
reviews.comment_workload:
如果你係學過M2既話都幾少workload 始終對你黎講學d 野少d
堂可以走曬 成個sem好似有~12份webwork 倒
M1 人可能workload 相對會大少少既 但應該都唔會太大既 始終其實M2 calculus 個方面都唔係真係好多野讀
總括而言 workload 都因人而異既 但應該唔會太大 始終係3 credits 既科

reviews.author: gotoschoolbybus
reviews.title: 讀過M2唔係大曬
reviews.comment_content:
Basically 有70%都係M2入面學過 30%係M2冇既內容
但係對比起DSE M2 1013更重於CONCEPT上 而唔係重計算
所以要改一下MATHS學習模式
reviews.comment_teaching:
雖然唔係堂堂都有上齊曬
但係我覺得佢教得真係唔錯
D CONCEPT解釋得好清楚 好易明

個人覺得tutorial 可以學到好多野,同埋仲可以有練習拎黎做,所以個人覺得走leture都唔好走tutorial
reviews.comment_grading:
Webwork:15%
mid term:35%
FInal:50%

本身DSE M2得5 以為好多都識 就冇咩點溫 最後
mid term:74/100 (mean66.68)
Final:79/100 (70.38)
Hw:9/9
overall:80.4%
最後B+
其實幾好Grade 不過就真係唔好掉易輕心 真係要操下數 明下D concept 如果唔係做得好.
有個朋友DSE M2 都係5 但係佢完全冇溫 最後得C 所以有付出就會有回報
同埋個人覺得 tutorial 學得多野D 好似有用個leture
reviews.comment_workload:
其實真係冇咩做
一星期一份WEBWORK 仲要唔難
唔識可以去MSC問
不過係要得閒就做下數咁 如果唔係mid term final 就未必可以有好GRADE

reviews.author: WPY
reviews.title: 大部分M2野
reviews.comment_content:
啲嘢好易 中學有讀過M2既輕輕鬆鬆啦
除左有幾個point係新野 其他都係M2學過既
不過考得唔深 理解到嗰一兩條式就OK啦
reviews.comment_teaching:
我個prof.好幽默都幾鍾意上佢堂
不過就無去其他堂比較啦
reviews.comment_grading:
absolutely grading
grading係可以自己計算到
所以啲mean同sd都唔係好緊要
hw可以無限咁做/錯 所以唔駛擔心
hw100/100 佔20%定係15%唔係好記得
mid-term 86/100 佔30%定35%
final 86/100 佔50%
overall A-
reviews.comment_workload:
過一段時間就會有online hw
啲嘢好簡單 好快就可以做完 不過有啲題目比較tricky
要記得check同埋建議一出就做 唔係既話唔記得做少左啲分都幾心痛下
workload唔大 考試都唔係好難所以溫書都唔駛用好多時間做啲pp就得

reviews.author: cwyyy
reviews.title: DO NOT reg Professor Li
reviews.comment_content:
Everyone who studied M1/M2 needs to take this course.
Basically most are M2 materials.
Some new concepts included such as L'Hopital's Rule, implicit differentiation and inverse function.
reviews.comment_teaching: Do not reg this professor!!! He speaks so fast like he assumes you know everything to be taught in class. I have no clue for what he is talking during lesson. Going to tutorial section and doing exercise by yourself is definitely more useful than going to lecture session.
reviews.comment_grading:
I can't tell whether the course is absolute grading or not, but I think grading is proportional to how much effort you paid in this course.
I studied M1 in my secondary school and did put a lot of time and effort in doing exercise.
Full marks for all 9 webwork (15%).
Midterm (35%): 71/100 (mean: 70.89/100)
Final (50%): 76/100 (mean: 64.78/100)
Final grade: B
Good enough for me. I am not a maths genius.
Practice makes perfect. Work hard if you want to get good grades.
reviews.comment_workload:
Not a big deal. Only 9 webwork throughout the whole semester.
If you have any questions, you can always approach the TAs or simply go to the Maths Support Center for help.
Don't miss the webwork. It's easy for you to gain this 15% of the course!!!

reviews.author: cylam
reviews.title: Lecture good for building up right concepts, but tutorial ...
reviews.comment_content:
U can find it here.
http://www.math.ust.hk/~tklam/Math1013/

Students aced M2 in dse should have no problem at least for midterm. Most of them are included in dse curriculum.
Final is quite difficult though even for M2 students.
reviews.comment_teaching:
The lecturer spoke softly so students at the back may not hear clearly.
The lecture is easy to follow but the notes as he demonstrated step by step.
The lecture notes uploaded is quite messy though, it takes time to follow if u miss the class.

For the tutorial class, we went through WebWork and midterm questions.
He faced to the board all the time and u need to prepare the questions print-out so as to know what he is doing.
So I think it is ur personal decision on whether attending the class.
He sent email quite often so that we can have the latest information anything related to the class. It is easy to find him although I have never find him.
reviews.comment_grading:
The grading is reasonable but the final is hard af and I didn't do well.

Ref:
I scored a 3 in dse, without much practice
Do work hard in mt and final. Mt above mean ~0.5s.d., final below mean ~0.5s.d. turns out having a C+.
reviews.comment_workload:
Reasonable. Practice makes perfect.
The difficulty is slightly above that of mt and final but it help clear concepts.

reviews.author: Jackie0925
reviews.title: Very poor grading
reviews.comment_content:
Week 01:
1.1 Review of functions,
1.2 Representing functions,
1.3 Inverse, exponential and logarithmic functions
Week 02:
1.4 Trigonometric functions and their inverses,
2.1 The idea of limits,

Week 03:

2.4 Infinite limits,

Week 04:
3.1 Introducing the derivatives,
3.2 Rules of differentiation
Week 05:
3.2 Rules of differentiation,
3.3 The product and quotient rules,
3.4 Derivatives of trigonometric functions,
3.5 Derivatives as rates of change,
3.6 The chain rule
Week 06:
3.7 Implicit differentiation,
3.8 Derivatives of logarithmic and exponential functions,
3.9 Derivatives of inverse trigonometric functions
Week 07:
3.10 Related rates,
4.1 Maxima and minima
Week 08:
4.2 What derivatives tell us,
4.3 Graphing functions,
4.4 Optimization problems
Week 09:
4.5 Linear approximation and differentials,
4.6 Mean value theorem,
4.7 L'Hopital's rule
Week 10:
4.8 Newton's method (*),
4.9 Antiderivatives
Week 11:

5.2 Definite integrals
Week 12:
5.3 Fundamental theorem of calculus,
5.4 Working with integrals
Week 13:
5.5 Substitution rule

For M1 students, the course is hard af!
reviews.comment_teaching: Li Dong's teaching is so difficult to understand. Lam Tsz Kin is much better.
reviews.comment_grading:
poor grading!!!
M1 students are hard to compete with nds and M2 students. If you are M1 student, you are so likely to get a C-range grade. The exams are too challenging for me, maybe just because I am weak.
reviews.comment_workload: Not much workload. Only 9 webwork.

reviews.author: peterpan
reviews.comment_content: very basic stuff covered in dse m1/m2, as well as some new concepts and theorems which is fundamental in calculus including squeeze theorem, l'hopitals rule and fundamental theorem of caluclus
reviews.comment_teaching: very detailed explanation at a reasonable speed, with quite a lot of examples explaining different concepts and theorems
reviews.comment_grading: absolute grading, very easy to get a pass with the basic concepts you've learnt in dse syllabus, grades would be good as long as you understand the concepts clearly
reviews.comment_workload: a total of 9 webwork homework in this semester, usually 1 per week, with midterm and final examination

reviews.author: Kabe
reviews.comment_content: Very basic stuff, functions, limit, differentiation and its application, IVT, MVT, and basic integration, just Riemann sum and substitution. I believe more half of it is covered in M2.
reviews.comment_teaching: Honestly I do not really attend lesson that much, even if so, I am just playing with my laptop. However he taught quite good according to my classmate. The tutorial section provide a lot of exercise and the tutor post them online along with the solution which is great in my opinion.
reviews.comment_grading:
WebWork 15%
Midterm 35%
Final 50%
Many people claim that this course is absolute grading but I doubt it as the class size is really big(around 1100 students). However I can't tell whether the grading is absolute or not as I do not collect every data in the class (at least those boundary one). But the provisional grading is
A range:85%~100%
B range:70%~85%
C range:50%~70%

For me, I get full credit in assignment (basically everyone should be).
Midterm: 96/100
Final: 93/100
Finally 95.1/100, and I get an A+.
reviews.comment_workload:
9 WebWork assignment in total, each contains around 10 questions or more. I will not say the workload is very low, but you can always use WolframAlpha to help you and those WebWork can be finished very quickly except some tricky questions. There are unlimited chances to answer WebWork question in 1013, so everyone should get full credit.

For midterm and final, you need some practice to help you get familiarized with the type of questions in the exam which require a day or two each time before the exam. Doing the past paper and tutorial notes before exam can help you get through the exam.

reviews.author: Rsternyin
reviews.title: Just don't reg this guy's course if you rely on teaching in lessons
reviews.comment_content:
- Number, inequalities and absolutes, basic functions and graphs, composite functions, exponential function.
- Trigonometric functions, inverse functions, logarithmic functions, inverse trigonometric functions
- Tangent and velocity, the limit of a function, limit laws
- Continuity, limits at infinity and horizontal asymptotes, derivatives and rates of change
- Basic derivatives, product and quotient rules (3.2), derivatives of trigonometric functions
- Chain rule, implicit differentiation, derivatives of inverse trigonometric functions and logarithmic functions
- Rates of change problems, related rates
- Linear approximations and differentials, Newton’s Method maximum and minimum values
- Mean Value Theorem, derivatives and graphs, L’Hopital’s rule
- Curve sketching, optimization problems
- Antiderivatives, areas and distances
- Definite integrals, the Fundamental Theorem of Calculus
- Indefinite integrals and net change, the substitution rule.
reviews.comment_teaching:
No notes provided, just powerpoint.
Since few weeks before final, lessons with only notes and remarks written on the board, without using any powerpoint.
Teaching is super fast, making everything confusing and assuming that you have known everything.
I am a M1 student and he is teaching stuff that even M2  students have no idea on it, and assuming it was taught in high school for everyone.
I can feel his passion and love towards math, but his teaching really sucks.
If you can master everything in 1013 before having lessons, just feel free to reg Li Dong, he will give you many challenging questions.
reviews.comment_grading:
WeBWorK Online Homework: 15%
Midterm Exam: 35%
Final Exam: 50%
Absolute grading:
85-100% -->A range
70-85% -->B range
50-70% -->C range
40-50% -->D
0-40% -->Fail
reviews.comment_workload:
Only webwork
Light workload
Just some may spend you hours to do if you are not familiar with the topic ;)
No attendance required.

reviews.author: TrashHang
reviews.title: Depends on which insturctor teach you
reviews.comment_content: Calculus. Half DSE-M2 stuff, half new things.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Mr Wang's English is not clear , it is hard to hear what has been said. And he sometimes cannot finish the examples and ask the students whether he is correct or not.

For tutorials, it is better if comparing to the teaching of lectures,
Tutor first explain the theorem then do some examples to give students a better understanding and it is easy to follow. Also, tutor is willing to answer and explain questions.
reviews.comment_grading:
Semi-absolute grading
15% WebWork 35% Mid-term 50% Final
Total score

70-85%-->B range
50-70%-->C range
40-50%-->D
0-40%-->Fail

reviews.author: Terry Leung
reviews.comment_content: 唔算太難, 主要係重温中學M1, M2 calculus嘅內容, 加L. Hopital rules, Riemann sum之類. M1人會比較吃力, 因為會教trigo calculus, 有M2底基本上無問題.
reviews.comment_teaching: 教得算係咁la, 但個人覺得唔聽書都得, 所以無認真比較過唔同instructor. 反正唔計attendance
reviews.comment_grading: +1 SD A- 自己諗過grade好唔好la
reviews.comment_workload:

Mid-term+final, 輕鬆la

reviews.author: Tomhck
reviews.comment_content: The content is fair if you studied M2 in secondary school. The content is similar to what you have learnt in M2.  I have to say the content itself is not so difficult, but the exam is another thing(the so-called past paper is of little use, completely different from the real one)
reviews.comment_teaching: To be honest, the teaching is quite boring. He tends to use the whiteboard. So, you have to have your paper prepared.
reviews.comment_grading:
quite fairly
you score high and you can get a good grade
reviews.comment_workload:
fair workload. have about 10 webworks
no need to attend the tutorial
no attendance requirement
you can simply ditch all the lessons as long as you finish all the practices

reviews.author: 2042XXXX
reviews.comment_content:
This course is intended to those who studied M1/M2 in the secondary school. It goes back to all the basics of calculus and introduce some minor excluded topics in M1/M2 syllabus, like L'Hopital rule, absolute value inequality and limits, differentiation on weird functions, etc.
In general the content is not difficult, but you may find the workload a bit more if you studied M1 in your secondary school life.
reviews.comment_teaching:
The Professor just speaks whatever she wrote on the lecture notes. There is no need to attend this professor's lecture as you could already knew what she is about to say.
Tutorial maybe useful to who has M1 background, but in general feel free to skip the whole course
reviews.comment_grading:
Grading was absolute, Midterm and final exam is not very difficult to a ordinary student.
I would say the grading is at it's best when you consider some students are able to get 100 marks in the midterm and final exams. So put your effort in and your grade will shine on this course.
reviews.comment_workload: Very little workload, except for weekly WebWork. Question on WebWork is also easy, and you can easily catch up by studying only WebWork.

reviews.author: Peter yim
reviews.title: Too hard for M1 students
reviews.comment_content: Some basic dy/dx, after that, is lots of hard stuff that most business student will never understand, and so meaningless
reviews.comment_teaching:
Lecture teach you the basic and the theory of the equation, but how on earth are we suppose to be interested if we don't even understand the equation?

Tutorial is a must attend if you want a pass
reviews.comment_grading: someone say getting a F is better than a rotten grade, as you can have a second attempt in course, but for this course, you better pass it cause you wouldn't want to learn this nightmare again.
reviews.comment_workload: webwork is easy btw, have unlimited trials in it.

reviews.author: Ceycey
reviews.title: M1 has not much help in Math1013
reviews.comment_content:
In-depth version of what we've learn in high school.
The content is actually not that hard, but the professor makes everything so confusing, and the calculus part is much similar to M2, like cotangent, so M1 calculus has no help in this programme.
Very confusing for M1 students, especially the one who are good at probabilities more than calculus.
(Me: DSE M1 Lv.5)
reviews.comment_teaching:
SUPER FAST!!!!
Goes over the slides so quickly that its impossible to follow.

reviews.comment_grading:
WeBWorK Online Homework: 15%
Midterm Exam: 35%
Final Exam: 50%
Hard to compete with M2 students and nds.
reviews.comment_workload:
Very light workload.
Only have to do Webwork.
About 15 questions for each homework.

reviews.author: mhcm138
reviews.comment_content:
Mostly are M2 stuff, some content is just appeared in Advanced Level Pure Mathematics, generally it is not too difficult to handle.
Content:
Week 1 Review of the concepts of functions and graphs.  
Week 2 Elementary functions.
Week 3 Tangent and velocity; the limit of  a function and limit laws.
Week 4 Continuity; limit at infinity; limit definition of derivative and rates of change.
Week 5 Derivatives of basic functions; differentiation rules.  
Week 6 Chain rule and implicit differentiation.  
Week 7 Rates and related rates.  
Week 8 Linear approximation and differentials; Newton's method; Maximum and minimum values.
Week 9 Mean Value Theorem; derivatives and the shape of a graph; L'Hopital's Rule.
Week 10 Curve sketching; optimization problems.
Week 11 Antiderivatives; areas and distance travelled.
Week 12 Definite integrals; Fundamental Theorem of Calculus.
Week 13 Net change; substitution rule.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Mr Lam will start the most basics topic is the first week. The progress is rather slow and You may think it is a little bit easy, but his teaching can help you clear some concepts rather than just memorize the steps.
He is willing to ANSWER to your questions after lectures. All of his examples and written notes will be uploaded to his website after one week, so you dont need to worried in case you dont attend to his lectures. Generally speaking, he is a nice guy so dont feel afraid to ask them maths questions. Well............he always laughs during his lessons when he made mistakes......

It is worth to attend all tutorial section, there are useful notes and the TA will demonstrate the example one by one, moreover, there are many exercises for you to do, which is similar to exam type questions.
reviews.comment_grading:
WeBWorK Online Homework: 15%
Midterm Exam: 35%  
Final Exam: 50%
more than 85% is A range
more than 70% is B range
Mean of Midterm: 71.61/100 B-
Mean of Final: 68.66/100 C+
Overall Mean: 74.13/100 B-
reviews.comment_workload: He will give you a list of problems that you may want to do in your textbook, not compulsory. Each topic has assigned a webwork for you to do.

reviews.author: Eddychan
reviews.title: Easy to learn and get a good grade.
reviews.comment_content: I went to all professors' lessons and i think LAM Tsz Kin is the best one. Most of the knowledge is learnt in the secondary school by students who take M1/M2 and the homework is not too much. So it is just a review of secondary stuffs and easy for most of students to handle. Even though i skipped many lessons because my home is far away from ust, i still got a not bad grade in the mid-term and final examination.

70-85%-->B range

40-50%-->D
0-40%-->Fail
reviews.comment_workload:
Basically 1 WebWork (Online homework) per week, each consists of 10-18 questions.

No attendance required for any lecture and tutorials

reviews.author: yoson
reviews.comment_content:
本身自己讀m1,mid term 前既野都冇咩問題
唔洗點溫都夠攞B+
但mid term 後開始係m2野,所以要聽書
reviews.comment_teaching:
nothing special
lam tsz kin 個人算幾nice
問佢野實解清楚
reviews.comment_grading:
正常有聽書就會識
不過個人覺得tutorial學得多d野
reviews.comment_workload:
係得webwork要做
最多tutorial 叫你做你就做埋當溫書

reviews.author: jswoo
reviews.comment_content: Basic calculus with some real life applications. The class doesn't go deep in terms of content. It rather covers wide range of topics and goes over them quickly.
reviews.comment_teaching: Students need some background education before taking the class in order to fully understand the instructor.
reviews.comment_grading: Picky about small things. However, if you are able to explain your way of thinking in a reasonable way then the instructor might be more lenient.
reviews.comment_workload: Not so much as a math class, but does take some time to complete it. Some assignments are also very time consuming.

reviews.author: zzy
reviews.comment_content: The content is easy. It's friendly to people who just begins learning calculus. If you go to classes and do the exercise on your own, mastering the content shouldn't be difficult.
reviews.comment_teaching: The teacher mostly just repeat the ppt. In some sessions it's not very necessary to go to the classes.
reviews.comment_grading: 15% A range. If you study hard, it won't be very difficult to get A range.
reviews.comment_workload: Workload is relatively small. Nearly every week we have an online assignment of around 10 basic questions. Besides, we have infinite attempts to answer those questions.

reviews.author: Jessiects
reviews.title: good teacher
reviews.comment_content: -calculus is a very good math foundation course, students have taken mathematics module 2 will have favor in this course.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Very good and interesting! he is the best in calculus math 1013,
i do think freshman should learn math 1013 from mr lam. Really a good course, i recommend
reviews.comment_grading: ok la, it is a basic course, grading average. but to be honest, it is mainly depends on your competitor.
reviews.comment_workload: simple workload, not much, only few assignments and examination. btw i do recommend student should do more exercise to secure a better grade

reviews.author: iciris
reviews.comment_content: 大部分係M2野，limit／differentiation／integration走唔甩，M2底好絕對有優勢
reviews.comment_teaching:
notes上堂前會upload上canvas
不過聽唔明lecturer嘅英文，上咗兩堂就無再上過
reviews.comment_grading:
absolute grading
85% A range
75% B range
本身讀M1  所以用咗好多時間操數
最後有B range
reviews.comment_workload:
總共9份webwork 每個禮拜一份
唔識做就Google
webwork答案可以無限次submit

reviews.author: Mixson
reviews.comment_content: The content is quite comprehensive, From the principle of first derivative to the differentiation is included in the course. You will learn more deeply compared to M2 learned in HKDSE
reviews.comment_teaching: The professor is quite boring. More in-deep materials should be searched in the internet by yourself.
reviews.comment_grading: Bad. It is because as we know that math 1013 is the worst grading course in the HKUST. But it is the compulsory course. So, you cannot fail it course because it will your further study very deeply.  But different instructor has a different style to grade.
reviews.comment_workload: If you have studied M2, the workload is acceptable. but if not, the workload is quite large

reviews.author: Fickdeinemutter
reviews.comment_content:
好深，Limit唔淨止中學教你tends to無限嗰陣除乜去計，而係由基本概念用抽象數學思維去教，用更貼數學嘅語言去解釋，聽到頭都大撚埋⋯⋯

有兩樣係以前M1/2冇教，諸如Inverse Function Theorem，考試長題起碼有十分關呢個事。擺過唔少時間同血淚操呢部分。仲有一個係Newton-Raphson Process用斜率同derivative去搵一個函數嘅x，代數字但都要清楚概念。

其餘都係中學M1/2嘅differentiation應用同integration（主打Fundamental Theorem of Calculus），更囊括trigonometric substitution，而呢個係好多M1人中學冇學過而要下苦功之處。

我當年M2得四，所以讀呢個真係好辛苦，但同一〇一四比較，一〇一四反而冇咁惡頂，而呢個係後話，在此不贅。
reviews.comment_teaching: 首推林子健，好友善好隨和亦教得好清晰，不徐不疾，問佢唔會越講越唔明，相反Kim Chow就越講越唔明，好似佢自己好叻但唔識教人嗰種。Kim Chow可取嘅就係佢嘅精美詳盡筆記，你哋可以搲下source攞。
reviews.comment_grading:
中期試：50/100（平均分：59/100）
末期試：73/100（平均分：73.73/100）

最後C+，拖低GPA唔少，喊咗我頗耐，始終當年大學第一學期，對大學充滿希冀，未讀到嗰種爛龜爛到慣嘅麻木⋯⋯
reviews.comment_workload: Webwork（佔總分約百分之十）做撚死人，幾份攞唔足滿分，即使幾乎全世界Webwork都攞滿分

reviews.author: fonso
reviews.comment_content:
Not too much for student who have studied M1/2
Functions and Graphs (1.1, 1.2); Inverse Functions, Exponential and Logarithmic Functions (1.3), Trigonometric Functions and Their Inverses (1.4); Limits (2.1, 2.2); Computing Limits (2.3, 2.4, 2.5); Continuity and Intermediate Value Theorem (2.6), Derivatives (3.1); Rules of Differentiation (3.2); Product and Quotient Rules (3.3); Derivatives of Trigonometric Functions (3.4); Rates of change (3.5); Chain Rule (3.6), Implicit differentiation (3.7); Derivatives of Inverse Functions (3.8, 3.9), Related Rates (3.10); Maxima and Minima (4.1), Derivatives and Graphing (4.2, 4.3); Optimization Problems (4.4), Linear Approximation (4.5); Mean Value Theorem (4.6); L'Hopital's Rule (4.7), Newton's Method (4.8); Antiderivatives (4.9), Area Under Curves (5.1); Definite Integrals and Their Properties (5.2), Fundamental Theorem of Calculus (5.3); Applications (5.4), Substitution Rule (5.5).
reviews.comment_teaching:
Poor
Can skip the lessons since self-learning is faster
reviews.comment_grading:
Quite high grading
Mid term and final are very easy. Similar to those in practise papers
reviews.comment_workload:
Not too heavy
Only webwork is required as homework
No quiz
No project

reviews.author: Cyril
reviews.comment_content: If you can still remember what you have learnt in secondary school, studying by yourself is not a great problem for some topics.
reviews.comment_teaching: Rubbish! CAI is a new professor. He like turning the light  in the classroom at the dimmest mode, resulting in everyone slept. He just simply read aloud the notes, nothing can learn in the lecture.
reviews.comment_grading: It is absolute grading. Doing past paper can help you get a B range in the exam.
reviews.comment_workload: There is no paper work. But we have to finish WeBwOrK twice a week. The homework is sometimes difficult.

reviews.author: Alpha
reviews.comment_content: Too much things to learn in one semester! Especially for those who didn't have a thorough understanding of derivative in secondary school.
reviews.comment_teaching: The lecturer is from mainland, so don't expect any pleasant accent. And I skipped most of the lectures, mainly revise at home and read the lecture notes. If lecture notes aren't clear enough can read through the text book.
reviews.comment_grading:
Absolute grading, 70-85  B range, 86-100 A range.
Mid term mean:73
Final mean around 6x.
I got 79 total, at last B.
reviews.comment_workload: Mainly web work, but you can do some additional practices on website.

reviews.author: ...lol
reviews.comment_content:
M2 students should be familiar with half of the topics included. Most topics are new to M1 students.
Topics included in this course:
1.Number, inequalities and absolutes, basic functions and graphs, composite functions
2.Exponential functions, trigonometric functions, inverse functions, logarithmic functions, inverse trigonometric functions
3.Tangent and velocity, the limit of a function, limit laws
4.Continuity, limits at inﬁnity and horizontal asymptotes, derivatives and rates of change
5.Basic derivatives, product and quotient rules, derivatives of trigonometric functions
6.Chain rule,  implicit diﬀerentiation, derivatives of inverse trigonometric functions and logarithmic functions
7.Rates of change problems, related rates
8.Linear approximations and diﬀerentials, Newton’s Method, maximum and minimum values
9.Mean Value Theorem, derivatives and graphs, L’Hopital’s rule
10.Curve sketching, optimization problems
11.Antiderivatives, areas and distances
12. Deﬁnite integrals, the Fundamental Theorem of Calculus
13 Indeﬁnite integrals and net change, the substitution rule
reviews.comment_teaching:
Chiang Yik Man's tone is so boring but you would find his notes a bit useful.
TA To Tsz Chung's teaching is quite useful for the exams and he gives many examples and exercises.
reviews.comment_grading:
Not Bad

Absolute grading
85%- 100% = a range
70%- 85% = b range
50%- 70% = c range
below 50% = d range

Full marks for Webwork (15%)
95/100 for midterm (35%)
6x/100 for final (50%) (just above mean)
got a B
PS: Study M1 in DSE
reviews.comment_workload:
1 Webwork per week Total:10
High workload before midterm and final
PS: No calculator is allowed in the exams

reviews.author: kkkkkk
reviews.title: M1好唔代表1013好
reviews.comment_content: 內容同中學有少少重疊，但有部分係m2先會讀過，不利m1學生
reviews.comment_teaching: 幾好，英文講得清晰，講解詳細
reviews.comment_grading:
唔拉curve呢點幾好
用咗好多時間溫，但below mean
利申: 中學m1 5以上，所以中學maths幾好都要俾心機讀
reviews.comment_workload: 只有webwork，但有啲難，上堂冇take attendance，好多人會走堂，但我係上足咁多堂架

reviews.author: flyingbeef
reviews.comment_content: This course include half of the content in DSE M2, including limits, differentiation and some basic integration skills (volume calculation not included). M1 students may find it a bit difficult as there are some trigo d/in.
reviews.comment_teaching: This professor always end his lesson late for 5-10 minutes, be careful if you have other lesson afterward. Notes are provided and uploaded to CANVAS.
reviews.comment_grading:
Absolute grading for this semester.
Homework(webwork) 15%
Midterm 35%
Exam 50 %
================================
85+: A range
70+: B range
55+: C range
with 5 marks between each sub grade
reviews.comment_workload: Total of 10 webwork online assignment which you may find it very annoying in midterm week.

reviews.author: Sunny0516
reviews.title: M1或M2學生必讀的課程, 有下過苦功便能輕鬆合格 / Compulsory course for M1 or M2 students, easy pass if you are willing to spend some time in this.
reviews.comment_content:
所教內容大部分已經在M2課程中學過, 頗為簡單。
Most content were taught in M2 curriculum before, this course was pretty simple.

內容 / Content:
- Limit (some new stuff like L'Hopital Rule)
- Differentiation (have trigonometry)
- Integration (including Reimann Sum)
reviews.comment_teaching:
這位老師有一點大陸口音, 我覺得有點難聽得明, 而且教得有點悶, 不太推薦。
It is a bit hard to understand this teacher's English. The lecture is also a bit boring, not recommended.
reviews.comment_grading:
這課程採用絕對評分法, 只根據你的總分(不按排名)來給予等級。
This course used absolute grading, your final grade only depends on your final score (not your performance when compared with others).

85% A-range
70% B-range
50% C-range

而總分由三個部分構成。
Your final score was composed of 3 parts.

15% - WebWork / 功課 (基本上人人也有滿分 / Nearly everyone got full marks)
35% - Midterm / 期中考
50% - Final / 期末考

我在期中考拿97/100分 (約高出1.8個SD), 期末考拿93分 (約高出1 SD), 功課滿分, 緦分95.45, 獲得A+。
I got 97/100 in midterm (around >1.8 SD), 93/100 in final exam (around >1 SD), full marks in WebWork, final score is 95.45/100, and eventually got an A+.
reviews.comment_workload:
有9份網上功課, 遲交便會獲得0分, 但非常簡單。
There are 9 online assignments (WebWork), and late submission will result in zero marks, but they are very easy.

reviews.author: Xavi
reviews.comment_content: Mostly M2 stuff of HKDSE in this course with some new concepts. It would be pretty complicated if you didn't take M2 in secondary school. The course is about fundamental theory of calculus, differentiation, integration,continuity, etc.
reviews.comment_teaching: The demonstration of calculus concept is so ambiguous. And the lecturer sometimes shifts the focus too often and completely lost me. Tutorial helps a bit. but the exercises are quite different from the problems in the exams.
reviews.comment_grading: Seems pretty strict to me. I remember scoring above 70% (or 75%?) gets you a B and to get A range, you need to score more than 85%.
reviews.comment_workload: Only less than 20 online questions per topic which the lecturer actually walks you through most of them in the lecure. There is not much you need to do on your own.

reviews.author: keithson
reviews.title: 你M2底好就hea讀都起碼有B
reviews.comment_content:
內容同中學M2野相差不大,只係加深講多少少
M2底好你會好輕鬆讀得 M2底差你真係要做多D唔係你會好慘1
reviews.comment_teaching: 好睇人教  TK lam真係......
reviews.comment_grading:
底好正正常常夠努力應該都有B
底差你就聽天由命啦 M2野真心唔覺得一個sem可以好得去邊
reviews.comment_workload:
math 基本上一定有online hw做咩
一個星期一份, 唔識就問人求救/去MSC啦

reviews.author: Berry
reviews.comment_content: The content is very basic calculus. A start for bigger mathematic world.If you want to learn more, learn something by yourself or try 1024.
reviews.comment_teaching: Prof. CAI always teaches by reading his notes. It might be boring to listen to, but he sometimes gives some interesting prove problems.
reviews.comment_grading: Grading is good. You can get A range if 90%.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is not heavy. Every week a homework which can normally be done in 90min. May need to do some past paper before midterm and final. There are many problems in same patterns, so it's really helpful to do some pastpaper.

reviews.author: Cyn
reviews.comment_content: Content was okay since most materials were covered in high school.
reviews.comment_teaching: Not very good style of teaching, most of the time he actually only discussed questions from webwork on his lectures.
reviews.comment_grading: No attendance. Questions on midterm and final are very difficult, very different from those of webwork, so try to earn full points of participation from webwork. Tip for mid term: Try to find some pastpapers, they actually helped as some of the questions are actually the same
reviews.comment_workload: Have to do the webwork to get 15% of the final grades. Some questions posted on webwork are difficult but you have unlimited tries.

reviews.author: Maurice
reviews.comment_content:
This is an introductory course in one-variable calculus. Topics include functions and graphs,
limits of functions and continuity, derivatives and their applications, basic indefinite and definite
integrals.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Dr. Lam teaches great. He will explain concepts slowly so to make sure student can follow.

In tutorials, the TA will teach again what had been taught in lectures and had explained example questions.
reviews.comment_grading:
Homework 12%
Midterm Exam 33%
Final Exam 55%

Students can obtain 4% more through attending extra quizzes in math supporting center.
reviews.comment_workload:
More than 10 assignments. Some questions may be challenging.

Midterm and final exams are not easy, and resulting low mean score.

reviews.author: Emilylyt
reviews.comment_content: HIs notes are quite well-detailed, with steps and answers provided. However, his lessons are quite boring and his tone is dull.
reviews.comment_teaching: His teaching is not bad though.
reviews.comment_grading: It really depends on how much time you devoted in this course and whether you have studied M2 or not. As the content is mainly about M2 maths, so if you have studied M2 before, it will be a comparative advantage for you. However, if you studied M1, it is also fine as long as you have done revision.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is not heavy. Only one webwork need to do on every week.

reviews.author: Jensen923
reviews.comment_content: Half of the contents have been learnt in high school and only one midterm and final. The syllabus is not really intense.
reviews.comment_teaching: Lots of extra examples have been used in lecture, no attendance requirements, no quizzes, no projects and the prof. is also a nice guy
reviews.comment_grading: Absolute grading where 85% to 100% A range, 70% to 85% B range, never revise before the midterm and final, but midterm and finals were more difficult than the textbooks questions.
reviews.comment_workload: 1 Webwork per week, most of the answers of the questions can be found online even through the numerical values are different

reviews.author: kero星人
reviews.comment_content:
mentioned by other people already, and I agree with them
m1 people like me need to self-study some parts
reviews.comment_teaching:
This is the first course prof ye teach in ust
her pronunciation is hard to understand at first, but soon we can understand
her notes although is hand-written, her penmanship is quite good and it summarized all stuff in the book, so read her notes before exam and no need to buy the book
dont judge her by the first lesson

moy is a fair prof, nothing special
reviews.comment_grading:
15% WebWork 35% Mid-term 50% Final
Total score
85-100%-->A range
70-85%-->B range
50-70%-->C range
40-50%-->D
0-40%-->Fail
(I was told the boundary is slightly lowered this term)
reviews.comment_workload:
webwork again
moy allen done all of it already in notes, so just copy it is ok

reviews.author: Eason
reviews.title: Math 1013
reviews.comment_content: Some advanced content like hkdse m2, some algebra and graphs
reviews.comment_grading: The A range is really hard to get that the score of midterm and final have to be at least 85+, I got 77 in midterm and 88 in final still got only B+
reviews.comment_workload: Basically only homework which is some good exercise for exams because it really helps building up the concept of the topics. Sometimes might have some online bonus quizs that everyone wil do so. Not really high loaded as long as you know how to do the homework.

reviews.author: RSK
reviews.comment_content: Mainly about the things students learned in high school, and some theorems, differentiation and a little bit about integration. Overall, students can generally get most of the idea of the topics.
reviews.comment_teaching: Teaching is good and clear. Tutorial is useful. Students must finish the worksheet and do revision after that. If you have any question about the topics, you can ask the professor.
reviews.comment_grading: Absolute grading system is good. If students are hard-working, everything is alright. No need to worry too much.
reviews.comment_workload: Not many assignments. But students still need to actively do revision.

reviews.author: tywanaa
reviews.comment_content: I have studied M1 in DSE before, so I found the content was quite demanding as it is mostly included in M2 syllabus but not M1's.
reviews.comment_teaching: She only copied the book content as her teaching material with exactly the same examples in the book.
reviews.comment_grading: It is using absolute grading so you do not need to worry about the competitors. Scoring 85% or above can get an A range, 70%-85% for B range.
reviews.comment_workload: You only need to do Webwork as assignment but I think it is indeed quite useful for revision. There is a total of 9 webwork for my semester and each webwork consists of around 15 questions on average.

reviews.author: Chiu Li
reviews.title: its difficulty is beyond your imagination
reviews.comment_content: i got 5* in both M2 and Maths.But Math1013 is totally a different thing. Its very hard to understand all the things even though you study well at your secondary school.The concept is very far away from the knowledge you learnt from secondary school. And also the integration and deviation are not familiar to what you have learnt. The lucky thing you should thank god is that the workload of this course is light. and also you do not need to attend the tutorial class , though it is very useful.
reviews.comment_teaching: The teacher seems like having no idea about what he is saying.
reviews.comment_grading: C-
reviews.comment_workload: not too much . just web work

reviews.author: minna_
reviews.title: MATH1013 review
reviews.comment_content: This course mainly teaches limits, derivatives, differentiation and integration. However, students who have studied Math Module 2 in the HKDSE syllabus have more advantages than students who have studied Math Module 1 as the content of the two subjects are more similar. Attendance is not required for both lectures and tutorial sessions, but I will suggest you to attend both, especially the tutorial sessions, as handouts will be distributed.
reviews.comment_teaching: The professor who taught me did not provide any notes to students during lectures, therefore I jotted all the things he had written on the whiteboard. Luckily, the notes in tutorial sessions are quite useful.
reviews.comment_grading: It uses curve grading, so it really depends on how students studying the same course with you perform.
reviews.comment_workload: There is webwork assignment every week and it consists of about 10 questions in each assignment. I will suggest visiting the Math Support Centre if you have any problems regarding the content as once you lost track, it is hard to catch up with the content in the following lectures.

reviews.author: Tang Hiu Yung
reviews.title: Bad
reviews.comment_content: If you study m1 in Secondary school, this course is good for you to learn more about mathematics.
reviews.comment_teaching: The main problem is that her pronunciation is hard to understand, so you will get bored on her lesson. I can't afford me to sleep at her lesson. Her lecture note is hand write, but fortunately it is easy to understand and learn, so you just need to learn from her lecture notes.
reviews.comment_grading: It is absolute grading. In the midterm, I got 84, mean is around 7x. And in the final exam, I got 58, the mean is 6x, total 72.2, and I got B-, quite fair
reviews.comment_workload: There are one midterm and one final, you need to do webwork like every week. Remember that you need to finish all the question so that you can get the mark of finishing the webwork.

reviews.author: Aaron Kwok
reviews.title: 爛grade course
reviews.comment_content: calculus ge 入門course, 讀過m2基本上都會學過。集中教differentiation 同 integration，教授教得淺顯易明，課程內容都幾容易理解。
reviews.comment_teaching: Edmund教授有時會遲到，但係教得幾用心，內容都幾風趣。而且Edmund非常願意抽出時間同學生傾計，唔會擺架子。
reviews.comment_grading: course教ge內容十分簡單，但係考ge野就難好多，建議要操多d數先好去應付考試。
reviews.comment_workload: 一個星期做一次網上功課webwork，大概需要兩個小時左右就可以完成。

reviews.author: hehehe
reviews.comment_content: just some basic calculus. 80% of the content is covered by the secondary school syllabus. So if you studied M2 in secondary school, you will have a great advantage in taking this course. However, if you were non-local or non m2 student, you will have a quite large lag behind starting comparing to those who study m2 in secondary school. So if you didnt study m2, its better to learn it before taking this course or find a friend that good at calculus. this course doesnt have attendance record.
reviews.comment_teaching: basically no teaching tehnique
reviews.comment_grading: standardized grading for the whole 1013.
reviews.comment_workload: just some simple online webwork

reviews.author: MaGGIe513
reviews.comment_content: Quite hard for those who did not take M1/M2 in DSE, not competitive in class and hard to catch uo the sysllabus.
reviews.comment_teaching: Different teacher have different pace, notes are provided. Tutorial classes are provided for small class teaching so it is easier to understand the topic comparing to in lectures.
reviews.comment_grading: Acceptable grading as webwork are handed in on time and sufficient study, it is not hard to rceive a pass in this course.
reviews.comment_workload: high workload, need to summit webwork per week. Questions in the webwork are not taught in class, hence it is quite hard to finish and receive a pass.

reviews.author: EJY
reviews.title: Good Instructors, Essential Course
reviews.comment_content: The course starts from function and goes deep to limit, derivative, simple integral. It only touches the superficial concept of calculus and its application. All you need to know is how are the concepts working instead of how did they come from.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Dr. ZHU graduated from Oxford University and has a very clear concept of mathematics. He emphasizes the importance of definition. Being a friendly and enthusiastic instructor, he is always willing to help when the students are in need. He teaches hard and his shirt always gets wet at the end of the class. Meanwhile, he likes to hang around when asking you to solve the given problems and tries to find out if anyone is in need of help. He is also a responsible person. During a conversation after class, he told me that he could not sleep well before the days that he would give lectures. He said he was always afraid of oversleeping although this never happend.
Mr. LI was the TA. He was also the TA for many courses like MATH 2351. Unlike Prof. ZHU, his tutorials were so boring that I just attended two and played with my phone! All he did was reading the material notes line by line. :(
reviews.comment_grading: It's not really a big deal. The midterm was much more difficult than the past paper but the final was reasonable. Just remember to do webwork carefully and efficiently, after which it would be easy to get a good grade.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload was quite light. Just remember to finish all the webwork questions. You can find similar problem for all of them in the lecture notes or tutorial notes.

reviews.author: Forest_lau
reviews.title: Don't know what happen

reviews.author: sx

reviews.author: Jackreal87
reviews.title: First Calculus course in UST
reviews.comment_content: Basic one-variable calculus. Functions and limits are covered. Rules of differentiation are taught to compute derivatives. Riemann sum and some basic integral calculus are introduced at the end of the course. Most of the content are covered by the M2 syallabus so the course should be easy for those who have taken M2 in DSE.
reviews.comment_teaching:
The content of the course are organised neatly and the order of the course content is arranged logically. Most student should be able to understand majority of the course content.

The instructor is nice and he is willing to answer students' questions after class. The TA is also very helpful and her notes distributed on tutorials are good materials for preparing exams.
reviews.comment_grading:
12% Homework- The assignments are released via Webwork. It serves as a nice way to revise materials taught on wach week

33% Midterm
55%Final
The exams are not too challenging as most of the questions have been appeared in homework and tutorial materials. Students should have no problem finishing these questions if they are well-prepared.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload of this course is small as the difficulty of the course content is not high. Working on exercises in the textbook and revising tutorial materials may be helpful for you to prepare the exams.

reviews.author: Mikey
reviews.comment_content: The content are mostly about calculus and graphs.
reviews.comment_teaching: The spoon feeding teaching style is extremely boring, the professor will only stick to the lecture notes without giving extra examples. On the other hand, the tutorials are quite useful as the tutor will explain the concepts thoroughly and comprehensively, also the tutor provides more examples and practicing questions.
reviews.comment_grading: The grading tends to be normally distributed as the grading pool is extremely huge.
reviews.comment_workload: The assignments are quite challenging and they may take up a few hours to finish, they are slightly more difficult than the midterm and final so make sure you understand all of them.

reviews.author: Grace YUN
reviews.title: MATH 1003
reviews.comment_content: The content is with well structured and planned. Definitions and examples are well provided. Most of them are already taught in IB Math SL courses.
reviews.comment_teaching: She's fine in teaching, desctibing well in class. However, the contents that she's taching is just the copy of the PPT. In other words, her PPT is well structured.
reviews.comment_grading: Lots of students do already have a basic understanding in math. Thus it is hard to get a good grade.
reviews.comment_workload: About 8 or 9 webwork-quizes are given. Each webwork quize contains 10 questions. No other homeworks are requested.

reviews.comment_content:
Limits and calculus (differentiation and integration)
First principle and L'hospital rule, linear approx. and newton's method, Riemann sum and definition of integration using right riemann sum.
