reviews.author: IpNing
reviews.comment_content: For someone who studied M1 in dse may find it is a little difficult to catch up because of trigo, but it is still ok if you spend some time on them. And there is tutorial class once a week and it has provided many exercises, finish all of them is enough to understand the content. There will be sample paper for mid-term and final, it is a must to do them because they are very similar to the real exam.
reviews.comment_teaching: Well teaching, I like his teaching very much. He gave many examples in the class to help students to understand the topics. He is also able and willing to answer students' questions and discuss with them.
reviews.comment_grading: It is absolute grading so if you got 85 or above you can get A range.  But the exam can be hard so you have to understand the concepts deeply and do more exercise to get more familiar with the exam question.
reviews.comment_workload:
webwork for every week, about 10 to 15 question per webwork, but it is easy to finish.
No other hw.
1 mid-term and 1 final

reviews.author: JimmyLeung1998
reviews.title: MATH1013
reviews.comment_content:
Tentative Learning Schedule

The following schedule may be adjusted due to the progress of the course.
Week 1 Review of the concepts of functions and graphs.  (1.2-1.3; Appendix A.)
Week 2 Elementary functions.  (1.5-1.6; Appendix D.)
Week 3 Tangent and velocity; the limit of  a function and limit laws.  (2.1-2.3.)
Week 4 Continuity; limit at infinity; limit definition of derivative and rates of change.  (2.5-2.7.)
Week 5 Derivatives of basic functions; differentiation rules.  (2.8, 3.1-3.3.)
Week 6 Chain rule and implicit differentiation.  (2.8, 3.1-3.3.)
Week 7 Rates and related rates.  (3.7-3.9.)
Week 8 Linear approximation and differentials; Newton's method; Maximum and minimum values.  (3.10, 4.8, 4.1.)
Week 9 Mean Value Theorem; derivatives and the shape of a graph; L'Hopital's Rule (LH rule).  (4.2-4.4.)
Week 10 Curve sketching; optimization problems.  (4.5-4.7.)
Week 11 Antiderivatives; areas and distance travelled.  (4.9, 5.1.)
Week 12 Definite integrals; Fundamental Theorem of Calculus FTC.  (5.2-5.3.)
Week 13 Net change; substitution rule.  (5.4-5.5.)

Textbook
J. Stewart, Calculus Early Transcendentals, 7th edition, Brooks/Cole.

A req math course for all engine, sci students
Some BBA students (Qfin, Gbus) may hv to take thz as well

To be honest, this course may not be suitable for students with M1 background.
In my observation, they seemed to hv difficulty to catch up.
Maybe because they suffered from the stupid dse system,
causing them get used to just a brief understanding on the opration, but not the reasoning behind the whole mechanism
Thus they may only acquire a limited skills in the exam if they did not put much effort in it

But even for M2-ers, they are not actually benefited much
although they may hv more exposure on caculus during their study in high schools
Before the midterm,
they may only need to know more about limit.
For instance,
they may hv to learn to find a limit of a function involving abs sign at a specific point by considering the graph
They may also need to know how or in what ways the limit laws work,
or maybe acquire different skills to link up lim and dy/dx in different situations (e.g. "advanced" first principle：Left lim = right lim)
And that's all
And then they could just skip the lessons before the midterm
(given the fact that in this sem only content taught in week 1 to 7 were included in the mid term exam)

But after the midterm,
every local-ers just suffer in the same way.
All those fancy stuffs in week 8 and 9 suddenly just kick ur axx hard.
It taught me a lesson:
It would be terrible for u to skip lessons just after the midterm exam.

After that,
everything seemed to go on more normally.
For M2-ers they may only need to re-pick up skills on all those familiar question relating to optimization and sketching.

Then there is another tough time for everyone.
When integral sign is involved,
everything we learnt before just mix together.
From the little x on the upper bound to the FTC
From FTC we revised once more the chain rule
From lim + integral sign to 0/0, leading us to that "cute" LH rule,
once again suddenly bring up FTC
And finally,
the boss abs sign would just show up from nowhere to skrew up everything,
causing u lost faith in ur integration skills...

sor for the long bullshxt...
Wht i want to say is,
even u enter this u with 5** in m2/math or both,
u still need to work hard.
Maybe u hv confidence in ur ability to learn/pick up/acquire those skills,
u still hv to pay attention on how the whole things work and how they would appear to strike u back
reviews.comment_teaching:
TK Lam is a good prof
He can explain Every details in a organised and systematic way
But still One minor thing i want to raise up here:
He may just be too careful to explain everythings,
make people feel confused in which part they should focus more
and thus cause students forget to think clearly in wht way all these could be applied in the real-world exam problems.

The tutor, Tommy Cheng, also did a great job.
He would try to include every necessary skills and techniques in 1hr tut/week
In the make-up session held in the sem break,
he even distributed to us a worksheet with excellent questions that never appear in other tutors' handouts.
Those 4 limit questions was just too great for us
to revise all the applicable theories we hv to know in the evaluation of limits
Thx to this great ta!!!!
reviews.comment_grading:
Fair
Work harder, grade better

Abs grading is used
Above 85% in total : A range
around 70 - 85: B range
around 50 to 70 : C range
40~ : D range forsure
Below 40 would be F

For me：
Full marks in All webwork (15%)
95/100 in mid term (35%)
87/100 in final (50%)
91.25% in total got an A

As u can see,
no pop up quiz or attendance issues are needed to be concern.
For whatever reasons, u could always hv the flexibility to skip lessons~~

A+ req luck and fortune I would say
Afterall,
with no help from calculator and a limited time,
it would be hard to hv ur best performance in exams
reviews.comment_workload:
Basically u hv to familiar with all necessary skills and techniques.
To do this, u hv to do all the webworks and choose some difficult questions from the textbook to practise
Practise make Perfect afterall
Of course, if u just want a pass,
just feel free to skip some webworks and fight as hard as possible in the last moment
D+/C- could always be given in this case (learn this from the experiences of others~~

reviews.author: supersherlockxd
reviews.title: 數學白痴都可以及格的course
reviews.comment_content: 對有讀M2既人非常容易，但係因為我讀M1（利申3）好辛苦先明白。齋讀calculus，冇stat，完全唔明。最後讀到一隻死狗咁，都係唔明。
reviews.comment_teaching:
tklam其實幾好人，我地都話佢似神探伽利略。佢教得好慢，雖然我都係唔明。如果數學好就唔使返，但係數學唔好根本已經訓著左。落堂之後佢會好耐心答我地問題。（同埋佢會認得學生）

Tutorial 先係精華，Einstein Kong 好努力令我地明白課堂內容，但係會教得快過lecture。因為我地tutoral入面得兩個人讀M1，我地吸收俾其他人慢。
reviews.comment_grading: 頭先都話我係數學白痴，midterm同final低mean超過一個sd，但係都有C-。absolute grading，其實都公平既（雖然俾班NDS屈機屈到個mean俾人拉高），做齊功課墊15%。
reviews.comment_workload: 每個禮拜都有webwork，非常簡單，但係非常麻煩，因為好多時候會唔多記得做。最好定時check有冇新功課，有時出奇不意又會多一份。同埋平時要溫書（雖然唔係compulsory），可以跟網上指引做。

Dr Cai, what do I start with *sigh*. Basically only rewrote the lecture notes uploaded to CANVAS once during lectures, not much other than that. I only went twice the whole semester, self-studied the lecture notes.
Btw I asked him to upload the MC answers but after the checking of the final exam paper, they're still nowhere to be seen.
reviews.comment_grading:
Absolute grading, no worries for being above/below mean as your grade will not depend on that at all. Each 5% is a sub-grade except for D and F.

95-100% A+
90-95%   A
85-90%   A-
80-85%   B+
75-80%   B
70-75%   B-
63-70%   C+
57-63%   C
50-57%   C-
40-50%   D
0-40%     F
reviews.comment_workload: 9 homework assignments in total for my semester, one assignment per 1-2 weeks. No assignment on midterm week. Midterm and final pretty much strictly follows the format and structure of questions given in tutorial worksheets, thus once again, try not to skip tutorials.

reviews.title: EASY but TERRIBLE course
reviews.comment_content: Yes, very easy course. But It is so meaningless and wasting my time because >90% things have learnt in M2. I am strongly hope HKUST change the official rule to let all student who got level 5 or above in HKDSE M2 transfer MATH1013 and starting from MATH1014.
reviews.comment_teaching: Extremely bad teaching. In the lecture and tutorial class, the instructor like hidden! The tutors in MSC are very rule!
reviews.comment_grading:
Bad grading.
Homework 15%Midterm Exam 35%Final Exam 50%
Grade Scale:
100% ≥ A+/A/A- ≥ 85%, > B+/B/B- ≥ 70%, > C+/C/C- ≥ 50% > D ≥ 40% > F
Using absolute grading although the final exam for most students are difficult and lots of people got low marks in final exam. For me, overall 81.03% B+
reviews.comment_workload: Light workload. I almost didn't get any stress from homework although I am a deadline fighter. Midterm almost no need to study but final need some time to study because you should make sure your concept is clear.

reviews.comment_content: the course only includes a little content of M1 and M2, most of them are new to students
reviews.comment_teaching: bored, but Mr. Lam is a passionate and patient teacher, he is willing to explain the questions that you don't understand
reviews.comment_grading: you can get a good grade if you work really hard, however, never try to skip the webwork, otherwise, your grade will be very low. besides, if you fail in the midterm, it is difficult to get a good grade even you get a good result in final exam.
reviews.comment_workload: not too much workload, one webwork per two weeks

reviews.author: Masakaki
reviews.title: What do you expect from a math course..
reviews.comment_content: Basic M2. Should be an easier ride for those of you who've taken M1/M2 before. If you have passed them by receiving credit transfer? Too bad, it wont be easy if you've have forgotten what you've learned before.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Honestly speaking, whether to attend lectures or not totally depends on you. Because? Well, the lecture itself does not help you at all. If might give a little help if you are taking this course without any pre-requisite knowledge.
Tutorial sessions may help you a little. They provide some useful examples to help you understand. Of couse, the level of difficulty is way lower then what appears in the exams.
reviews.comment_grading:
Yeah, what you may expect from a math course in HKUST. The average grade is around C. The mean is low(still pretty high considering that this course is MATH course) but the highest score is nearly 100%. Which means it has very high SD and its extremely hard to receive an A for this course.

Do not miss the webwork deadlines. As they are fairly easy, missing one of them means a significant drop of your grade unless you perfectly master both midterm and final exam.
reviews.comment_workload: Only webworks. You cant say that you're 'studying' even without this little piece of work.

reviews.author: guess_what
reviews.title: Easy course
reviews.comment_content: Basic knowledge about the math. Everyone who has the basic concepts about the math can handle this course easy.
reviews.comment_teaching: Never wen to the class. So don't know the teaching method. But I think the math support center is very useful. If you have some problems then the TAs would like to help you. Besides the webwork, other questions are also OK.
reviews.comment_grading: Great. Only need some exercises then can understand the course easily. The grade is very satisfying for me.
reviews.comment_workload: Light. Only some webwork questions and some homework. Recommond to do some exercises by yourself.

reviews.author: yan
reviews.comment_content: The content just like DSE M2 but the notes had more explanation in each topics
reviews.comment_teaching:
TA taught the math questions step by step, very detailed
It is free to go to different tutorial sections as much as you want to get different notes
reviews.comment_grading: not very good if you do not do the practice provided in the tutorial class and it would be better to do extra practice
reviews.comment_workload:
Have midterm, final and webwork
To answer the questions in webwork, google search can help if you do not know how to calculate

reviews.author: Leon0305
reviews.title: Advanced and intensive M2 course
reviews.comment_content: It just teaches M2 in 3 months, taken M2 before, not too difficult, otherwise, tough to remember the content quickly and hard to catch up.
reviews.comment_teaching: It is kind of boring. He taught by using the WebWork questions as example, where he show all the steps, most simple very slowly, making the lecture boring and slow.
reviews.comment_grading: As most of the students are come from Mainland or the top students in HK, having a minimum of 5 in DSE Mathematics, plus the grading system of using mean, you will expect to be really hard to outclass others in order to get good grade
reviews.comment_workload: It depends. If you aren't aim for good grade and just do the WebWork, it is easily. Otherwise, you need to do lots of wastepaper just like the times back in DSE.

reviews.author: Azurite_of_Blue
reviews.title: Way too easy for mainland students
reviews.comment_content: The content is too easy for mainlands, most of which we have learnt in high school. Even for the other parts which we haven't learnt, it's easier than the calculus class in almost every mainland university.
reviews.comment_teaching: Fine. The professor is really patient. Although the pace is too slow.
reviews.comment_grading:
Assessment:

Homework 15%

Midterm Exam 35%

Final Exam 50%

Grade Scale:

100% ≥ A+/A/A- ≥ 85%, > B+/B/B- ≥ 70%, > C+/C/C- ≥ 50% > D ≥ 40% > F
reviews.comment_workload:
You just need to do webwork with unlimited trials, that is, try until you get it right.
Don't take attendence so many students never go to lectures.

reviews.author: charleskye
reviews.comment_content: M2 stuff. Will be challenging if you don't have M2 background.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Backgroud:
-This is the first year she teaches in hkust, said she had 7years of teaching experience in the US.
-Her English pronunciation is just above the line of understandable.
Lecture:
-The lecture is super boring. She just read out what was on the notes.
-No need to answer questions
Tutorial:
-Tutorial is useful and more interesting than lecture.
-Teaches the same stuff as lecture does
-Don't skip tutorial
reviews.comment_grading:
A range >=85%
Don't know about difficulty becuz no exam yet

Almost everyone get full mark in webwork. Difficulty is low-medium but you can submit it many times until u get the right answer.
reviews.comment_workload:
Workload is light. Webwork contains 15-20questions a week.

But there are lots of exercise in the book which she suggests us to do. Should evaluate on how much time u want to invest in maths.

reviews.author: Vicky0530
reviews.comment_content: The content of this course is not difficult.
reviews.comment_teaching: Teaching styles of each instructor is different. You can borrow notes from other students if it suits you.
reviews.comment_grading: Grading is  fair enough as long as you finish all the web work and do exercise.
reviews.comment_workload: Workload isn't much. Just about 10 web work. There is also some out-class exercises and bonus quiz. You should complete the example quiz first for the bonus quiz is much similar to the example. Finish the exercise and past paper. It is important to know the example questions which may occur in the exams.

reviews.author: Alex Yeung
reviews.title: Short Review SUmmary for MATH 1013
reviews.comment_content: About M2 stuff learnt in high school, with deeper explanation and deduction processes. Good for people who have learnt M2, but not M1.
reviews.comment_teaching: explain in detail, but a bit boring sometimes. Good for students who love Math and want to learn more about calculus and mathematical deductions.
reviews.comment_grading: Quite bad as the exam and midterms are difficult. You might need more revisions to get good concepts on math theories, especially on graph sketching chapters.
reviews.comment_workload: Web work is quite time-consuming. But other than that, no other extreme time-consuming workload. Revision depends on yourself.

reviews.author: franfrancoco
reviews.title: 爛龜但一家要讀嘅COURSE
reviews.comment_content:
都係中學果啲M1 M2野,M2叻嘅可以輕易A RANGE
M1嘅同學要記下啲SIN COS野
冇讀過嘅就自求多福啦,就算BUSI人都係爛1個SEM姐
reviews.comment_teaching:
一個字,悶
堂可以唔洗上,不過佢有EXERCISE可以操下
EXERCISE有埋答案,不過偏淺
主要都係靠TUTORIAL操題目
TUTORIAL嘅題目較接近考試
reviews.comment_grading:
MATH COURSE都係爛龜架啦,盡早上岸啦
MEAN~C+,大約60幾分啦
SD就15~19分左右
高1個SD~B-,高2個SD先有A RANGE
WEBWORK 12%
MIDTERM 33%
EXAM 55%
reviews.comment_workload:
1MIDTERM 1FINAL,每個禮拜1份WEBWORK
記得做WEBWORK就得啦
有時唔識可以去MSC問啲厹(最好叫啲女仔FD問)
或者GOOGLE有時都可以幫到你

reviews.author: Rezzaldo
reviews.comment_content: Basic calculus. Students with M1/M2 should be at least OK with that. Taught high school maths in first 2 lessons.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Tries to be funny which, in case, is not, but nice effort.
Explains in details with graphs. Talks relatively slow but you can have more time in understanding. Therefore, he is sometimes boring when you get the concept fast. If you still don't understand, feel free to ask him after class. He will stay there for a while. Seems to be easy-going.
reviews.comment_grading: With a hard-working and inquisitive attitude, you can easily get an A range.
reviews.comment_workload: Online HW. No attendance is taken.

reviews.author: Harrywh
reviews.title: Need Calculus Base
reviews.comment_content: Studying calculus. It will be difficult for students who haven't  studied    M1/M2.
reviews.comment_teaching: Boring mostly. I didn't really listen to the lecturer because it was boring. The lecturer is not a good speaker and students who have no calculus base may have the concept mixed up.
reviews.comment_grading: Not so good. i got B-.Forgot the mark. Especially for students who don't know about calculus. Really tough to get good grade.
reviews.comment_workload: Only webwork, not really heavy in terms of workload. Webwork answers can somehow be found on the internet

reviews.author: Calvin Chan
reviews.title: A difficult for a student never studied M2 Maths
reviews.comment_content:
It is just a course teaching M2 Maths in HKDSE.
Should be easy for those who have studied that.
reviews.comment_teaching: Boring teaching with interesting maths. Lecturers are kind of the same in all lecture, all teach in a boring way.
reviews.comment_grading: For a person to get a C+ without any knowledge in M2, I think for grading part, it is not bad. For those who have studied it, it would be much better.
reviews.comment_workload: For the online Webwork, you need to do it every single week. It should be easy for those who have studied M2 before to finish it.

reviews.author: wyiLe
reviews.comment_content: Calculus, conducted in a small class, professor will be covering the contents at the beginning of the class, after that, you will have a in class exercise to complete. The time for you to complete the exercise is limited. But meanwhile you can ask as many questions as you want, there will be lots of TAs around for you to ask questions if you have any. Then after a short break, you will have to complete a in class quiz (one quiz per class), you will not be able to ask questions during this time, so learn the stuff when you are doing the in class exercise.
reviews.comment_teaching: In the Winter semester, the class structure is quite different from what it originally is. There will be lots of TAs around for you to ask questions, and in every class you will have to do a set of questions. All the TAs are friendly and happy for you to ask question. Do not hesitate to ask them questions they are happy to help! Sometimes if you have some questions in mind, you can even discuss it with the professor, it can be quite fun. In my opinion, I learn much more effective this way.
reviews.comment_grading: It should be 25% in class exercise, 25% in class quizzes, 50% final. Since it was some time ago already, I cannot remember exactly, but the percentage should be distributed like this.
reviews.comment_workload: Workload is not very heavy, as you will be doing most of the work in class, and you can do exercise out of class for practice too. If you do the in class exercise properly, you should be okay with the quizzes. The workload is very reasonable.

reviews.author: b桑
reviews.comment_content: 讀過m1/2可以輕鬆上，沒上過的就可能會覺得比較難
reviews.comment_teaching: 之前學m2，所以覺得幾悶，lecture雖然悶，但是tutorial還是要上的，如果想要攞好龜就不要走tutorial
reviews.comment_grading: 我mid高1sd，final高1.5sd，b+
reviews.comment_workload: 一個星期一份webwork，不算太多，但是有時候其他assignment一起來的時候會容易忘記

not hard just basic stuff
quite useful

reviews.comment_grading:
fair la
maths base ok then easy to get good grade
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is quite heavy. There is online homework and it counts attendance. The quiz and midterm are quite difficult.

reviews.comment_teaching: Exams are much more difficult than in classes.Students with m1/2 can handle it easily.Hope you can learn well.
reviews.comment_grading: If you do more extra exercises， you can get good grades.Students with m1/2 can handle it easily.Hope you can learn well.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is fair, you can learn better and make less mistakes with those exercise. Students with m1/2 can handle it easily.Hope you can learn well. reviews.author: A0grad不是夢
reviews.title: You are going to die
reviews.comment_content: There is really no difference here, for who is your instructor. Lam is already the better one but not much difference is made as the course is really too hard for business students.
reviews.comment_teaching: Just skip the lesson, and go to the tutorials for exercise and the Math support centre for real teaching and advice.
reviews.comment_grading: Unless you get near perfect, you are going to be in B range.
reviews.comment_workload: Low to nothing as everything can be found on the web. And you will soon realise whatever you have done in the web work wont help you.

reviews.author: Moving
reviews.title: Good
reviews.comment_content: Not really easy for those who didn't study M1/M2 in their secondary school.
reviews.comment_teaching: t seemed like professor's main concern was finishing the syllabus, rather than being coherent enough to make sense to students. This is why I stopped going to the lectures and studied from the book on my own.
reviews.comment_grading: Be careful before enrolment! Exam is rather difficult!
reviews.comment_workload: Workload of this course was somewhat heavy. You are sometimes required to do a great number of questions in a week. Some of them are extremely difficult (not all of them are marked though). But I totally agree this is a kind of training.

reviews.author: Benny Wong
reviews.comment_content: Very basic calculus. People who have studied M2 will find the content easy but the questions in mid-term and final exam can be challenging.
reviews.comment_teaching: The notes of Albert Ku are hand-written and he just pointed out some main formulae and key points instead of giving full explanation. His notes are just basics and not enough for mid-term and exam. When doing revision, better to find some more organised notes.
reviews.comment_grading: I think you can get B-/C+ when you're around mean
reviews.comment_workload: Just have to complete Webwork nearly every week and most of the questions are simple and straight-forward.

reviews.author: ZhangFangzhou
reviews.title: Fundamental math course
reviews.comment_content: This is a fundamental math course and is compulsory for year-one students, unless you've taken some alike courses before. The content is about basic calculus knowledge.
reviews.comment_teaching: My instructor was from mainland China, and he was energetic and willing to give advice to every individual.
reviews.comment_grading: The grade wasn't too bad, but it may take some effort if you want to get a really good mark.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload of this course isn't large. I spent about one hour a week after class on it and got a satisfactory grade.

reviews.author: hihello
reviews.title: Failed in Fall, Retook in Spring
reviews.comment_content:
As someone who didn't take Math modules in secondary school, I had a difficult time trying to understand the content. The math was quite challenging.

Since attendance was not compulsory, I found it hard to drag myself to a class that I found so boring.

There were:
- online quizzes as HW which you should do well in because they do make a difference in your grade
- midterm
- final
reviews.comment_teaching:
Prof Ku was very dull- so much that I only went to lecture once or twice.

Prof Chiang was much better, more dynamic. He would give interesting examples of how the calculus was applied in real life. His passion about Math was very evident and contagious. He also told his personal story about how we sucked at math until uni and he was suddenly top of his game.
reviews.comment_grading:
In Fall, since there were so many mainland students in my class, as well as Math geniuses who took M1 or M2, they raised the mean tremendously. There were many students who received near perfect results.

In Spring, my class was mostly made up of students who had failed the first time and were retaking the course. It was much less competitive. Got a C-.
reviews.comment_workload:
Not much workload to be honest. The online quizzes (around 10 of them in a semester), midterm and final are manageable.

But if you want a really good grade, e.g. B or A, you will have to work A LOT. Way more than what is required. You will need to self-study and practise as many sums as you can.

reviews.author: Alex Cheng
reviews.comment_content:
Basic calculus, mainly on differentiation.
You will find it too easy if you have studied calculus before.
The cotent is useful and rich. teach in details.a nice teacher.good grade,easily get a+.weekly homework.
little and easy.
reviews.comment_teaching: good teacher, content well explain, will answer to students' question patiently
reviews.comment_grading:
quite good
The grading reflects how much you work on this course
reviews.comment_workload: Webwork is the only piece of work we need to do and submit.But if you want to get a good grade,you should do more exercise after class.If you attend lessons accordingly, the homework is easy to handle

reviews.author: Aden
reviews.comment_content: Content is easy. it is all fundamental mathematic theories. for example, the fundamental theory of differentiation.
reviews.comment_teaching: Professor Chow's teaching is absolutely unclear so that i can't even get anything from his course. actually, even i went to all his lectures, i didn't pay attention to his course. it is enough if you only do the practice problems.
reviews.comment_grading: Grading is by curve, and you can get a good grade if only you learned it carefully.
reviews.comment_workload: As we have already learned in high school, the workload is really light.

reviews.comment_content:
中學M2會學過關於微積分既野
mainly about diffrentiation

powerpoint 都幾清晰
都睇得明

M2 同mainland 屈曬機
自己本身讀M1

final 55%

webwork midterm and final
midterm and final same format
MC and LQ

reviews.author: Leo Lui
reviews.comment_content:
基本上係中學DSE Math M2的內容, 中學有學習過m1或者m2嘅話就輕鬆,有讀m2所以上堂冇咩聽書同埋走堂都跟得上(利申DSE M2 5*),跟唔到進度嘅話睇返notes都ok.
btw, 好似有人DSE M2攞5**, Math 攞5** 之後Belowmean.
reviews.comment_teaching: professor講野都ok, 不過對讀過m1 m2嘅同學嚟講好似有啲同重複,自己睇notes都得.
reviews.comment_grading:
記得不太清楚,好似做齊功課(webwork),考midterm過around 0.75SD, final過around ==>B+
個grade ok,考試above mean 0.5SD, 做曬功課就應該有B

Workload唔大, 同Phy1112一樣,每星期有一份Webwork但都幾容易做

考試嘅話個人認為做多啲唔同年代嘅考試卷就可以攞到高分.

reviews.author: JOEMUI
reviews.title: Introductory to maths
reviews.comment_content:
The content is sufficient to understand the basic knowledge.

Week 01:
1.1 Review of functions,
1.2 Representing functions,
1.3 Inverse, exponential and logarithmic functions
Week 02:
1.4 Trigonometric functions and their inverses,
2.1 The idea of limits,
2.2 Definitions of limits
Week 03:
2.3 Techniques for computing limits,
2.4 Infinite limits,
2.5 Limits at infinity, 2.6 Continuity
Week 04:
3.1 Introducing the derivatives,
3.2 Rules of differentiation
Week 05:
3.2 Rules of differentiation,
3.3 The product and quotient rules,
3.4 Derivatives of trigonometric functions,
3.5 Derivatives as rates of change,
3.6 The chain rule
Week 06:
3.7 Implicit differentiation,
3.8 Derivatives of logarithmic and exponential functions,
3.9 Derivatives of inverse trigonometric functions
Week 07:
3.10 Related rates,
4.1 Maxima and minima
Week 08:
4.2 What derivatives tell us,
4.3 Graphing functions,
4.4 Optimization problems
Week 09:
4.5 Linear approximation and differentials,
4.6 Mean value theorem,
4.7 L'Hopital's rule
Week 10:
4.8 Newton's method (*),
4.9 Antiderivatives
Week 11:
5.1 Approximating areas under curves,
5.2 Definite integrals
Week 12:
5.3 Fundamental theorem of calculus,
5.4 Working with integrals
Week 13:
5.5 Substitution rule,
Review (if there is time available)
reviews.comment_teaching: Professors use quite a number of graphs to illustrate his teaching.

reviews.author: Joe Yiu
reviews.comment_content:
Basic M2 stuff.
At the beginning of the course,it includes some knowledge you learned in secondary school like integration.
Basically,most of the year 1 students are required to take this course.
reviews.comment_teaching: Professor Fong is the best professor in my year 1 study.He will provide his own materials and powerpoint and his teaching can cater for all levels of students.
reviews.comment_grading: This math course is the nightmare for most of the students.Although you may learn the math knowledge before, the midterm and final,especially the mc question ,can be difficult even though you have revised it.Remember,you are not allowed to take the calculator with you.So,try not to depend it too much while you are doing your homework.
reviews.comment_workload:
Every week,you will receive webwork questions(~10 question/time).It helps you review what you have learned in every lesson.
You may be very busy before midterm and final.

reviews.comment_workload:
webbbbbworkkkkkkkkkk
完全唔識做 本身搵人做最後去msc 搵ta教我做
次次都要坐起碼3粒鐘
仲要好似每兩個禮拜有一份？
好煩

reviews.author: ckf98
reviews.comment_content: I only studied M1 in hkdse and i found this course really hard for me. But if you can manage to do all the webwork by yourself, you won't fail midterm or the final exam. The exam questions are very similar to webwork and past papers. Must do past papers!!!
reviews.comment_teaching: Although I think the professor has a heart in teaching, it was teally hard for me to understand his steps....cannot catch up with his flow. Even TA teaches poorly. You really have to ask for help from senior students or other classmates in order to survive this course.
reviews.comment_grading: I failed my midterm exam (2X/100), but I studied really hard for the final and got 6X/100=> thanks god I passed the course at the end and got a C.
reviews.comment_workload: Lectures and tutorial classes are optional, only have webwork; but the webworks are quite difficult. Sometimes have to try many times in order to obtain the correct answer.

reviews.author: Florence Huang
reviews.comment_content:
content was okay.
started with numbers, trigonometry, differentiation & the applications, integrals, etc. Lecture notes were pretty good, but you must listen to what prof is saying as well so you get the detailed version.
but I just personally don't like calculus.
reviews.comment_teaching:
really bad. Pronunciation is not clear. Make me feel bored all the time. Don't catch anything what prof is saying. I had to sit in other instructor's classes. He teaches just the basic but when it comes to exams. It was super super hard.

Present in class = Absent in class. I didn't learn anything in class, I just spent more time reading the notes and doing exercises outside of the class.
reviews.comment_grading:
can't say much because I got really bad score in math 1013.
Make sure that you got the final answer correct, some questions won't allow partial credits. so it's full score or 0. I got really bad score on midterm and final, 47 and 54. Finally got a C.

Mean was C+
reviews.comment_workload: Just homework. Not that bad. It helps you learn for the exams. But the exams are nothing like the webwork. way worsee.

reviews.author: yoyo
reviews.comment_content: simple calculas in your university life which is some basic knowledge you must know,and the content is similar as the textbook in your secondary school , and the course is similar as math1012 but harder
reviews.comment_teaching: since i have absent too many lesson in fall seem ,so i won't give too much idea about the teaching :P
reviews.comment_grading:
i think the grading is quite bad since i only got b- when i got a mean score in this course,
which 75% in final(55%
64% in mid term(33%
98% in webwork(12%

finally i got b-
reviews.comment_workload: only webwork once a week ,but not very hard since you can try not limit

reviews.author: jaydench
reviews.comment_content: The content is similar to Dse M2 but more detailed. The topics are related to calculus. There is no attendance requirement and project. People who have studied M2 may find it easy to follow while M1 student will find it more difficult.
reviews.comment_teaching: The teaching is quite good. The professor explains different topics with several examples. The delivery is clear and fluent.
reviews.comment_grading: The grading scheme is mid -term(33%), webwork(12%),final(55%).
reviews.comment_workload: There is online assessment. You have to finish webwork almost once a week. No reading is required. The workload is not high but many effort is needed in understanding the concepts.

reviews.author: Sharken
reviews.comment_content: 好多都係COVER M2既野，有讀M2好大優勢，相反，讀M1有D灰，教到TRIGO個陣會有D難FOLLOW UP。
reviews.comment_teaching: PROFESSOR D英文都算係咁，叫做幾易聽得明，同埋都係跟NOTES D EXAMPLE教咁濟，如果係勁既話，自己睇完D NOTES唔駛上堂都得
reviews.comment_grading: 一個MID TERM 一個FINAL,FINAL佔5成左右，MID TERM 3成幾，WEBWORK就佔靜低個D，兩次個MEAN都係60-70左右
reviews.comment_workload: 靜係每星期都要做WEBWORK，都算輕鬆，UNLIMITED TRY，慢慢做做到岩為止。

reviews.author: hsycindy
reviews.comment_content: TOO HARD for students without previous M2 background since the whole M2 syllabus plus some level-up knowledge are gone through within 3 month lecture. But this course is very advantageous for students who possess previous calculas knowledge
reviews.comment_teaching: Fair. Probably he is just explaining the theories but i guess situation is similar among every lecturer
reviews.comment_grading: Definitely not a good-grade course. The mean grade is around c+ or b-.
reviews.comment_workload: There are both mid term exam and final exam, and on top of it, the heavy workload with homework every week makes life harder.

reviews.author: wwongad
reviews.comment_content: The content was good. But there were a lot of theorem that I need to remember
reviews.comment_teaching: How he delivered the content of this course was not clear at all. And he couldn't handle the class situation
reviews.comment_grading: The grading system was a bit harsh for me, because I felt that I only made a small mistake in the calculation but he and the TAs crossed it out and give small marks.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload was fair enough. And the difficulties of the homework or the tutorial papers were good enough to prepare us for the exams.

reviews.author: Victoria
reviews.comment_content: You need to really focus on the lectures to be able to understand. Of course, you already have the basics of calculus from high school, but trust me, once you see the mid term--it's really different. However, I enjoy learning math so this is actually one of my favorite course lol
reviews.comment_teaching: Professor is great and is willing to help out each student. After explaining the materials he usually gives a few exercises and looks around the class to make sure that the students are able to do the exercises. His power point is also very clear.
reviews.comment_grading:
Grading overall is a bit harsh, though.

Homework: 12%--easy, everyone usually gets 100% unless they missed the deadline
Midterm: 33%--tougher than the finals (I think), got around mean (actually 3 points below, but doesn't really matter as SD is around 15)
Final: 55% (relatively easier, and the mean is freaking high for maths. I got around mean+ ~0.7SD).

I got a B in the end.

This term's mean is really high compared to previous years', but judging from the past papers, our paper is relatively easier.
reviews.comment_workload: Workload is light but exams are pretty difficult.

reviews.author: venska
reviews.comment_content: There are 5 chapters on basic calculus, including functions, limits, differentiation, applications of differentiation, and basic integration.
reviews.comment_teaching: Teaching materials are taught in an organized and elaborate manner. The professor gave specific lecture notes that helps a lot for the course. He begins each class with a PRS question, which I think helps to make students aware of frequent mistakes. He will also spend time to go through your questions, especially during the paper check so that you know your mistakes.
reviews.comment_grading: The grading will be taken from Webwork (12%), 1 Midterm (33%), and Final (55%). The past papers might give you an image of the midterm and final.
reviews.comment_workload: Webwork every few weeks

reviews.author: Thomas
reviews.comment_content: only 40% is in DSE M2, 60% are totally new knowledge. If you study  M1, you need a lot of effort to catch up. Before mid-term is quite simple, but final is really hard.
reviews.comment_teaching: The prof. taught really well, he has some great notes on web page, that will strength your understanding. I will take some time to go through them if I miss the class.
reviews.comment_grading: Even you study hard, you need luck to score high grade.
reviews.comment_workload: There is only around ten webwork for the whole sem. You won't spend more than an hour to finish it. Super easy.

reviews.author: Rubbish
reviews.title: 讀過M2有優勢
reviews.comment_content:
內容大部分DSE M2內容
integration,differentiation同埋function個D
如果DSE讀過M2好快可以上手
reviews.comment_teaching:
手寫note，上堂都係講返份note
份NOTE幾簡潔
講英文聽得明
reviews.comment_grading:
唔好 因為加埋D NDS入黎1013
個mean拉到幾高下
mid term同final above mean都係得B
reviews.comment_workload:
間唔中有web work
其實冇咩野要做

reviews.author: Bohr
reviews.title: M2野
reviews.comment_content:
可以話係m2既加長版 (rigorous d)
一開頭學少少基本野(function, domain, co-domain)
到中間學m2版differentiation再加d新野(left,right handed limit..)
最尾會學d basic integration (Riemann sum, fundamental theorem of calculus, power rule,.....)

Suggestion: Learn AL Pure Maths and try to do their past paper
reviews.comment_teaching:
佢教得好清晰 d concept都講得好清楚

本人建議一定要去tutorial 做下d ex 咁樣先知你係咪了解清楚個concept/topic
reviews.comment_grading: Grade: Normal
reviews.comment_workload: Webwork

reviews.author: Erickwan0330
reviews.comment_content:
Calculas入門班 本身有讀M2會輕鬆D Prof用手寫notes 簡單易明(雖然走哂堂)
但因為分開左1012 1013, 得M1/2既人係到困獸鬥, Mean 高好正常
主要講番basic calculas(去到普通interagtion+少少application)
reviews.comment_teaching:
Prof用手寫notes 簡單易明(雖然走哂堂) 個人認為比較悶所以過左
add drop就完全冇上

Tutor最好試多Ｄ　搵個岩自己既上
reviews.comment_grading:
mid term +1sd
Final +1.2sd
webwork做齊
Grade:A-(around 85%)
reviews.comment_workload:
一堆Webwork 緊記要做
另外都做下書既題目(有助理解D therorem)(中學應該甚少有教)

reviews.author: Charlie Chan
reviews.title: Trol
reviews.comment_content: Content is overlapping with M2
reviews.comment_teaching: Teaching is rubbish. Unclear explanation, non-m2 student will dunno what the instructor talking about.
reviews.comment_grading: Really large C range, you will never get a B+ if you fall between -1sd to 1sd, that mean you need to work hard in this course to get a good grade, if you are lazy student, just assume you get a C or less.
reviews.comment_workload: Only webwork no workload, but the practise for the exam is important, because a lot of sucks will do every year past paper and make your grade very low.

reviews.author: ahaha
reviews.comment_content: 今年分開1012同1013，將D冇讀m12的人同有讀既分開左，變左M1人易墊底。課程內容主要講limit同calculus，仲有D theorem，主要考concept，同dse M2內容相似，唔難明。隔一星期左右會出一份homework上網做，睇返lecture notes黎做就唔難做。
reviews.comment_teaching: 照lecture notes讀，但份notes係prof.自己寫，佢會up上canvas，可以走堂
reviews.comment_grading: midterm,final踩mean B-
reviews.comment_workload: workload唔太大，每份homework 起碼比個幾禮拜你做，無限attempt，做錯左都可以繼續試。

reviews.author: AloneJoseph
reviews.title: A course that the grade can be saved by final exam
reviews.comment_content: the content is quiet easy for those who have studied M2 in the HKDSE. It includes mostly M2 stuffs but more details on theories.
reviews.comment_teaching: Bad. I had attended the first two lessons and then decided to skip all the rest. After a month( before the mid term), i felt scared and decided to attend again. I went once again, and i didn't attend anymore afterward. People who got good grade in HKDSE M2 can skip all lessons.( like myself)
reviews.comment_grading:
homework didn't get 100 percent.
mid term= +0.31 s.d.
final exam= +1.36 s.d.
overall= +1.00 s.d.
A-
It's quite good, i thought.
I was frustrated after knowing my mid term score (61/100). i then decided to give up getting a good grade in this course. At the night before the final exam day, i do the past paper once. It is difficult for me to get those answer when i was doing and i turn out understanding the answers instead of trying to figure them all out by myself. Finally, the final exam paper is 90 percent the same as the past paper. the past paper is extremely helpful and must be finished studying before the examination.
reviews.comment_workload:
Not much. Around ten short questions every week.
It is easy to be coped with if you have studied M2 before.( Of course with a good grade in M2)

reviews.author: Spaceship
reviews.comment_content: Highly duplicative of the M2 syllabus, with only a few new theorems and the "omnipotent" L'Hospital Rule, but otherwise useful and a good revision.
reviews.comment_teaching: A very friendly professor. He always encourages students to try a few problems during his lectures and invite some to present the solutions. He takes rigorous definitions of mathematical terms quite seriously, which is helpful for "clearing concepts". Even so, skipping lectures is suggested because his teaching is best suited for students w/o calculus backgrounds.
reviews.comment_grading:
Reasonable grading (but not great of course).
Since students w/o calculus backgrounds can now enroll in math1003/1012 instead, the grading should be worse than before, especially when facing NDS (who almost always achieve top scores).
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is not that much tbh--only 9 webworks in total. Doing extra math problems before exams is recommended to avoid bad results.

reviews.author: Tin Hei
reviews.title: 爛grade course一個
reviews.comment_content:
calculus入門班 5個chapters
1. Functions
2. Limits
3. Differentiation
4. Applications of differentiation
5. Basic integration
大部分DSE M1/M2都學過 M1大約6至7成已經識 M2大約學左8成

我就讀M1既 覺得都算易handle
reviews.comment_teaching:
Fong Tsz Ho第一年係到教 但就教得好好 堂堂有worksheet做 教得幾好幾易明. 佢d lecture notes係彩色又整齊 溫起書都有心機d. 佢會擺哂所有material同埋lecture videos上canvas 所以走堂都唔洗驚. 同埋佢係香港人 又後生 幾幽默 同我地d思想幾close下 係幾有heart既professor

Tutorial係Dave 算教得幾好 清concepts好好 Dave
reviews.comment_grading:
12% Webwork (記得due date前做)
33% Midterm
55% Final exam

因為今年分開左1012同1013 加上有班屈機既mainland係到 所以應該仲爛grade過之前

My score:
Midterm: 65/100 (mean: ~59 sd: ~8) (詳細數字唔記得)
Final: 84/100 (mean: 73.73, sd: 15.6)
Total score ~80% 都係得B
Mean應該係C/C+
reviews.comment_workload:
一星期一份webwork total有9份 唔算多野做 不過有d webwork題目好tricky 要用多少少時間做
如果有聽開書 midterm final前做下數都應該唔難有mean

reviews.author: SmallPotato
reviews.title: 自求多福既數學"入門"科
reviews.comment_content:
其實主要係M2學過既野 再加幾個theory咁
M1係會吃虧小小 因為M1微積分部分冇教得咁深入,就冇cover入呢個課程 但始終考試係集中考概念野 所以未至於有大差距
reviews.comment_teaching:
pre-reg抽到呢個就自求多福啦, 伏到喊 教非所考 英文水平又有很大很大的進步空間 考完midterm後既堂基本已經有一半人走堂 因為真係難吸收到知識之餘 又未必係考試會考既野 未去到out c 既, 相比其他lecture同tutorial 就係out focus咁 notes又係好耐以前冇update過既 總之係教得1999

我最後係走曬佢堂 去sit足第2個lecture 真係頂佢唔順
reviews.comment_grading:
成個course拉grade
mean應該係 c+, 其中midterm既mean ~=50%
final既mean ~=70%

功課12% midterm33% final 55%
reviews.comment_workload:
功課唔多既 都係網上webwork 算係功課既入門題目
好心一題 唔好打算溫webwork功課當溫書咁考試 因為考既根本就唔同既方向
考試考既係概念 唔比用計算機的 所以最重要都係溫好concept.

reviews.author: Kiu
reviews.comment_content: should be some basic calculus and its compulsory for M1 and M2 students. i think students with weak math basis can ask their friends to teach them or go to math support center
reviews.comment_teaching: many people skip lessons so its better to have self study. I have attended lessons for the first month but i didn't understand the content so i have self study for the remaining time. i think students with weak math basis can ask their friends to teach them or go to math support center it will be more useful
reviews.comment_grading:
grading is very bad. M1 students will get bad grade easily as there are many mainland students, students from engineering and those who study m2.Final will be easier than mid-term
mid term 33%
final 55%
webwork 12%
reviews.comment_workload: one webwork ex per week. it is quite annoying to do it every week

reviews.author: fooldic
reviews.comment_content: This course is quite easy if you have studied m2 before, only a few principles and theorems are to be remembered for MT/final, so picking up should be easy for m2 students while for m1 students, they may feel difficult as they hadn't studied much about topics in 1013 during secondary schools.
reviews.comment_teaching: He will teach a lot of examples in class to demonstrate how to apply different theorems, but I think in general the examples are too easy compared to MT or final, so it really depends on yourself to do the exercises in the book.
reviews.comment_grading:
Overall grading is quite bad, mean = C-C+
1.5 SD = B+
2 SD = A range
reviews.comment_workload: workload is very small, just 9 webworks throughout the whole semester, you can always ask TA to help you solve them.

reviews.author: Alv8n

reviews.comment_content:
呢個SEM係retake既（上個sem fail左）。

reviews.comment_teaching:
一個字悶

呢個prof既powerpoint係多同埋亂到你唔知點入手好

reviews.comment_grading: 我比較hea讀，爛grade真係無得講
reviews.comment_workload:

每個禮拜一份WEBWORK，
重要比起lecture上面教既野更加難

reviews.author: 無名氏

reviews.author: firegod
reviews.title: 點讀都死
reviews.comment_content:
其實我唔明點解我會讀咗呢科，明明係中學係讀core only，數學勁廢，不過就要讀一個有9成都係 M2 既 calculus 教過哂嘅course，唔fail都算謝天謝地...

我讀個年係好似有個1003，如果我知話自己廢就有得讀1003唔洗讀1013我點都會，無奈係add drop後先知... 所以預咗比人屈機，不過冇諗過伏到喊。

呢個course自稱係calculus 入門course，所有野都好淺，不過我真係feel唔到limit、d in 數有咩咁易，讀咗兩次都唔會了解。最恐怖係spring midterm問 "what is limit" 我o嘴o到傻咗？？？你到底想我學calculus黎做咩... 同埋考試唔比用 calc 機我入去真係得個坐字。

Anyway，calculus好似係有用嘅，不過個人問題算啦...
reviews.comment_teaching:
教書真係好悶，個人教野教到跳線，notes又勁難理解，冇可能catch up到
上完堂都冇任何得著，所以fall上咗幾次就放棄

地球最不幸係spring retake都係佢，個時真心想死，不過點都有試下，好似好咗少少，不過都係0得著，當去坐下lor

如果reg到佢就call friend求救啦...
reviews.comment_grading:
基本上一定爛grade，不過睇下有幾爛
本身數學好勁／M2好勁既人 可能有b range
MAINLAND就會好好GRADE？？
冇讀過就算啦，唔好彩就F架啦，so easy （唔知關唔關我個killer事）

spring就輕鬆"D"，就係咁簡單 lol
reviews.comment_workload:
每星期都做WEBWORK
正常係唔會識做，不過你實會識有人幫你做，不過自己唔做到時gg
不過WEBWORK明顯難過考嘅野好多，所以都係算啦lol

reviews.author: cheungkiki621
reviews.title: Ok
reviews.comment_content:
同m2差唔多，要好努力，唔好走堂。咁最後都會有好成績。學嘅內容同m2差唔多，Week 01: 1.1 Review of functions, 1.2 Representing functions, 1.3 Inverse, exponential and logarithmic functions

Week 02: 1.4 Trigonometric functions and their inverses, 2.1 The idea of limits, 2.2 Definitions of limits

Week 03: 2.3 Techniques for computing limits, 2.4 Infinite limits, 2.5 Limits at infinity, 2.6 Continuity

Week 04: 3.1 Introducing the derivatives, 3.2 Rules of differentiation

Week 05: 3.2 Rules of differentiation, 3.3 The product and quotient rules, 3.4 Derivatives of trigonometric functions, 3.5 Derivatives as rates of change, 3.6 The chain rule

Week 06: 3.7 Implicit differentiation, 3.8 Derivatives of logarithmic and exponential functions, 3.9 Derivatives of inverse trigonometric functions

Week 07: 3.10 Related rates, 4.1 Maxima and minima

Week 08: 4.2 What derivatives tell us, 4.3 Graphing functions, 4.4 Optimization problems

Week 09: 4.5 Linear approximation and differentials, 4.6 Mean value theorem, 4.7 L'Hopital's rule

Week 10: 4.8 Newton's method (*), 4.9 Antiderivatives

Week 11: 5.1 Approximating areas under curves, 5.2 Definite integrals

Week 12: 5.3 Fundamental theorem of calculus, 5.4 Working with integrals

Week 13: 5.5 Substitution rule, Review (if there is time available)

reviews.author: M&A
reviews.comment_content: Mostly covered in HKDSE M2, but pay more attention to some concepts like limits, fundamental theorem of calculus and Riemann sum. The content of this course might be a bit hard for M1 students, especially for implicit differentiation, trigonometric identities, as well as the differentiation and integration of trigonometric functions.
reviews.comment_teaching:
I attended all the lessons in real-time before the mid-term exam. After the mid-term exam, I skipped most of the lessons. Besides, I skipped most of the tutorials. However, I did watch the lecture/tutorial videos on the same day as they were conducted to make sure that I would be able to catch up with the progress.
The content he mentioned during lectures were easy in general, but he spent so much time explaining those easy concepts and I felt like he made simple things complicated most of the time, which might confuse students. Despite this, he was nice and willing to answer students’ questions.
reviews.comment_grading:
Assignments: 10%
Mid-term: 35%
Final exam: 55%

You got unlimited attempts for the assignments so make sure you spare enough time to finish them and get all of them correct.
You only have to finish 10 mc questions within one hour for the mid-term exam. The most challenging part would be the concept of limits, so you may want to put more effort in this topic.
For the final exam, you have to finish 18 mc questions and 3 long questions within 3 hours. Each mc question worths 3 marks while each long question worths around 14-16 marks.
People say that the grade of this course is determined on an absolute basis but I asked my professor about the grading mechanism and he said our grades were determined on a relative basis. Anyway, work hard to secure a satisfactory grade.
For your reference, I got full marks in all assignments and the mid-term exam. However, I screwed up in the final exam and I only got 86/100. My overall score was 92.3/100 and I got an A at last. I knew that if I had not lost any mark in the 7-mark question about Riemann sum in the final exam, I must have got an A+. But yeah this might be a punishment for my disrespectful act of skipping lectures and tutorials, and that’s why I have to pay the price. Therefore, do make sure that you understand every concept before you sit for the exams.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is light. There were a total of 8 assignments and you get plenty of time to finish each of them. However, beware of the deadlines as the professor/TA wouldn’t tell you when the deadlines were.

reviews.author: Ahzzzz
reviews.title: Just Don't Screw Up Your Midterm
reviews.comment_content:
From the perspective of a DSE M1 student:

Actually when compare with M2 students, the major disadvantage of M1 students involve in limit. Limit is the most important part for midterm and M2 students are more exposed to it. For trigonometry, though it is a new topic for us, there are not much questions involve in complicated trigonometry during midterm and final. Just understand and recite the basic of trigonometry then you should be fine. After the midterm, the difference between a M1 students and M2 students is limited.

If you will like to have more practices on the content, e-book with questions and answers should be provided in the Classviva system. HOWEVER, IF YOU WILL LIKE TO EXCEL IN EXAM, doing past papers is important. If you cannot find answers for the past papers, you can do them with your friends and cross-check with them.
reviews.comment_teaching:
If you are registered to her course, I wish you good luck and highly suggest you to go for other professor's lectures if you will like to have a teacher to guide you through.
Although most of the professors are just PowerPoint readers, she is the more outstanding one. She has such a strong accent that you can barely understand what she is saying and she will sigh every 30 seconds during the lecture. At the finally lesson, no more than 20 people (120 in total) are attending her class.
reviews.comment_grading:
Assignment(10%): Full for this part
Midterm(35%): 40/100 mean = 55.6
Final(55%): 81/100 mean = 65.57

grade: B-

Because I screw up midterm, I can only get a B-, or else the grade should be much better and I can get a dean list. :((
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is relatively not heavy. Only 8 Classviva assignments are required with unlimited attempts.

reviews.author: ypl
reviews.title: M1噩夢
reviews.comment_content:
1 Number and intervals, inequalities and absolutes, functions and graphs, composite functions, exponential functions
2 Trigonometric functions, inverse functions, logarithmic functions, inverse trigonometric functions
3 Tangent and velocity, the limit of a function, limit laws.
4 Continuity, limits at infinity and horizontal asymptotes, derivatives and rates of change
5 Basic derivatives, product and quotient rules, derivatives of trigonometric functions
6 Chain rule, implicit differentiation, derivatives of inverse trigonometric functions and  logarithmic functions
7 Rates of change problems, related rates
8 Linear approximations and differentials, maximum and minimum values.
9 Mean Value Theorem, derivatives and graphs, L’Hôpital’s rule.
10 Curve sketching, optimization problems, Newton’s Method
11 Antiderivatives, areas and distances
12 Definite integrals, the Fundamental Theorem of Calculus.
13 Applications of integrals, the substitution rule

reviews.author: jath
reviews.comment_content:
As an ex-M2 student in secondary school, plus I am good at maths (5 in compulsory part, 5* in M2 in the DSE), the content is extremely easy.

Topics:
1. Function definitions, sets, domains, basic function types, inverse functions
2. Limit easy, advanced definitions, limit evaluation, intermediate value theorem
3. First Principles, Differentiation rules (includes product rule, quotient rule, chain rule), differentiation of inverse functions, implicit differentiation, applications of differentiation (finding rates using chain rule, first derivative test for finding extrema)
4. Linear approximation, Newton's Method
5. Local, Global Extrema and relevant theorems (including extreme value theorem), critical points, mean value theorem, tonicity (including monotonicity), concavity, first and second derivative tests, curve sketching
6. Riemann Sums (left, right, midpoint), definition of definite integral, fundamental theorem of calculus, indefinite integration definition, area between two curves, integration methods (substitution. including trigonometric substitution)

If you have studied M2, this course would be easy for you as most content is covered in M2 (except for some topics like Newton's method), but in a more in depth mode, including some theorem names e.g. extreme value theorem. If your maths is good, even better. But if your maths sucks and/or you haven't studied M2 and M1, you should think twice before taking this course as the topics covered in one to two years in M2 shrink to a semester in this course, so expect things to be quick.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Ok.

For the lectures, Professor Chang taught things quite clearly and the pace was not too fast. Lecture ipad drawings are released after the lecture. He has a slight mainland accent but I was still able to hear clearly what he meant (but if you so fear accents, you can choose another instructor). His teaching was good. He was willing to answer different questions.

For the tutorials, I attended those held by Mengjie Fang. content in the lectures was repeated, but taught in much less detail. Examples were the main focus of tutorials. Sometimes after the due dates of the homework, she would explain the homework solutions. The tutorials are a bit boring if you are good at maths. So if you attend them, focus on the most useful parts: 1. practicing questions provided, and 2. ask questions about things you don't understand (although most of the times I didn't have to)
reviews.comment_grading:
Homework 25%
Final Exam 75%

Homework can be repeatedly done for infinitely many times, and each time you have finished, following is a report of which answers you have correctly/wrongly answered. So you should repeat each piece until you get full mark.

For the final exam, it is easy if you are so good at maths. If you are not as bright, you can do past papers (get them from seniors). Analyze the commonly asked topics and train yourself until you can master them (e.g. evaluating a limit by turning it into a definite integral, find the value of a constant such that two curves can be connected at a point and combine into one continuous/differentiable curve)

I missed one homework and scored full marks for all other pieces of homework, and in the final exam (all mc), I did one question wrong out of about thirty to forty questions. Final grade: A

I should not have missed that piece of homework.
reviews.comment_workload: Light workload. One or two pieces of homework a month, each to be completed in one or two hours if you are good at maths. Of course it would be a different story for those who suck at maths. No midterm, no quizzes, so the only time you would need to do revision is before the final exam.

reviews.comment_content:
Arc length, surface area, integration by disk, integration with shells, should be a natural extension to things in 1013

Improper integrals and other integration techniques, ie. how to integrate sqrt(x^2 +5) dx (hint: use trig identities)

Polar coordinates and integration

Infinite sequences and series, sums of said series, divergence and convergence tests (HIGHLY recommend you study up on these and know which test to apply)

Maclaurin and Taylor series for functions (recommend writing the polynomial, trig and log functions you are used to seeing in Taylor series form as practice)

Ends with a short section on vectors - understanding cross and dot product, projections, and distances from points to plane, etc.

Calculus. Half DSE-M2 stuff, half new things. Good luck if you are M1.
Here's a list(not complete) of non-M2 stuffs in this course:
Continuity, Differentiability, Intermediate Value Theorem, Mean Value Theorem, 'one-to-one' function, Solving problems with absolute functions, Sandwich(Squeeze) Theorem, Linear Approximation, Newton's Method, Critical Point, Rolle's Theorem, L'Hopital Rule, Reimann Sum, Fundamental Theorem of Calculus(A little more things than DSE M2)
reviews.comment_teaching:
Dr. Lam's English is clear, and he is willing to answer student's questions. However, his writes on the whiteboard in a less organised way, so it's not easy to follow. The teaching pace is slow, and he put too much time on explaining the fundamental knowledge that both M1 and M2 and even DSE Maths core should have covered, especially functions... He should have put more efforts on new topics such as L'Hopital Rule and more...

Mr. Kong's tutorial is better, at least he can demonstrate the examples clearly and remind us some important steps/tips in solving problems.

I think attending tutorial is more important than attending lecture. I skip most lectures that teaches M2 stuff.

reviews.comment_workload:
Homework: Basically 1 WebWork(Online homework) per week, each consists of 10-18 questions. Apart from the first one you will need 2-4 hours to finish one, not very heavy workload. You can attempt questions infinitely many times , so try your best to get full marks in them!
No attendance required for any lecture and tutorials
Exam: Do your best in the relatively simple mid-term to secure a better grade earlier. All contents will appear in final exam, so don't forget to practice on evaluating limits for the final. I focused too much on integration and didn't do a single question of limits before the final, so I lose at least 9 marks on some relatively simple limit MCs, sigh~~
By Alpha703 on Dec 25, 2016 13 of 13 people found this helpful. 0

reviews.author: ZhuKexin
reviews.title: easy content, hard to be perfect and get A+
reviews.comment_content:
Course descriptionThis is an introductory course in one-variable calculus, the first in the Calculus I and II sequence, designed for students that have taken HKDSE Mathematics Extended Module M1/M2. Topics include functionsand  their limits, continuity, derivativesand  rules  of  differentiation, applications of derivatives, and basic integral calculus.Credit points:3Prerequisite:Level 3 or abovein HKDSE Mathematics Extended Module M1/M2Exclusions:AL Pure Mathematics or Applied Mathematics, MATH1003, MATH1012, MATH1014, MATH1018,  MATH1020, MATH1023, MATH1024, any MATH course at or above 100-/2000-level5.Intended learning outcomesUpon successful completion of this course, students should be able to1.Develop basic computational skills in calculus.2.Express quantitative relationships using the language of functions.3.Apply the concepts and methods of calculus in modeling and problem solving.
MATH1013 Calculus IBCourse OutlineL7 (Fall 2017)Page 2of 26.Assessment scheme9WeBWorKAssignments15%(accessible via http://webwork.math.ust.hk/)Extra Problem Sets0%Midterm Exam35%(Sunday, October 22, 2017)Final Exam50%Calculators will not be allowedin the midterm and final exams.Provisionalgrading scale: F< 40% < D < 50% < C’s < 70% < B’s < 85% < A’s7.Student learning resourcesLecture note by the instructor(Course website: https://canvas.ust.hk/courses/13667)Reference text:J. Stewart, CalculusEarly Transcendentals(Metric version, 8th edition), Cengage Learning.8.Tentative course scheduleWeekDatesTopicsTextbook sections1Sep 5, Sep 7Naïve set theoryAppendix A2Sep 12, Sep 14Functions and graphs§1, Appendix DElementary functions3Sep 19, Sep 21Limit of a function§2.1–2.34Sep 26, Sep 28Limits at infinity, infinite limits§2.6Continuity§2.55Oct 3Derivatives§2.7 –2.8Basic rules of differentiation§3.1 –3.36Oct 10, Oct 12Techniques of differentiation§3.4–3.67Oct 17, Oct 19Ratesof change§3.7–3.98Oct 24, Oct 26Linear approximations, differentials§3.10Newton’s method§4.8Maximum and minimumof functions§4.19Oct 31, Nov 2Optimization§4.7Mean Value Theorem§4.2ľHôpital’s rule§4.410Nov 7, Nov 9Curve sketching§4.3, 4.5, 4.611Nov 14, Nov 16Antiderivatives§4.9Riemann sums,definite integrals§5.1, 5.212Nov 21, Nov 23The Fundamental Theorem of Calculus§5.3Techniques of integration§5.4, 5.513Nov 28, Nov 30Final review
reviews.comment_teaching:
I skip all his class and decide to learn by myself.
I think he is a nice teacher but not very good at teaching.
reviews.comment_grading:
got full marks in miderm.
but didn't do well in final.

almost A+ but actually A

students from mainland should be able to get above A. but still need some efforts
reviews.comment_workload: light. but you should make sure that your homework get full marks.

reviews.author: Yu012120
reviews.comment_content: M1 M2 stuff mostly M2 though
reviews.comment_teaching: Great. Swapped to this class at add/drop and found that he is way better at explaining the concepts than the other professor that i attended.
reviews.comment_grading: Absolute grading. I got 5* in DSE M1 and A- in this math course. My final score is 86.xx It seems to have a better grade for M2 student given that the content is mostly M2 stuff. According to professor Lam, the cutoff score is not integer as stated and getting 90 would be an A.
reviews.comment_workload: I would say it is moderate as it is M1 student can followed up without much difficulty much less M2 student.

reviews.author: Kit9973
reviews.comment_content:
Week 01:
1.1 Review of functions,
1.2 Representing functions,
1.3 Inverse, exponential and logarithmic functions
Week 02:
1.4 Trigonometric functions and their inverses,
2.1 The idea of limits,
2.2 Definitions of limits
Week 03:
2.3 Techniques for computing limits,
2.4 Infinite limits,
2.5 Limits at infinity, 2.6 Continuity
Week 04:
3.1 Introducing the derivatives,
3.2 Rules of differentiation
Week 05:
3.2 Rules of differentiation,
3.3 The product and quotient rules,
3.4 Derivatives of trigonometric functions,
3.5 Derivatives as rates of change,
3.6 The chain rule
Week 06:
3.7 Implicit differentiation,
3.8 Derivatives of logarithmic and exponential functions,
3.9 Derivatives of inverse trigonometric functions
Week 07:
3.10 Related rates,
4.1 Maxima and minima
Week 08:
4.2 What derivatives tell us,
4.3 Graphing functions,
4.4 Optimization problems
Week 09:
4.5 Linear approximation and differentials,
4.6 Mean value theorem,
4.7 L'Hopital's rule
Week 10:
4.8 Newton's method (*),
4.9 Antiderivatives
Week 11:
5.1 Approximating areas under curves,
5.2 Definite integrals
Week 12:
5.3 Fundamental theorem of calculus,
5.4 Working with integrals
Week 13:
5.5 Substitution rule
reviews.comment_teaching: Actually, I did not attend all lecture and tutorials.
reviews.comment_grading:
In midterm and final, about 5%   mark is about prove, mostly is computation. If you deeply understand the content of this course, getting A-range is not difficult, but A+ need more careful than your knowledge.
my result: overall 92/100->A
reviews.comment_workload: it is not heavy. almost 0.5-1 hr to complete each webwork for me.

reviews.author: heremandy
reviews.title: MATH 1013
reviews.comment_content:
80% HKDSE M2 content

Week one: Thursday (Sep 1)
• Numbers, inequalities and absolute values (Appendix A)
• Coordinate Geometry and Lines
• Basic functions and graphs, composite functions (1.1, 1.2, 1.3)
• Exponential functions (1.5)
Week two: Monday (Sep 12) (Holidays: Sep 16)
• Trigonometric functions (Appendix D)
• Inverse functions, logarithmic functions and inverse trigonometric functions (1.6, Appendix D)
Week three: Monday (Sep 19)
• Tangent and velocity (2.1)
• The limit of a function, limit laws (2.2, 2.3)
Week four: Monday (Sep 26)
• Continuity (2.5)
• Limits at infinity and horizontal asymptotes (2.6)
• Derivatives and rates of change (2.7)
Week five: Monday (Oct 3) 
• Basic derivatives (2.8, 3.1)
• Product and quotient rules (3.2)
• Derivatives of trigonometic functions (3.3)
• Chain rule (3.4)
Week six: Monday (Oct 10) (Holidays Oct 10)
• Implicit differentiation, derivatives of inverse trigonometric functions and logarithmic functions (3.5, 3.6)
Week seven: Monday (Oct 17)
• Rates of change problems (3.7, 3.8)
• Related Rates. (3.9)
Midterm Exam: 10:15-11:45, Oct 23 (Sunday)
Week eight: Monday (Oct 24)
• Linear approximations and differentials (3.10)
• Newton's method (4.8)
• Maximum and minimum values (4.1)
Week nine: Monday (Oct 31)
• Mean Value Theorem (4.2)
• Derivatives and the shape of a graph (4.3)
• L'Hopital's rule (4.4)
Week ten: Monday (Nov 7)
• Curve sketching (4.5, 4.6)
• Optimization problems (4.7)
Week eleven: Monday (Nov 14)
• Anti-derivatives (4.9)
• Areas and distances (5.1)
• Definite integrals (5.2)
Week twelve: Monday (Nov 21)
• The Fundamental Theorem of Calculus (5.3)
• Indefinite integrals and net change (5.4)
Week thirteen: Monday (Nov 28)
• Substitution rule (5.5)
reviews.comment_teaching:
Professor is boring
The tutor is good and has a quiz with us.
We may visit the Math Support Center at Room 3011-3013 for help.
reviews.comment_grading:
Absolute grading.

Homework 15%                                                                   Midterm Exam 35%                                                                   Final Exam 50%                                       
       
Grade Scale
100% ≥ A+/A/A- ≥ 85%,
85% > B+/B/B- ≥ 70%,
70% > C+/C/C- ≥ 50%
50% > D ≥ 40%
40%> F

Getting a A- or above is easy for those who studied M2 in DSE
reviews.comment_workload: Only 1 webwork per week, very light workload

reviews.author: jouyangaa
reviews.comment_content: R 曬各tutor d practice嚟做先喺靚grade做法,個個tutor都喺悶.
reviews.comment_teaching: 上堂模式有d似tutorial,喺咁教example,簡單嘢教得OK,難嗰d就教到1999,自己上去佢個math網站睇notes仲好,佢上堂寫d notes都會擺上嗰個網所以5使自己抄,講嘢幾悶,不過math都喺咁咖啦.

reviews.author: Clay
reviews.title: Repost
reviews.comment_content: Calculus. Half DSE-M2 stuff, half new things. Good luck if you are M1. Here's a list(not complete) of non-M2 stuffs in this course: Continuity, Differentiability, Intermediate Value Theorem, Mean Value Theorem, 'one-to-one' function, Solving problems with absolute functions, Sandwich(Squeeze) Theorem, Linear Approximation, Newton's Method, Critical Point, Rolle's Theorem, L'Hopital Rule, Reimann Sum, Fundamental Theorem of Calculus(A little more things than DSE M2)
reviews.comment_teaching: Dr. Lam's English is clear, and he is willing to answer student's questions. However, his writes on the whiteboard in a less organised way, so it's not easy to follow. The teaching pace is slow, and he put too much time on explaining the fundamental knowledge that both M1 and M2 and even DSE Maths core should have covered, especially functions... He should have put more efforts on new topics such as L'Hopital Rule and more...
reviews.comment_grading: Semi-absolute grading. Much fairer than previous semesters. 15% WebWork 35% Mid-term 50% Final Total score  85-100%-->A range 70-85%-->B range 50-70%-->C range 40-50%-->D 0-40%-->Fail
reviews.comment_workload:
Homework: Basically 1 WebWork(Online homework) per week, each consists of 10-18 questions. Apart from the first one you will need 2-4 hours to finish one, not very heavy workload. You can attempt questions infinitely many times , so try your best to get full marks in them!
No attendance required for any lecture and tutorials
Exam: Do your best in the relatively simple mid-term to secure a better grade earlier. All contents will appear in final exam, so don't forget to practice on evaluating limits for the final. I focused too much on integration and didn't do a single question of limits before the final, so I lose at least 9 marks on some relatively simple limit MCs, sigh~~

reviews.author: kaminohokyu
reviews.comment_content: easy if hv study m2 in secondary school,only few things is new to you,but more question required answer include proof, but not all calculation
reviews.comment_teaching: poor teaching,usually cant listen well wt the teacher say.actually no need attend lesson because ppt can be found online.
reviews.comment_grading: grading is fair ,above mean makes me get b-
reviews.comment_workload: no workload,only midterm and final,but practise more really can make u a better grade.  Do pastpaper before exam is a must,because questions may be the same . source can be found on peter gao.

reviews.author: Cromvale
reviews.comment_content: Not very tough if you finished IB HL Maths. If one is good enough at studying to join HKUST, the content should not be very challenging. However, it is quite tough when it gets to MATH1014.
reviews.comment_teaching: Although the content is not very difficult, the teaching ability of the professor was not very good. Possibly because math concepts are hard to recognize at once due to its nature.
reviews.comment_grading: Quite average. If you get the average, you would probably end up getting C+ or B-.
reviews.comment_workload: Due to the weekly assignment, the workload is quite high

reviews.author: _ry
reviews.comment_content:
A bit different from HKDSE M2
Course Description:
1. functions and graphs
2. limits of functions and continuity
3. derivatives and their applications
4. basic indefinite and definite integrals


Some say that M1 didn't help much.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Lessons were absolutely boring.
She only went through notes once on classes without little further explanation. She talked very softly and pronunciation was a bit weird, I could hardly listen.
No attendance recorded
No iPRS
Tutorials were quite useful, and if you have any questions, you may also ask the tutor after class personally.
reviews.comment_grading:
Absolute grading:
85%+: A+/A/A-
70%+: B+/B/B-
50%+: C+/C/C-
40%+: D
40%-: F

Got a B+ (studied M2 in DSE)
reviews.comment_workload:
Assessment scheme:
homework: 15% (webwork)
Midterm 35%
Final 50%

For the webwork, you can actually visit math support center and tutors would always guide you to complete your assignment, so you can easily fully take the 15% in this way.

For exams, we had a midterm practice and final practice respectively, question types in exams were somehow the same as practice. If concepts are clear and you had studied the question types in practice papers, it would be fine.

reviews.author: Herman1031
reviews.comment_content:
Mainly about secondary syllabus with some extra topics.
Not so easy for those who didnt get a good result in m1/m2 in HKDSE
reviews.comment_teaching: Lam tsz kin is a good professor as he draws graphs and explains the concept very clearly
reviews.comment_grading: Absoulute grading implying that it is harder to get a better grade if you are not hardworking enough
reviews.comment_workload: Only webwork is required but it can be difficult for those who didn't study well in HKDSE since most of the topics in math 1013 are about secondary calculus. Better revise frequently to understand the concept

reviews.author: Angela Tsui
reviews.comment_content: Basic DSE M2 Stuff with little new stuff. Easy to understand if you attend the tutorials and read through all the ppt.
reviews.comment_teaching: Explained tonnes of examples during lesson, but not much in teaching solving skills. And also useless notes. Tutorials are good though.
reviews.comment_grading: Skipped all the lessons, taken DSE M2 before, didn't finish several WebWork. Mid-term and final exmaination >50%. Got a C at the end.
reviews.comment_workload: Almost weekly WebWork. Everyone have their unique WebWork question but they are similar, you can take reference from your peers' WebWork answer or you can google it. Most of the questions are 'google-able'.

reviews.author: hahayeah
reviews.comment_content: if you have studied M2 in secondary school and had got good grade in DSE, you are quite likely to be ensured that you can get at lease B range in math1013.If you are M1 student like me, you should pay more effort on attending the lessons and do more exercises. Don't skip the tutorials when you met a bad lecturer like mine.
reviews.comment_teaching: All in all, I do not recommend Dr Ye as a good choice as her mainland accent is a bit hard to be understood. But she won't count attendance so if you have confidence in your exam performance, just ignore her lectures and do exercises instead.
reviews.comment_grading: It is absolute grading for 2016-17 fall semester, I would like to recommend u to pay more effort on midterm so as to pull your grade up as the final exam will be much more difficult.
reviews.comment_workload: My lectures and tutorials do not count attendance and only webwork need you to pay effort on. It don't really have a heavy workload if you do not aim high on this course.

reviews.author: ZHUYUXIANG
reviews.comment_content: the content is quiet easy in my view and it just covers what you have learnt in high school. there is no need to spend more time on this for an engineering student .
reviews.comment_teaching: the instructor is quiet humorous. sometime he may  makes a funny mistake deliberately.  he always try to use some example which is familiar to us to introduce what he want to teach.
reviews.comment_grading: very good. A+ is easy.
reviews.comment_workload: workload is very very small, you just need to finish what is put on website.   for tutorial , there is no extra exercise but if you think you need more exercises, go to the math department.

reviews.author: Gerald W. Liu
reviews.title: Not so hard
reviews.comment_content:
Most of the content is taught in secondary school, so it's a very easy course. The materials are well-prepared, especially the tutorial notes. The textbook is not required at all.
Attendance is not required. In fact, I only attended two lectures (the first one and the last one) and the last two tutorials. If you have already learned the content before, the lectures won't help you a lot.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Judging by the two lectures I attended, I think the teaching was easy to understand. The professor is very patient with students. By the way, he always replied my email in two minutes, which is really nice!
The tutorials are known to be very helpful, so please attend them. The teaching assistant can answer a lot of questions after the tutorials. If you don't want to attend anyway, please print those tutorials notes by yourself and do the exercises, or you will deeply regret it in the exam.
reviews.comment_grading:
15% for Homework, 35% for Midterm, 50% for Final. It seems that you need 95% Total to get an A+.
Midterm mean: 72.59  SD: 16.94
Final mean: 63.91  SD: 15.49
Total mean: 71.39  SD: 13.51
100% ≥ A+/A/A- ≥ 85%, > B+/B/B- ≥ 70%, > C+/C/C- ≥ 50% > D ≥ 40% > F
reviews.comment_workload:
The workload is very light. There are 9 sets of homework on WeBWorK, each one takes about an hour on average. You have unlimited attempts, so it's easy to get 100% as long as you never give up. It is said that the Math Support Center at Room 3011-3013 is very helpful.
One more thing, no matter how easy you think the course is, please take it seriously. If you don't make any effort, your grades will definitely disappoint you.

reviews.author: CLL
reviews.comment_content: 最主要都係中學M2野，係多左o的theory同method
reviews.comment_teaching: 由於成日走堂，不便評論，但係個professor講英文有少少口音
reviews.comment_grading:
今年用absolute grade
85分或以上有A range
70-84分有B range，有friend 69.X都有B-，mean大約70，所以grade同以前比唔算差
reviews.comment_workload: 每個星期有一份webwork做，唔識可以去Math support center或者用online calculator都得，除此之外都冇乜野做，加上大部分內容都學過，workload算輕鬆

reviews.author: michael_teng
reviews.comment_content:
Content

The comtent covers the most important parts of the book. From corporation itself to its investing and financing. The class also includes a tutorial, whose schedule is decided in The first one or two weeks. My schedule totally conflicted with all its tutorials, even the later added one. So I have never been to one. But I think it's ok since the tutorial slides are very easy.


Teaching

Well, what you learnt in class is just NOT ENOUGH! You have no idea what is going to be in the exam! For example, the first part about corporation is covered too little, but it was highly required in the exam!



Grading

10% participation(9% PRS 1% bonus card)
15% homework 9out of 10
30% midterm
45%final
I scored about 87% in total and got a B＋... pretty disappointed. But as I said before, the class is full of experts, so you just can't expect a good grade.


Workload

A bit of heavy I think. The homework is just s

Topics include functions and their limits, continuity, derivatives and rules of differentiation, applications of derivatives, and basic integral calculus.
The exam paper seems to be a little bit easier than before
