This is an introductory course in one-variable calculus, the first in the Calculus I and II sequence, designed for students that have taken HKDSE Mathematics Extended Module M1/M2. Topics include functions and their limits, continuity, derivatives and rules of differentiation, applications of derivatives, and basic integral calculus.
Better than nothing
reviews.comment_grading:
This is an introductory course in one-variable calculus, the first in the Calculus I and II sequence, designed for students that have taken HKDSE Mathematics Extended Module M1/M2. Topics include functions and their limits, continuity, derivatives and rules of differentiation, applications of derivatives, and basic integral calculus.

reviews.comment_workload:
This is an introductory course in one-variable calculus, the first in the Calculus I and II sequence, designed for students that have taken HKDSE Mathematics Extended Module M1/M2. Topics include functions and their limits, continuity, derivatives and rules of differentiation, applications of derivatives, and basic integral calculus.
Not much, remember to do all webworks

reviews.author: AnsonTing
reviews.title: Good course
reviews.comment_content: The content is a bit easy for university level. It covers a lot of high school knowledge.The principles are however very useful.
reviews.comment_teaching: The teaching is simple but easily understandable. The Professor is very nice. The class is very relaxing. In lectures, there is no attendance taken so you can go to the class freely.
reviews.comment_grading: Reading this class means you can easily get a high grade, since the content is easy and simple, and the lecture is also good and easily understandable.
reviews.comment_workload: There is nearly no assignments for this class.

reviews.author: Carl
reviews.comment_content:
Simple basic M2 stuff with deeper explanation. It won't be hard if you have studied M2 before.
1. Functions
2. Limit
3. Differentiation
4. Introduction to Integral
reviews.comment_teaching:
Frederick is a funny person. He makes jokes about the politics. Not boring at all.
He has his own notes provided which is easy to read and understand.
Interactive lectures with the use of iPad as "whiteboard" which makes the content easy to understand.
reviews.comment_grading: A range is not hard if you performed OK in both mid-term and final exam.
reviews.comment_workload: Webwork every week. Simple questions if you have listened to lectures.

reviews.author: JackyChung
reviews.comment_content: Most of them are covered in M2 in DSE. To get good grades, you need to utilise the questions provided in the textbook and most importantly, past papers.
reviews.comment_teaching: Lectures are basically useless and you have to go to tutorials to learn again and get exercises. You will see more question types in tutorial class.
reviews.comment_grading: Need to compete with science and engineering students, who in general have more mathematical intelligence. Business students can still get good grades if enough effort have been paid.
reviews.comment_workload: There are online assignments with unlimited trials (not sure if I remembered correctly). Mid-term and final exams could be difficult.

reviews.author: SL
reviews.comment_content:
The topics were not too difficult to understand as most of it are based on the HKDSE M2 sylllabus if you have studied M2.
The topics are:
limits, differentiation, applications of differentiation, and basic integration.
However, the questions that appear in the midterm and final are not as easy as the webwork or examples on the lecture notes.
reviews.comment_teaching: His English is not fluent enough, but ok for you to understand it. His explanation is very clear, but you may find his teaching a bit slow and the exmples in the lecture notes are too easy.
reviews.comment_grading:
The distribution is about like this:
Webwork 12%
Midterm 33%
Final 55%

The grading is quite poor because the mean is quite high and the grading is curved.
reviews.comment_workload:
Online assignemnt (WebWork) once a week
Midterm exam
Final exam

reviews.author: legendarychriz
reviews.title: Average course
reviews.comment_content:
This course is learning what you have learnt in secondary schools.
Excel in high school maths see this course as heaven but other see this course as a purgatory.
reviews.comment_teaching:
For Prof.Zhu, despite his accents he is able to explain the concepts in math, and will always encourage us to think and sometime he will call someone to show how to solve the math problem.
For Prof.Ku, his lessons are more boring, and so there were less people attending his course. He is just saying about his notes, ignore his speech and just go through his notes, you will be fine, since his notes are quite good.
reviews.comment_grading:
Mid term 33%
Final exam: 45%
WEBWORK: 12% (99.9% of student get a full mark since there are unlimited tries, and the amount is low)
BBA students always moan about the engineering students and science students have made the course difficult. I am an engnerring student and i find this offensive. I get beloe 1.5 sd in mid term ,which proves that BBA students can be better than engineering students, so don't blame engineering students and science students anymore! It's all about hard work ( and depends on what you get in DSE M2)!
M2 5**or 5*: Go kill yourself if you can't get A range in this course and please go to MATH 1023, you guys are the ones who make the mean of this course relatively high.
M2 5: Work harder and have a chance to grab A- or A
M2 4: Work harder to get a B+
M2 3: Work harder to get a B range
M2 2 or lower or M1 students: Good luck.

Need to get good results in both mid term and final to secure a B-.

Mid term below 1.5 sd
Final above mean ~0.5 sd
Still C+

Oh boy.
reviews.comment_workload:
M2 5**-5*: Just go through what you have learnt in secondary school and it will be fine
M2 5: Do some math if you are free, you don't have to put a lot of time in it,  go for other courses.
M2 4: Work harder
M2 3: Work much harder
M2 2 or lower or M1 students: Good luck.

Just kidding, all of you should work hard.
And Submit WEBWORK on time, 99.9% of students will finish it

reviews.author: t
reviews.comment_content:
DSE 讀m1，所以覺得好難跟得上prof 講咩，

reviews.author: aejonathan
reviews.comment_content: It covers the basic of calculus. It's not that much different from high school math.
reviews.comment_teaching: The teaching is really good and the pace is just right. However, it can be a bit too slow for those who are good in calculus
reviews.comment_grading: The grading is not so good compared to other courses in HKUST.
reviews.comment_workload: There is not too much workload. There are 9 webworks, 1 midterm and 1 final. However, do not expect the midterm and final to be similar with webworks. In order to get a satisfactory grade, we need to do a lot of exercises.

reviews.author: Kenneth Lee
reviews.title: Hard but interesting
reviews.comment_content: Fundamentals of calculus, review of your highschool Math, but a lot harder.
reviews.comment_teaching: I really like professor Zhu, I think he cares about the student and teaches enthusiasticly.
reviews.comment_grading: I think the grading for math department is quite hard. Additionally in my class the mean is really high so its quite hard to get a good score. Expect c+ if you only get the mean.
reviews.comment_workload: webwork every week, not too hard. But its not enough for the exams because the exams are a lot harder. I suggest to practice a lot.

reviews.author: 无书
reviews.title: Maybe good.
reviews.comment_content: The content is simple in the first half part but difficult in the last part.Some students might have learned some parts in high school.So I think you may find it easy to follow the pace at first.
reviews.comment_teaching: He is very friendly and always encourages students to do presentation in class to show the solution of math problems.
reviews.comment_grading: The grading is good.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is not heavy.Webwork is the only piece of work we need to do and submit.But if you want to get a good grade,you should do more exercise after class.

reviews.author: V.lylit
reviews.comment_content:
It's either M2 stuff (if you're in HKDSE) or basic math (if you learnt it before) or unknown stuff. I don't have anything else to say really.

PS M2, in full Maths (extended module 2), entails algebra and calculus.
reviews.comment_teaching:
A class of 100 or so ended up with only 10 or 20 people coming to class. I am very proud to be one of them who went to almost every lecture... I think that says enough about what other people thinks of the class.

As I took M2 before, I did not find the course extremely difficult.  What I found rather repelling is the instructor's horridly rude reaction when my friend asked him a question - "why don't you go get a M2 book?" WELL, if my friend took M2 before, would she have to ask you? (For that I decline to expose the instructor's name)

There are tutorials as well, but I only went to the first session because the classwork there seems to be quite easy (at least for me). I do recommend you go to the tutorials if you don't seem to get what your instructor said in class.
reviews.comment_grading:
Theoretically its grading is fair because you get score for how correct your answers are.  It becoems less fair-looking because of the math geniuses and all the people who took related math courses in high school.  
For a good grade, you need to have a strong calculus basis, carefulness (while taking the exam - duh), and some luck.  For strong calculus basis, either take related math courses in high school or get some help from your friends who did so.  No matter what though, you still have to do lots of practice.
reviews.comment_workload: You have a midterm, a final exam and some assignments on workweb (or a platform with similar name).  Workload could be huge if you don't have strong base and somehow have decided to tackle it on your own.  My advice is to get some friends to help you out, and then do lots of exercise <-- this increases the workload too...

reviews.author: Christian_Chow

mainly 4 parts
functions  and models (types of function and definition of models)
limits and derivatives
differentiation (rules and application)

very slow and boring lecture
reviews.comment_grading:
mid term 79/100
final 56/100
outcome B-
reviews.comment_workload:
Acceptable amount of workload
Weekly Webwork

My advice is to always finish the assignment as soon as possible and then do as many exercise as possible. Don't rush studying all the content in the course syllabus in the first month!  assignment > exercise > reading textbook

reviews.author: 热爱科学的猪
reviews.title: FF is God!
reviews.comment_content:
The L1 section is specially designed for future Math major students as said by FF. Apart from the contents in other sections, the L1 section focuses more on logic.

Here are the four chapters:
Ch1: Preliminaries
Ch2: Limit of Functions
Ch3: Differentiations 1
Ch4: Differentiations 2

As you can see, the teaching progress of the L1 section is much slower than the other sections so if you want to take this section, you have to take the Math 1014 L1 section in Spring. So better think twice before the Add and Drop period is closed.

Assignments:
There are 10 weekly problem sets. HW9 and HW10 are not collected and graded.
reviews.comment_teaching:
FF's teaching is perfect! He has a great sense of humor so his class is quite fun actually. Also he is always ready to answer anyone's questions.

Professor A0 will never fail you, trust me.
reviews.comment_grading:
The grading is pretty fair.

Score Formula:
Scheme1:
HW 20% Midterm 40% Final 40%
Scheme2:
HW 20% Midterm 5% Final 70%

Letter Grades:(copied word by word from FF's Syllabus)
"Try to aim at getting a total of 85% or above for A-/A/A+, and about 60% or above for B-/B/B+, 40% or above for C-/C/C+."

Gradebook:
total 93+ : A+
total 89+ : A
total 82+ : A-
total 72+ : B+
reviews.comment_workload: The wordload is quite light. FF will post the assignments two or three weeks earlier on canvas for you to download it. So you have an adquate amount of time to do the assignments theoretically. The time neede to finish that week's assignment is approximately 1hour.

reviews.author: AlexT
reviews.comment_content: Half of it is the same as the concepts in HKDSE m2. Compared with m2, some more details of some taught in m2 were taught, but they are still quite simple and it should have no problem for students who learnt m2 well to understand the new parts added. Some completely new concepts like Newton method are taught. They are not hard and only occupy some of the course content. In general, the course is not hard for people who learnt m2 well.
reviews.comment_teaching:
English of the lecturer is not perfect but still acceptable and does not hinder my learning much. In general, lecturer presents logic, idea and concept clearly and always try to show the students pitfalls of confusing concepts.
The tutor is willing to answer student's query and very welcomed to student's questions. Despite this, the tutorial mainly is a session about her doing examples. I personally found it not very helpful and only a few attended the tutorial.
reviews.comment_grading:
10 percent for 8 web work hw
Because you can modify for unlimited times, everyone can score a 100 in this part
35 percent for midterm
Very easy only consist of 10 mc and 1 hour is given, and I consider it as very sufficient amount of time.
Though I missed 1 due to carelessness
And only scored 90 out of 100, the mean in this class is only 50 something. I personally think anyone should try to aim a 100 in midterm
Final accounts for 55 percent
19 mc and 3 long questions
Slightly harder than midterm
But still doable if you understand what was taught in lectures
The grade is not yet known but I expect a A range
reviews.comment_workload: Quite light if you have studied m2 well as more than half of the content is the same as m2. Only 8 simple web works which can be re submitted for unlimited times without any penalty to ensure 100 marks. In addition, sufficient time is given for each of these web works.

reviews.comment_content:
Mostly dse m2 stuff, if you did well in dse and don't want to study the on9 honour course, this is the best place to wash grade.
Course content(copied from another review lol)
1
Number and intervals, inequalities and absolutes, functions and graphs, composite functions, exponential functions.
2
Trigonometric functions, inverse functions, logarithmic functions, inverse trigonometric functions.
3
Tangent and velocity, the limit of a function, limit laws.
4
Continuity, limits at infinity and horizontal asymptotes, derivatives and rates of change.
5
Basic derivatives, product and quotient rules, derivatives of trigonometric functions.
6
Chain rule, implicit differentiation, derivatives of inverse trigonometric functions and logarithmic functions.
7
Rates of change problems, related rates.
8
Linear approximations and differentials, maximum and minimum values.
9
Mean Value Theorem, derivatives and graphs, L’Hôpital’s rule.
10
Curve sketching, optimization problems, Newton’s Method.
11
Antiderivatives, areas and distances.
12
Definite integrals, the Fundamental Theorem of Calculus.
13
Applications of integrals, the substitution rule.
reviews.comment_teaching: Prof Chang is from Taiwan, the accent is fair but not very good tho. I'd say the explanation is not bad, but one of the observation is that a 120 ppl lecture ended up having 40-50 ppl attending.
reviews.comment_grading:
Absolute grading
Total score
85-100%-->A range
70-85%-->B range
50-70%-->C range
40-50%-->D
0-40%-->Fail

25% hw (classviva)
75% final(all mcq)

Got full score in hw, 24/25 in final, total 97/100, A+
I got 5** in core maths and m2 in dse but don't want to study on9 1023 so came here wash grade. However, for normal local m1/2 students, the absolute grade is a nightmare. Be careful doing every mcq as one question=one grade.

Very light, no mt, only 8 online hw, due 1 month after releasing.
Try to ask for resources and do the past papers before the final exam and you'll be good. Ask questions in wtapp group if you need help. If you don't have one, form one.

reviews.author: rind
reviews.comment_content:
This course is designed for those students who have studied M1 or M2 in secondary school.
Here is just a brief syllabus:
Intervals and absolute value
Functions (odd, even, *inverse)
Limits
Trigonometry
Differentiation (first principle and equation of tangent)
Related rates
Graph plotting (asymptotes, critical points, point of inflexion, absolute max/min)
Newton's method
Mean Value Theorem
Intermediate Value theorem
Tangent approximation
Anti-derivative and definite Integral
Fundamental Theorem of Calculus
*L'hopital Rule
*Reimann Sum
Those topics with stars are those I think is quite difficult compare to the other topics.

As a M2 student, I think many of them have been taught in DSE syllabus except those I put a star on and the theorems. I do think the theorem are quite intuitive and easy to understand. So not a big problem.
reviews.comment_teaching:
I highly recommend Phyllis. The best tutor so far in UST course I have studied. In tutorial lessons, she will give us her notes and we will go through all the questions. Her notes is simple but extremely easy to understand. The most important thing is that these practices include the questions from past paper and she has arranged the question in a very smart way. After learning the theorem, you do the first question. Just apply the theorem is ok. However, the next question is usually sightly different from the previous one and most of us cannot finish it by just the same method. That's the trap students usually fall into when they are doing exam which makes the concept more clear. IN THE MIDTERM EXAM, AT LEAST HALF of the questions are similar to those in the tutorial notes. Phyllis is nice too and she can speak fluent English which hardly can be found in Math course. I have sent a email to her about her website is not working and she replied me within 30mins together with the soft copy of tutorial notes. I hope she teaches 1014...but seems she is not.

Prof. Lam is a very good professor in Math1013. Clear hand writing, fluent English and clear explanations make him the best. Highly recommend to sit his class. Remember to arrive the classroom earlier because you may not get a seat if you are too late.

LTK is teaching you to prove the theorems and definitions of them. Phyllis is to teach you how to apply them. One of the problems of Math1013 is that, if the theorem is proved in lectures. You should know how to use it but Professor won't teach you. So attending to Phyllis's tutorial is a must.
reviews.comment_grading:
Grading System:
15% homework (8 sets of homework, each 100)
35% midterm
50% final
Should be absolute grading

My scores:
Homework: 800/800
Midterm: 100/100
Final: 90/100
Overall: 95/100 A+

The midterm as I have said, most of the questions are similar with the tutorial notes (those MCQs that try to trap you) and past papers. Easy to get full mark if you pay attention to something basic.

The final change to online exam. Since it is open-book exam, they don't exam things like tangent approximation or Newton's method because you just simply substitute into the formula and things are done. Instead they examine something quite difficult, the exam is 2 hour long to finish 20 MC questions. The exam is proctored so suppose no one can cheat. The difficulty is extremely high compare to past exams. Mean is about 60.
reviews.comment_workload:
8 sets of homework, basically you have to spend 1-2 hours to finish it. You can have infinite number of attempts so make sure you get full marks for all homework.
Basically no workload since many of the syllabus has been taught in DSE.
No attendance for both tutorials and lectures, but I still attend LTK's lectures since there is still something important things being taught or prove in lessons.

There is no workload for me, if you have studied M2 in secondary school then Math1013 should not be a big problem.

reviews.comment_content: The course material is really easy. I basically learned  everything in this course in my high school.

The miodterm is super easy and the final is much more difficult.
i finally got 90/100 in midterm and 91/100 in final.

Moreover, this course is using absolute grading, which means that as long as you can get overall 85%, you would get into the A range.

reviews.author: etkf
reviews.comment_content:
Basic calculus, mainly on differentiation.
You will find it too easy if you have studied calculus before.
reviews.comment_teaching:
The accent of the professor is really annoying, although the teaching is alright.
If you have taken M2 or you are good at math, skipping lesson is highly recommended.
reviews.comment_grading: The grading reflects how much you work on this course, for both type of students with or without M1/2 background from HKDSE.
reviews.comment_workload: Only 2 exams, and weekly webwork. The problems are not very difficult, but sometimes can be very time consuming! So do not wait until the last minute to start working on it.

reviews.author: SZT
reviews.comment_content: it's easy and we don't need to practice too much and get a good grade. I think watching some review videos on youtube is enough to handle most questions in exams.
reviews.comment_teaching: fantastic notes provided by instructors, so though the instructor. We can actually skip the lectures and watch the notes on Canvas.
reviews.comment_grading: I get 90/100 in the midterm, 100/100 in the final, a full mark in HW and get an A+ successfully. Though there exist some uncontrollable points, I think getting an A range is still not difficult.
reviews.comment_workload: Nearly nothing and the HW is easy.

reviews.author: uxgl7
reviews.title: easy course
reviews.comment_content:
Topics include functions and graphs, limits of functions and continuity,derivatives and their applications, basic indefinite  and definite integrals.
To be honest, I think the content is not quite difficult. For students who have strong interests in math, maybe MATH 1023 is more suitable for you.
reviews.comment_teaching: Professor Wang is a nice and kind instructor. Her pronunciation is clear and lecture rhythm is appropriate. What's more, I like her notes because they are well-structured which play a significant role in my midterm and final review.
reviews.comment_grading:
Homework 10%
Midterm 35% (10 MC questions)
final  50%  ( about 20 MC questions and 3 long questions)
My grade:
Homework: 100/100
Midterm:90/100
Final:100/100
Overall:96.5%  A+
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is not heavy. You have to finish 8 homework during the whole semester and each homework has about 15 questions.You can try to do it many times.The instructor only considers the highest score.

reviews.author: chens
reviews.comment_content: 如果你學過m2，一切對你來說都很簡單，80%是高中學過的內容...基本看筆記就可以自學，lecture沒有什麼聽的必要。tutorial看遇到的tutor如何。好的tutor早九的課也很多人上，差的教室裡一般空空如也
reviews.comment_teaching: 經常花很長時間去講一些基礎知識點

reviews.author: BayernMunich
reviews.title: Fair
reviews.comment_content:
Fair Very Ver Fair

Calculus. Half DSE-M2 stuff, half new things. Good luck if you are M1.
Here's a list(not complete) of non-M2 stuffs in this course:
Continuity, Differentiability, Intermediate Value Theorem, Mean Value Theorem, 'one-to-one' function, Solving problems with absolute functions, Sandwich(Squeeze) Theorem, Linear Approximation, Newton's Method, Critical Point, Rolle's Theorem, L'Hopital Rule, Reimann Sum, Fundamental Theorem of Calculus(A little more things than DSE M2)
reviews.comment_teaching:
Good
Dr. Lam's English is clear, and he is willing to answer student's questions. However, his writes on the whiteboard in a less organised way, so it's not easy to follow. The teaching pace is slow, and he put too much time on explaining the fundamental knowledge that both M1 and M2 and even DSE Maths core should have covered, especially functions... He should have put more efforts on new topics such as L'Hopital Rule and more...

Mr. Kong's tutorial is better, at least he can demonstrate the examples clearly and remind us some important steps/tips in solving problems.

I think attending tutorial is more important than attending lecture. I skip most lectures that teaches M2 stuff.
reviews.comment_grading: Fair Very Very Fair
reviews.comment_workload:
Low

Homework: Basically 1 WebWork(Online homework) per week, each consists of 10-18 questions. Apart from the first one you will need 2-4 hours to finish one, not very heavy workload. You can attempt questions infinitely many times , so try your best to get full marks in them!
No attendance required for any lecture and tutorials
Exam: Do your best in the relatively simple mid-term to secure a better grade earlier. All contents will appear in final exam, so don't forget to practice on evaluating limits for the final. I focused too much on integration and didn't do a single question of limits before the final, so I lose at least 9 marks on some relatively simple limit MCs, sigh~~

reviews.author: Ethen
reviews.title: 龜好，但不易好龜 Good grading, but not so easy to get good grade
reviews.comment_content:
一些最基礎的函數和微積分知識

Some basic knowledge about functions and calculus
reviews.comment_teaching:
很不錯，語速夠慢，通俗易懂。Tutorial講的也很不錯。

Very good, slow enough to understand. Tutorial is also very good.
reviews.comment_grading:
本人來自中國大陸，經歷過中國高考，不想評價太多，如果你恰好也是這種，你只需要認真作對你會的題目就能拿到A+。

本學期情況是75%final（25題），25%assignment (8個）,
assignment全對的前提下，final錯一個A+，錯兩個A。


75%final（25questions），25%assignment（8）
When you get full mark assignment, you will get A+ if you make one question wrong in the final exam, and A if you make two.

This course will be really easy for students from mainland China, even if they skip lessons. Because most of the contents are taught  in their high school.
reviews.comment_workload:
非常輕鬆，assignment可以無限次提交，直至滿分

Easy to handle, you can redo your assignment indefinitely untill you get full mark.

reviews.author: ambroselin_
reviews.comment_content:
Basic calculus stuff. Easy to handle if you have studied calculus in high school.

Topics covered:

Functions and Graphs of functions
Transformation of Graphs
Limits
Continuity and Differentiability
Basic Differentiation (Trigo and its inverse etc) (Differentiate inverse functions)
Definite and Indefinite Integrals (Substitution rule) ,
Riemann sum  
Extreme Value Theorem, Mean Value Theorem, Intermediate Value Theorem,  Fermat's Theorem  etc
Linear Approximation
Newton's Method
reviews.comment_teaching: A very helpful professor who is really willing to answer student's questions. Explains concepts in great detail. Not really hard to catch up if you haven't studied M1 & M2.
reviews.comment_grading:
25% Assignment
75% Final exam

You can easily secure a full 25% in assignments. The mean for final exams is about 70%. 3 x 45 mins final exam sessions within 3 hrs with about 8 MCs each.
reviews.comment_workload: To be honest the workload is quite light. About 8x homework for the course, so about 1 in every two weeks. Quite easy to handle the homework and you can easily get 100% if you attend the tutorial sessions and do some basic revision. (shoutout to Yue Wu who is my tutorial session instructor, she is very helpful)

reviews.author: Henry0122
reviews.title: easy course
reviews.comment_content:
Topics of the course include:
number and intervals, inequalities and absolutes,
functions and graphs, graph transformations, composite functions,
exponential functions, inverse functions, logarithmic functions,
Trigonometric functions, inverse trigonometric functions.
Tangent and velocity, the limit of a function,
limit laws, continuity, limits at infinity and horizontal asymptotes,
derivatives and rates of change,
basic derivatives, product and quotient rules,
chain rule, derivatives of inverse functions, implicit differentiation,
rates of change and related rates,
linear approximations and differentials, Newton’s Method,
maximum and minimum values, Mean Value Theorem, derivatives and graphs,
L’Hôpital’s rule,
curve sketching, optimization problems.
antiderivatives, areas and distances,
definite integrals, the Fundamental Theorem of Calculus,
applications of definition integrals, the substitution rule.

reviews.author: YuxinTang
reviews.comment_content: The course is not very difficult and teaches about/extrapolates from many concepts already learned in high school, but it still requires adequate time and exercises to achieve high like A+. Besides, some problems are interesting to work on. In a word, a inspiring(might be a bit boring for advanced learners) introductory course.
reviews.comment_teaching: Ms. Ye is a very nice teacher. She has mainland accent but it's generally easy to follow. She gives clear and useful summary of underlying ideas when solving problems. Also, her notes are concise and cover all the concepts and types of problems that'll tested, which are useful for building a basic framework. Though you still have to do some relatively more difficult problems from tutorials or past papers to pratice.        And as she explains all the steps to even simple problems very slowly to ensure that everybody understand, you can skip certain explanations based on your own need.
reviews.comment_grading: absolute grading for grade range: ≥85 A range but detailed grades like A+ will be determined by your position in all the students taking math1013 that term. Easy to get into A range but requires more effort to get A+
reviews.comment_workload: very small. Homeworks are all done on webwork and offer unlimited attempts to try different solutions. You only need  to get your final attempt right. 1midterm+1final

reviews.author: Kevin KAI
reviews.title: A GOOD GRADE COURSE FOR THOSE WHO HAVE STUDIED M2
reviews.comment_content:
The content is easy and not so difficult because most of them have all been taught by your M2 teacher in secondary school.
But there are some new things need to understand. If you aim to get an A or A+, you need to have a deepen understanding of those new things, otherwise you may lose some marks in final exam.
reviews.comment_teaching: The teacher is so good. His lessons are easy to follow. His notes are really good. If you want to learn more, he is really a good choice for you .
reviews.comment_grading:
GOOD GRADE because the grade doesn't depend on your competitors. This is absolute grade.
100% ≥ A+/A/A- ≥ 85%, > B+/B/B- ≥ 70%, > C+/C/C- ≥ 50% > D ≥ 40% > F
The grade depends on homework(15%)+midterm(35%)+final(50%), the grade depends mostly on your final exams. and it's easy to get 100 in homework because you can try again and again to get full marks.
But final exam should be more careful if you want to get a good good grade.
reviews.comment_workload: not so large workload. just homework and homework is not so difficult for you to do.

reviews.author: I Want 1st Hon!
reviews.title: Practises are important!
reviews.comment_content:
If you get star(s) in DSE M2 like me, you probably don't need to do any extra exercises before midterm. Just revise some examples and do the midterm pastpapers, then it is ok.
However, you need to do extra exercises/tutorials after midterm because nearly everything is new.

I just made serious careless mistake in final, 12 marks (4 MC) is deducted because of my carelessness...

I give "B" because it is just too easy for M2 students but I don't think it is fair for M1 students.
Also, many Non local students have learnt it in their high school, e.g. Function... Not fair for local DSE students.

I think non-local students should go to an advanced class since they have learnt most of the content in high school.
reviews.comment_teaching:
He writes his notes on a paper, and uses a visualiser to teach.

His accent is hardly understandable. A lot of people quit his lectures.

He will upload the materials he taught in class. I just read it by myself.

Tutors is very very great! Remember to register Leung Ho Ming and sit in the front! I will give him an "A".

But for Dr. Hu. I will definitely give him "D".

However, I appreciate his effort since I see him nearly everyday in LG3/LG4 Library and work hard on something, maybe teaching or researching.
Maybe he is a great great researcher, but NOT a good teacher. He is nice to answer your questions, even though you still don't understand what he is talking about (accent)...
reviews.comment_grading:
Quite fair. 85% above A range.

- Absolute grading
Midterm (35%): 92/100 (mean: 70.92, SD: 15-17);
Full mark in Webwork: 9/9 (15%)
(TOTALLY NOT USEFUL)
Final (50%): 81/100 (mean: 66.2, SD: 17.53)
Total Mark: 32.2+15+ 40.5 = 87.7
Grade: A- (3.7)
reviews.comment_workload:
Do exercises. Nothing else. Quite normal.
Not necessary to attend tutorials, but I suggest you attend all of Leung Ho Ming's tutorials if you have things that don't understand!

reviews.comment_content:
以前學m2係不停操題目，講兩句concept就開始做，呢個course更加著重概念，內容就唔係難，但最難既一樣野係改變以前既學習模式，從學做題目到學概念 e.g limit definition of differentiation同riemann sum之類

本身個lecture係li dong但係佢真係super fast, assume全世界都識曬咁，上左兩堂就去左sit TK Lam

reviews.author: 日修運動服愛好者
reviews.title: Easy to understand
reviews.comment_content:
Week


1

Number and intervals, inequalities and absolutes, functions and graphs, composite functions, exponential functions.

2

Trigonometric functions, inverse functions, logarithmic functions, inverse trigonometric functions.

3

Tangent and velocity, the limit of a function, limit laws.

4

Continuity, limits at infinity and horizontal asymptotes, derivatives and rates of change.

5

Basic derivatives, product and quotient rules, derivatives of trigonometric functions.

6

Chain rule, implicit differentiation, derivatives of inverse trigonometric functions and logarithmic functions.

7

Rates of change problems, related rates.

8

Linear approximations and differentials, maximum and minimum values.

9

Mean Value Theorem, derivatives and graphs, L’Hôpital’s rule.

10

Curve sketching, optimization problems, Newton’s Method.

11

Antiderivatives, areas and distances.

12

Definite integrals, the Fundamental Theorem of Calculus.

13

Applications of integrals, the substitution rule.
Some of the parts can be skipped if you have studied related math topic on DSE maths or M2,with using your tricks.
However,the teaching speed is a bit slow...
reviews.comment_teaching: Although Mr.Ji comes from Mainland,he is a kind teacher which you will understanding the course even if you got level 3 on M2,you will be satisfied with his teaching that you won't fall asleep in his class

reviews.author: pepe
reviews.comment_content: An easy course, the prof is very nice. I recommend taking this course no matter what. When I get into trouble on my exercise, the tutor are also nice and teach me how to do it.
reviews.comment_teaching: Clear presentation of the prof. Lecture notes are very nice too.
reviews.comment_grading: I got good score in my midterm. The midterm is quite easy if you understand the concept. You do not need to recite a lot. I think everyone can perform well if you are smart.
reviews.comment_workload: satisfactory, exercise are challenging but good to know.

reviews.author: garbage
reviews.comment_content: basic stuff of calculus
reviews.comment_teaching:
Cannot tell because I have attended only 2 lessons.
The notes of T K Lam is extremely useful and the textbook is useful as well because T K would select questions from the textbook and you can practice.
reviews.comment_grading:
15% homework
35% midterm
50% final
I think the grading would be pretty bad because there are people who have studied calculus in high school studying this course instead of going to MATH 1023. They just break the curve.
mid term: mean: 59.74 SD: 20.96
I did pretty bad in the mid term exam, only got 93/100
it seems that getting an A is pretty hard because you have to be very careful in the exam. The paper checking session is cancelled due to the events this semester and I do not even know where I got wrong. The final is moved to the first week of the Spring Semester.
Update:
The format of the final exam is changed into online canvas quiz due to the coronavirus and it consists of multiple choice questions only. The exam is easier than the past since there is sufficient time and the questions are pretty simple but you really need to be careful because 5 points accounts for each of the question.
mean of the final: 66
I personally got 100 for the final.
Overall I got 97.55 for this course and I got an A+. It is really a good grade and simple course.
reviews.comment_workload: Questions in Classviva are pretty dumb. There are 8 assignments in one semester and it takes about 1.5 hours to finish each assignment. You only have to study calculus for like one hour each week. And you would need to mock the past papers given by the professors in order to get an okay grade. The workload is tiny compared to the LANG courses. P.S. I have not learned neither M1 nor M2.
